name: 2019-05-13 05.20.12 2042394447341490345_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Edvard Munch’s ‘sick child’ of 1885, a highlight from the powerful exhibition of his work until July 21st at the British Museum. The title was actually given to 6 of his works executed over a long period (1825-1926). Munch became obsessed with the tragic death of his sister Johanne (pictured left) from Tuberculosis. It is probably her aunt Karen on the right. Strong echoes of Picasso’s Blue Period of the same time and for the visitor to the Tate Britain the pre- raphaelite ‘Too late’ by William Lindsay Lindus’ of 1885. This also deals with premature death from T.B. With the surge of Romanticism and the high mortality rate among middle-aged adults it became known as the ‘romantic disease.’ #bluebadgetouristguide #expressionism #norway #art #painting #edvardmunch #britishmuseum #artexhibitions

name: 2019-06-30 20.23.16 2077638210129183461_britishmuseum.jpg
text: بازوبند طلا با سر قوچ هنر هخامنشىمربوط به گنجينه آمودريا قرن چهارم پيش از ميلادمحل نگهدارى موزه بريتانيا گنجينه جيحون يا آمودريا متشكل از ١٧٠ تكه طلا و نقره ، اشياى باقى مانده از امپراتورى هخامنشى است. مهمترين مجموعه موجود از هنر فلزكارى هخامنشى و نيز ديگرنمادهاى چند فرهنگى اين امپراتورى است. اين گنجينه كه متشكل از دستبند ، بازوبند ، پلاكهاى طلاونقره با نقش برجسته ، ارابه طلايى با چهار اسب و بسيارى اشياء ديگر بين سالهاى 1876تا١٨٨٠ در نيايشگاهى واقع در منطقه تخت قباد در نزديكى رود جيحون(آمودريا نام باستانى آن است )توسط جويندگان گنج كشف شد. در همان سالها يك فرمانده ارتش انگلستان بنام كاپيتان برتون گروهى از بازرگانان را كه در ميانه راه پيشاور توسط راهزنان اسيرشده بودند نجات داد و در پى آن گنجينه نيز هويدا گشت ، كاپيتان برتون بخشى از اين گنجينه را از بازرگانان خريدارى و به موزيم (بريتانيا) انتقال داد. اين گنجينه زمانى كاملتر شد كه سرآگوستوس فرانك مدير موزيم انگليس تكه هايى از آن را از بازارهايى در راولپندى پاكستان و در نقاطى از هند خريدارى و به موزيم انگلستان انتقال داد. طبق گواه كارشناسان هنرى اين مجموعه از با ارزشترين بازمانده هاى هنرى دوران پرشكوه هخامنشيان است. #britishmuseum#گنجينه#هخامنشيان#پارسيان#آمودريا#گنجينه_آمودريا#موزه#تاريخ#تمدن#گالرى#كوروش_بزرگ_هخامنشى#موزه_ميهو#غاركلماكره#گنجينه_فرمانروايان

name: 2019-06-30 20.36.36 2077644916158509662_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ارابه طلايى مربوط به گنجينه جيحون يا آمودريا، از زيباترين و ظريف ترين اشياءاين گنجينه به وزن 75گرمقرن چهارم پيش از ميلاد محل نگهدارى موزيم(بريتانيا)به تازگى دانشمندان براى كشف مدل ساخت اين ارابه با استفاده از اشعه ايكس دريافتند كه اسبها و تنديس ها تو خالى هستند آنها همچنين متوجه شدند كه چرخها با يك سيستم از سيمهاى طلايى كه از ارابه آويزان شده و پشت چرخها پنهان هست به ارابه متصل شده اند. (ورق بزنيد)شرح كامل اين گنجينه در پست قبلى اشاره شده #britishmuseum#گنجينه#گنجينه_آمودريا#هخامنشيان#پارسيان#موزه#تاريخ#تمدن#گالرى#كوروش_بزرگ_هخامنشى#داريوش_بزرگ#غاركلماكره#موزه_ميهو#گنجينه_فرمانروايان

name: 2019-06-30 21.48.42 2077681209680652336_britishmuseum.jpg
text: دستبند يا بازوبند طلايى به شكل شيردال (گريفين)از مجموعه با ارزش جيحون (آمودريا) اين اثر كه عرض آن 11,5و ارتفاع آن 12,8 سانتى متر است يك قطعه مشابه هم دارد كه در موزه ويكتورياآلبرت نگهدارى مى شود. اين دستبند مشابه دستبندهايى است كه به عنوان هديه به تخت جمشيد آورده مى شده و در نگاره هاى تخت جمشيد نيز به تصوير كشيده شده. بخشهاى تو خالى كه در حلقه اين اثر و بالهاى شيردال (گريفين) به چشم مى خورد قبلا با شيشه و سنگهاى گرانبها مزين شده و به مرور زمان كنده شده اند. #britishmuseum#گنجينه#گنجينه_آمودريا#هخامنشيان#پارسيان#كوروش_بزرگ_هخامنشى#داريوش_بزرگ#موزه#گالرى#غاركلماكره#موزه_ميهو#گنجينه_فرمانروايان

text: The Queen Elizabeth II Great Court was opened by Queen Elizabeth II in 2000, beautifully constructed with glass and steel, the roof embraces the largest covered square in Europe. The British Museum is a space dedicated to human history, art and culture in which visitors can discover a wide range of antiques from different cultures and civilizations. You can travel back in time to the Ancient Greek and Rome, Asia, Europe, Egypt, Africa and America among many others. ...#London #londoncityworld#ilovelondon#britishmuseum #picoftheday #pictureoftheday #teampixel #traveldestination #travelbloggerlife #travelblogger #travelguide #portraitphotography #portrait #traveller #wanderlust #Londres #england #instagood #instadaily #tbt

name: 2019-07-30 06.12.20 2098953191927807663_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🇪🇸La Piedra #Rosetta!🇬🇧The Rossetta Stone!🇬🇧👇👇.🇪🇸 Si, estamos frente a este ícono de la #historia de la #humanidad que se encuentra en el #Britishmuseum..🔹Esta piedra permitió descifrar los #jeroglificos #ejipcios..🔹La piedra fue tallada en el año 196a.c. con un edicto del #faraon Ptolomeo V redactado en 3 lenguajes: Jeroglifico, escritura Demótica y Griego Antiguo..🔹Con el tiempo fue usada como material de construcción cerca de la desembocadura del Nilo en Rashid o Rosetta..🔹Los franceses la encontraron en 1799, pero 2 años después, luego de la victoria Britanica en Alejandría, los Británicos la llevaron a donde está hoy en 1802. ..🔹En 1822 Jean-François Champollion logró descifrar el código de los jeroglificos..🔹Estar parado frente a esta piedra, genera una emoción particular, de esas donde parece que el tiempo se detiene y uno quiere que siga detenido.🔹ENTEADA GRATUITA! ... 🇬🇧Yes, we are facing this icon of the history of humanity found in the British Museum.🔹This stone allowed to decipher the ejiptian hieroglyphs.🔹The stone was carved in the year 196a.c.  with an edict of Pharaoh Ptolemy V written in 3 languages: Hieroglyph, Demotic and Ancient Greek writing.🔹 Over time it was used as building material near the mouth of the Nile in Rashid or Rosetta.🔹The French found her in 1799, but 2 years later, after the British victory in Alexandria, the British took her to where she is today in 1802.🔹In 1822 Jean-François Champollion managed to crack the code of the hieroglyphs.🔹 Being standing in front of this stone, generates a particular emotion, of those where it seems that time stands still and one wants it to remain stopped.🔹FREE ENTRANCE! #viajes #viajeros #fotografia #viajerosporelmundo #blogger #londres #london #museos #museums #cultura #culture #culturas #uk #travel #travelers #travellife #wonderfulcities #seetheworld #travelshots  #holidays #vacaciones #viajoxmicuenta #viajopormicuenta

text: يكى از باشكوهترين آثارهخامنشى عصاى منسوب به داريوش بزرگ اين عصاى افسانه اى از معروفترين اشياء گنجينه جيحون(آمودريا)و اشياء ايران باستان است. سده پنجم يا چهارم پيش از ميلاد ساخته شده از طلا و سنگ لاجورد كشف شده در تخت قباد تاجيكستان محل نگهدارى موزه ويكتوريا ، آلبرت لندن #Britishmuseum اين اثر فاخر و غرورانگيز در بين 170 اثر ديگر گنجينه جيحون بود كه توسط كاپيتان برتون جمع آورى و به لندن فرستاده شد ، كه شرح كامل آن در پستهاى قبلى ارائه گرديد. #هخامنشيان#پارسيان#عصا#داريوش_بزرگ#موزه#تاريخ#تمدن#كهن#گنجينه#گنجينه_جيحون#گنجينه_آمودريا#گنجينه_فرمانروايان

Ye second sign is that of Kish and it breaketh down all barriers and openeth ye portals of ye Ultimate Planes. text: K N İ D O S 🏛 Çalıştığımız arazi, yemek yediğimiz sofra, tadını çıkardığımız enfes manzarası ve konumu ve hayatıma kattığı fotoğraflara sığmayan çılgın ve yüreği güzel insanlar. Bu yazı benim için her yönden çok öğretici kıldığı için bu kente büyük teşekkür borcum var. Beni büyüttü bana kocaman bir kalp hediye etti. Arkeoloji adına koca bir adım atmamı sağladı. Kendi mesleğimin farklı yönlerini keşfetmemi ve aşık olduğum bu mesleğe daha da aşkla bağlanmamı sağladı. Hocalarım, şeflerim ve kaldığım süre boyunca tanıştığım kaynaştığım tüm arkadaşlarım hayatımda çok büyük izler bıraktılar. Bu bir veda değil yeni bir başlangıç.Sana kocaman teşekkür ederim KNİDOS 🙏🏻Çünkü Tanrı uzun ve sağlıklı yaşamasını istediği kullarını Datça’ya gönderirmiş! Strabon...

name: 2019-09-21 16.06.34 2137665396702837268_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ Anglo-Saxon Reenactor and History enthusiast Kieran wearing a shirt displaying a design based on pressblech fragments (STH 1423 and STH 1382) dated to the 7th century AD, from the famous Staffordshire Hoard. The shirt's colour scheme was proposed by Kieran to imitate the gold and garnet regalia found on the Staffordshire Hoard finds. The iconography shows warriors marching holding spears and shields, wearing eagle-crested helmets similar to foils found on the Vendel helmets found in Uppland,Sweden.#theatreofwarclothing #thedarkages #englisheritage #britishmuseum #britishhistory #britisharchaeology #anglosaxonperiod #anglosaxon #england🇬🇧 #staffordshirehoard #saxons #britishheritage #darkages

name: 2019-09-21 17.14.38 2137699652764585994_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Edge of the Woods (c.1912).🎨 Painted by Charles Courtney Curran.Born: 13 February 1861, Hartford, United States.Died: 9 November 1942, New York, United States..📝 An Impressionist figure, genre, and landscape painter, Charles Curran is known as a prolific artist who created light-filled paintings, often of young women.Curran was born in Hartford, Kentucky, but in 1881 moved to Sandusky, Ohio.  After studying one year at the Cincinnati School of Design, he began a distinguished career when he moved to New York City in 1882 and enrolled in the National Academy of Design.  There he studied under Walter Satterlee.At age 23, he had his first public exhibition at the Academy and won numerous prizes from that time onward.  Five years later he received the Academy's Third Hallgarten Prize for "A Breezy Day", which was considered the most meritorious painting in oil.Following his training at the National Academy, he became a student at the Art Students' League.  He then studied at the Academie Julian in Paris from 1889 to 1891.  The French artist Jules Bastien-Lepage was a source of inspiration for Curran with his paintings of peasants as a common subject matter.From 1887 to 1935, he exhibited regularly at the Pennsylvania Academy.In 1903, artist Frederick Dellenbaugh invited Curran to Cragsmoor, an art center in the Hudson River Valley near Ellenville, New York.In 1910, Curran moved into a house there and established a studio. At this time, he turned to the themes and Impressionist style that would occupy most of the remaining 30 years of his life: young women in bright sunlight.  His female subjects are often elegantly dressed, posed, and feminine, with uncomplicated and dreamy gazes.  Curran later included flowered backgrounds in his paintings, a theme to last the remainder of his career.  He occasionally painted portraits and landscapes, as well as a series of views of the Imperial Temples of Peking.His works can be seen in collections at the Columbus Museum of Art in Ohio, the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C., and the Toledo Museum of Art in Ohio..(Fig 2, 3, 4, 5: Details)...

name: 2019-09-21 18.16.22 2137730726460495850_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Ognuno a fine estate attende con ansia qualcosa: un po’ di fresco perché dopo il caldo estivo ci vuole, la domenica dopo una settimana di scuola o di lavoro, l’arrivo delle vacanze di Natale, le prime castagne cotte sul fuoco, le serate al cinema quando piove, il calduccio del piumone.---Ecco, noi di ArcheoKids, a partire da agosto aspettavamo con trepidazione solo una cosa: di avere tra le mani il nuovo volume della collana “Bambini nell’antichità” curata da @edizionilapis in collaborazione con il @britishmuseum di Londra.---E quel momento è finalmente arrivato e l’attesa, manco a dirlo, ha soddisfatto appieno le nostre aspettative.---Oggi sul blog @giobalda ci parla del libro di Chae Strathie e @marisamorea, "Vita dei bambini nell'antica Grecia", un albo divertente per tuffarsi nell'antica Grecia e scoprire come se la passavano i bambini dell'epoca.---Se avete già apprezzato "Vita dei bambini nell'antico Egitto", non potrà non piacervi anche questo nuovo volume della collana.---Noi attendiamo a questo punto il prossimo e voi? 😁---Link 👉 in bio···#grandilibriperpiccoliarcheologi #vitadeibambininellanticagrecia #chaestrathie #marisamorea #lapiseditore #britishmuseum #grecia #anticagrecia #greekkids #greekchildren #childhood #books #bookstagram #booksforkids #childrenbooks #Archeokids

name: 2019-09-21 18.39.22 2137742297437948501_britishmuseum.jpg
text: -今天的自己一個人搭了火車，以往的自己，步調總是快，覺得容易跟上人們的腳步。但近日希望自己的心能隨著生活緩緩的、穩穩地跳動。-想念著在倫敦與宮生活的日子，被暖和的陽光曬醒，在香味刺鼻的地鐵站與人群錯肩，在午後四五點的街上漫步。這一天我深愛的大英博物館裡，見著了許多帝國時期的飾物，華麗的、優雅的、大器的，忍不住讓我覺得有趣突然想回到那個時代一起學習與交流（我鬧著的啦但真的羨慕）-最喜歡的是大英博物館外觀建築，太美了那個樑柱讓我非常戀愛，是我喜歡的象牙色，要白不白要陳舊不舊的色調。最近很認真的思考設計的方向還有慢慢完成一點一點的計畫，希望未來的作品與生活一切美好。#yshootd #londonlife #likeforlikes #jewelrydesign #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-21 18.43.41 2137744475741555080_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Always busy around this grumpy guy at the @britishmuseum.Hoa Hakananai'a is a moai (Easter Island statue) housed in the British Museum in London. It was removed from ‘Orongo, Rapa Nui (Easter Island) in November 1868 by the crew of the British ship HMS Topaze and arrived in England in August 1869......#britishmuseum #museumday #rapanui #easterisland #easterislandhead #hoahakananaia #grumpy #modernart #minimalart #minimalism #minimal #fineart #artgallery #artspotlight #moma #curator #dailyart #famousart #contemporaryart #londonart #abstractart #artcollector #minimaldesign #design #artdealer #artwatchers #dnescestujem #londonpop

text: 英法雙城記- #thebritishmuseum #坐在#大英博物館 裡面的悠閒。/其實來國外真的發現自己在台灣過的太忙碌，為了生活真的沒天沒夜的忙，時間久了好像習慣了忙碌。/因為不想折磨自己，所以用自己習慣的頻率走著，走累了就坐下來休息，這是旅行——任意的旅行。/離開倫敦前往巴黎的路上，想著：「何時還會回來？」##lomography #lomo #vsco #huji #hujicamera #b612 #foodie #photography #photographer #pic #Taïwan #Londres#paris #français #uk #voyage #amit #amitié #london #franch #britishmuseum #newblance

name: 2019-09-21 18.47.47 2137746531738921026_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🐉 This colourful cloisonné jar was made in 15th-century China. The enamel decoration shows a vigorous-looking dragon chasing a pearl through clouds.Brightly coloured enamelled objects like this were once thought to be vulgar and garish, but by the early 1400s they were considered suitable for the emperor’s palace – the reign mark suggests this jar was used in the Imperial Household.In Room 33 you can learn more about the fascinating history of China from 5000 BC to the present.#BritishMuseum #China #ChineseHistory #cloisonné #art #design #London #Museum #Ming

name: 2019-09-21 19.03.48 2137754593197717776_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Kerrrrrrang!.Manga is a contradiction. It’s a global phenomenon but is still deeply rooted in Japanese culture. It’s big business too but with enough genres to cater for tastes from the everyday to the perverse. But trying to make sense of all of manga’s contradictions can result in more hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang. It’s best to find your own corner of the manga world to enjoy.If you’re interested in reading more, my article ‘More hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang! The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ’ can be found by clicking the link in the bio (August 2019).Kawanabe Kyōsai (1831-1889), Detail from the Shintomiza Kabuki Theatre Curtain, 1880 © Tsubouchi Memorial Theatre Museum, Waseda University from The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ at the British Museum, London from 23rd May to 26th August 2019.#manga #anime #hokusai #katushikahokusai #kyosai #kawanabekyosai #hagio #motohagio #tagame #gengorotagame #britishmuseum #japan #japaneseart #talkingaboutart #art

name: 2019-09-21 22.20.04 2137853379837005552_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Witty ceramic masks by #JonathanBaldock convey a world of emotion." - @CreativeBoomMag looks forward to the artist's upcoming solo exhibition ‘Personae’, opening at @stephenfriedmangallery this Thursday 26 September (6-8pm).________Baldock's work is saturated with humour and wit as well as an uncanny, macabre quality that channels the artist's longstanding interest in #myth, #folklore and narratives associated with ‘outsider' practices.Baldock's upcoming exhibition 'Personae' brings together a new series of ceramic masks that teem with bright colours and outlandish expressions. Ripples of clay allude to folds of skin whilst incisions and abstract protuberances reveal physiognomic features such as eyes, ears and nostrils. Here the artist toys with a cognitive process called pareidolia, a psychological phenomenon that causes people to see faces in inanimate objects. Whilst some masks mediate universal emotions such as happiness or sadness, others merely hint at figuration. 'Personae' follows Baldock's solo show at @CamdenArtsCentre, London earlier this year and precedes a solo exhibition at @Kunsthall_Stavanger, #Norway in May 2020.________Jonathan Baldock, ‘Maske I’, 2019. Ceramic, 30.3 x 25 x 7.8cm (11 7/8 x 9 7/8 x 3 1/8in). Copyright Jonathan Baldock. Courtesy the artist and Stephen Friedman Gallery, #London. #britishmuseum #creativeboom #news #contemporaryart #mask #ceramics #camdenartscentre #londonexhibition #sculpture #newexhibition #exhibitionopening

name: 2019-09-21 22.27.45 2137857245264952700_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🔷Ancient Persian Art.Famous gold armlet from Oxus Treasure with a pair of typical Achaemenid griffins at both ends, the visual characteristics comparable with some of Falcon species in Iran and Eurasia; 👁‍🗨🔎looking at the skull showing how the cavities roughly correspond to the hollowed parts once received the semiprecious stone inlays .🔺Comparative study by Abdoreza Majdi 2019.📸 Photos : “Bones Clones”, "BritishMuseum", and “Iranian bird blogfa” and nature photographers.🔹(For understanding hidden aspects of animals in art of ancient times, one needs to be a good observer of both art and nature , but also much better if developed an empathetic relationship.)#AbdorezaMajdi#OxusTreasure#AchaemenidArt#PersianEmpire#Iran#Amudarya#Tajikestan#Archaeology#BritishMuseum#AchaemenidGold#AnimalStyle#GoldArmlet#Griffin#AchaemenidGriffin#🔶بازوبند مشهور هخامنشى از گنجينه ى آمودريا مكشوف از تاجيكستان، اكنون در بريتيش ميوزيم لندن، با دو شيردال به سبك هخامنشى: از سر اين جانور اساطيرى كه اولين بار در شوش ظاهر شده در طراحى نشان «هما» استفاده شده، اما نگاهی دقیق تر به ویژگی های این سردیس کوچک مرصع، نشان می دهد که سر این پرنده بسیار به  شاهین سانان ، به ویژه گونه های کوچکتر آن مانند ( Kestrel) “دليجه” ( با ويژگى ايستادن در يك نقطه با درجا بال زدن) و "دليجه ى كوچك" شبیه است تا “هما” ( Bearded Vulture)، در عين حال شباهت بخش هاى خالى شده ى سر پرنده كه با سنگهاى رنگى پر شده بوده ، به ساختار جمجمه ى شاهين بسيار جالب است🔸مطالعه ي تطبيقى و چيدمان عكس ها از عبدالرضا جدى🔹( تحقیق بدون ذکر تصویری یا نوشتاری منابع ، نه تنها سرقت، بلکه موجب سرگردمی و گم شدن سر رشته ی پژوهش های آینده است )

name: 2019-09-21 22.36.14 2137861517751222429_britishmuseum.jpg
text: RAMSES II Nieto de Ramsés I e hijo de Seti I, se cree que Ramsés II no había sido el primogénito del faraón, sino que tenía un hermano mayor cuyo nombre no ha perdurado. En cualquier caso, Seti I quiso asegurarse en vida su sucesión designándolo heredero y vinculándolo al poder en calidad de corregente. Al joven príncipe Ramsés le fue otorgado un palacio real y un importante harén, y debió de acompañar a Seti I en las campañas militares emprendidas para sofocar las rebeliones en Palestina y Siria. También secundó a su padre en la guerra contra los hititas que habían ocupado los territorios de Siria.#temple#god#isis#sobekegyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto# #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum#mummy

name: 2019-09-22 01.27.47 2137947858823875248_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Found today by a lucky fellow Mudlark, this beautiful bosun’s whistle really did come out looking like this ... all thanks to the unique preserving nature of the Thames mud.The boatswain's pipe is the 'modern day' descendant of the flutes used by the Ancient Greeks and Romans to convey orders to the oarsmen and galley slaves, and the first use of the whistle in the English Navy was during the crusades of the 13th century. The 'Call' (or 'Pipe') is named after the Boatswain who was the officer in charge of the rigging and therefore issued more orders than any of the other officers. The high pitch of the Boatswain's 'Call' could be  be heard above even the worst storms and gales.The three rings on the ‘gun’ of the whistle were introduced to English bosun’s whistles in the 18th century, which helps date this one.#londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking

text: I had a fabulous time at the @shire_hall_dorset , welcoming guests and telling stories at their opening of the @britishmuseum's wonderful #DesireLoveIdentity exhibition. 🌈🌈...I said it last night (and it always bears repeating): it's impossible to underestimate the effect that events like this have on the the wider community. When a public building like a museum or library visibly celebrates a historically repressed part of their society, they are actually allowing the whole community to take pride in being who they are! 😍😍.So snaps to the Shire Hall! 👏👏...#mamag #mamagstories #shirehall #dorchester #britishmuseum #exhibition #pride #panto #pantodame #drag #storytelling #dorset #gala #party

name: 2019-09-22 03.02.40 2137995620548607357_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Repost @britishmuseum• • • • • •🐉 This colourful cloisonné jar was made in 15th-century China. The enamel decoration shows a vigorous-looking dragon chasing a pearl through clouds.Brightly coloured enamelled objects like this were once thought to be vulgar and garish, but by the early 1400s they were considered suitable for the emperor’s palace – the reign mark suggests this jar was used in the Imperial Household.In Room 33 you can learn more about the fascinating history of China from 5000 BC to the present.#BritishMuseum #China #ChineseHistory #cloisonné #art #design #London #Museum #Ming

text: Ashurbanipal - King of Assyria 669-627 B.C. He is famed for amassing a significant collection of cuneiform documents for his royal palace at Nineveh. This collection, known as the Library of Ashurbanipal, is now in the British Museum, which also holds the famous Lion Hunt of Ashurbanipal set of Assyrian palace reliefs.#monumentssf #asianartmuseum #sfciviccenter #ashurbanipal #kingofassyria #assyria #neoassyrianempire #cuneiform #ninevah #britishmuseum #lionhuntofashurbanipal #history

name: 2019-09-22 04.11.15 2138030132523056836_britishmuseum.jpg
text: One of my favourite and most important archaeological findings of the 18th century is the Rosetta Stone 196BC here shown (original spelling being Rashid in Arabic for Rosetta). Until the finding in 1799 we had no idea what hieroglyphics said for hundreds of years.That is for the longest time we had a large chapter missing of the history book of humans. Precisely the history of not just Egyptians but of all of us. As history is you. One must understand that the understanding of history is an understanding of yourself. As we are cultural people an amalgamation of all of our experiences has shaped us to who we are now and will be in the future. To sum up, we now have a one way communication channel with a civilisation and ourselves who have been mute for a millennia permitted to speak of its history, magic, medicine, religion, politics, and philosophy.The top text is Ancient Hieroglyphics.Middle is a later cursive version of ancient hieroglyphics called Demotic.Bottom is Ancient Greek, which is understood well.#archaeology #egyptology #hieroglyphics #ancientgreek #britishmuseum

text: La Danza del Antigu Egipto alcanzó una gran difusión, técnica y perfección y que transformándose desde parte del ritual sagrado hasta parte integrante en cualquier festejo o actividad social.Quedando reflejado en todas las tumbas como signo de festividad.El movimiento del cabello creaba sensualidad y belleza.#temple#god#isis#sobekegyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto# #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum#mummy

name: 2019-09-22 06.13.09 2138091491934350965_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Tumba de Sennefer - TT 96Sennefer era alcalde de Tebas durante el reinado de Amenophis II.Su tumba está situada en Sheikh Abd el-Qurna bajo la denominación TT 96,en la necrópolis tebana, en la orilla oeste del Nilo, frente a Luxor. Su vida se conoce principalmente por su notable tumba pintada en la orilla oeste de Luxor.El lugar de enterramiento de Sennefer es conocido como la Tumba de las Viñas por tener el techo decorado con parras y racimos de uva.#temple#god#isis#sobekegyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto# #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum#mummy

name: 2019-09-22 06.37.10 2138103578861686489_britishmuseum.jpg
text: VINO EN EGIPTO En el panteón egipcio hay varios dioses que tienen una relación especial con el vino: según las crónicas Osiris, dios del más allá y la resurrección, la renovación, los cultivos y el vino, fue el primero en probarlo y en enseñar a los hombres el cultivo de la vid y la vinificación. Por otra parte la diosa-vaca Hathor, protectora de las cosechas, la fertilidad, la música, la danza y la ebriedad, era adorada por sus devotos en fiestas multitudinarias celebradas cada año en sus centros de culto, con grandes libaciones y borracheras rituales de peregrinos y clero; festines similares eran dedicados también a Sejmet, la terrible diosa del Alto Egipto, con el fin de apaciguar su ira y obtener su protección.#temple#god#isis#sobekegyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto# #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum#mummy

text: MUSEUM PROJECT ON CASTLE IN PONFERRADAThe works continue !!!Inauguration: 9.10.2019 (Capicúa of the year !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082. 2019“The bridge in Art”Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose purpose is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.The first three museums have already opened in Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata and Madrid. The next one will be in Ponferrada and then in Vitoria, Alovera, Arganza, Azuqueca, Sancti Petri, Trillo, Laguardia, Guadalajara, Elciego, Yebra, Logroño, La Puebla de Ponferrada, .... #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma  #museedorsay #louvre #met #salvadordalimuseum #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #yaleartgallery #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

text: 陽月瞳さんの商品の紹介です。アンダーソンの猫ポーチ。大英博物館で最も有名かつ優美なネコ。 今から2500年前ごろに作成されたブロンズ製のネコの像!!ネコの姿をした女神バステトを表すものであり、単なるネコの像ではない。 耳と鼻には金の装飾が施され、胸には護符が下げられている。 。 。 博多阪急『ユトリエ』×｢洒落市場｣～英国と考古学の宴～ 10/2(水) ～10/8(火) #博多阪急ユトリエ #洒落市場#洒落市場特別編 #shareichiba#陽月瞳#アンダーソンの猫 #ポーチ #猫 #太陽と月 #レザーアート #大英博物館 #レザークラフト #カラフル #leathercraft #pouch #cat #popupshop #Britishmuseum #art #colorful #thankyou

text: The massive false door is 3.6 metres in height and width, surmounted by an architrave 4.1 metres in width. It is made of limestone, but is painted pink to resemble granite, as exclusive stone that was predominantly reserved for royalty. If individuals did have the opportunity to use materials reserved by the royals, there is more commonly a kinship connection, that maybe not explicited stated.The false door (with architrave) from the Tomb Chapel of Ptahshepses (Pth-Sp-ss); Old Kingdom (Dyn. V); Saqqara; Inv. name: 2019-09-22 19.26.04 2138490579867168431_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Kerrrrrrang!.Manga is a contradiction. It’s a global phenomenon but is still deeply rooted in Japanese culture. It’s big business too but with enough genres to cater for tastes from the everyday to the perverse. But trying to make sense of all of manga’s contradictions can result in more hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang. It’s best to find your own corner of the manga world to enjoy.If you’re interested in reading more, my article ‘More hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang! The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ’ can be found by clicking the link in the bio (August 2019).Moto Hagio (b. 1949), Cover for The Poe Clan (1972-1976) ©MOTO HAGIO SHOGAKUKA INC. from The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ at the British Museum, London from 23rd May to 26th August 2019.#manga #anime #hokusai #katushikahokusai #kyosai #kawanabekyosai #hagio #motohagio #tagame #gengorotagame #britishmuseum #japan #japaneseart #talkingaboutart #art

name: 2019-09-22 20.26.24 2138520943516144029_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Steatite Nomoli (plural nomolisia) figurines, Sierra Leone, uncertain origin but likely to predate the 15th century. Found in caves in southeastern Sierra Leone, nomoli figurines were once believed to be of great antiquity and at least predate Portuguese encounters in the region during the 15th-16th centuries. Many seem to represent chiefs or group leaders, whereas others seem to embody mythological creatures like spirits known as ‘krifi’. Today, they have ritual significance for local Mende and Kissi peoples, who use them as ‘rice gods’ to encourage crop growth. #sierraleone #britishmuseum Af1906,0525.19 Af1907,0617.4 Af1907,0617.3

text: (en) Portrait of Louis XIV surrounded by emblems, and below Louis, the Grand Dauphin, as a boy, standing full-length on the right and wiping tears away, and on the left Charles de Sainte-Maure de Montausier, governor of the Dauphin, and Maria Theresa of Austria, who points at the Dauphin and at Louis XIV's portrait; from Giovanni Palazzi's "Aquila inter lilia" ("The eagle among the lilies"), Venice: Herz, 1671. Location: The British Museum, London, UK.⠀(fr) Portrait de Louis XIV entouré d'emblèmes et au-dessous de Louis, le Grand Dauphin, enfant, debout à droite et essuyant les larmes, et à gauche Charles de Sainte-Maure de Montausier, gouverneur du Dauphin, et Marie-Thérèse d'Autriche, qui pointe le dauphin et le portrait de Louis XIV; "Aquila inter lilia" ("L'aigle parmi les lys") de Giovanni Palazzi? Venise: Herz, 1671.⠀(ru) Портрет Людовика XIV, окруженный эмблемами и под ним изображен Людовик, Великий Дофин, в детском возрасте, он стоит справа и вытирает слезы, слева изображен  Шарль де Сент-Мор де Монтозье, гувернер Дофина, и Мария Терезия Австрийская, которая указывает на Дофина и на портрет Людовика XIV; 'Aquila inter lilia' ("Орел среди лилий") Джованни Палацци, Венеция: Herz, 1671.⠀#BritishMuseum #leroilouisxiv #history #france #17thcentury #grandsiecle #leroisoleil #louislegrand #thesunking #louisxiv  #Frenchetching #etchingfrancaise #historicaletching #engraving #etching

name: 2019-09-22 22.30.39 2138583487184431194_britishmuseum.jpg
text: UPCOMING | @sculptor.khaled.zaki @154artfair For the upcoming London edition of the 1-54 art fair we are delighted to share new bronze works by Khaled Zaki.A metaphorical journey, Zaki is deeply concerned with the resurrection of his country, he zones-in on its evolution in the wake of the Arab spring. In constant reassessment and refinement of his technique, Zaki moved from fluid marble to solid bronze, abstract to figurative in a bid to capture and express the feelings, dreams, and expectations of his society more closely. His fluid figures, once lying down, now stand tall as Egypt finds its strength and pace. Dynamic and culturally-loaded, Zaki’s art continues to reveal the complexities of his country as it battles to rebuild itself. On his output art writer and academic Anthony Downey suggests: “...We alight upon the twin poles of destruction and rebuilding, and how mechanisms of reassembling have been a mainstay not just of sculptural practice but of social and political orders today, for better and, indeed, worse.” Pictured: The Meditator, solid bronze 1-54 Contemporary African Art Fair October 3-6@somersethouse Stand: W14#BritishMuseum⁣⠀﻿#Sufi#Bronze#154#AfricanArt⠀﻿#Sufi⁣⠀﻿#Egypt⁣⠀﻿#Cairo⁣⠀﻿#tabariartspace ⁣⠀﻿#art ⁣⠀﻿#artist ⁣⠀﻿#artistofinstagram ⁣⠀﻿#khaledzaki ⁣⠀﻿#sculpture ⁣⠀﻿#sculptureart ⁣⠀﻿#sculptureartist ⁣⠀﻿#drawing ⁣⠀﻿#sketch ⁣⠀﻿#sufism ⁣⠀﻿#gallery ⁣⠀﻿#modernart ⁣⠀﻿#modernartist ⁣⠀﻿#contemporaryart ⁣⠀﻿#contemporaryartists ⁣⠀﻿#abstractart ⁣⠀﻿#middleeast ⁣⠀﻿#middleeastart⁣

name: 2019-09-23 01.24.28 2138670968393052497_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Niño Comiendo Sandía (c.1920).🎨 Painted by Joaquín Sorolla y Bastida.Born: 27 February 1863, Valencia, Spain.Died: 10 August 1923, Cercedilla, Spain..🖼 Oil on canvas 99,5 x 75 cm..📝 Cuando apenas contaba dos años de edad, fallecieron sus padres víctimas de una epidemia de cólera. Al quedar huérfanos fueron acogidos, su hermana Eugenia y él, por su tía Isabel, hermana de su madre, y su marido, de profesión cerrajero. Pasados los años, su tío intentó enseñarle, en vano, el oficio de la cerrajería advirtiendo pronto que su verdadera vocación era la pintura.Un viaje a París en 1894 lo puso en contacto con la pintura impresionista, lo que supuso una verdadera revolución en su estilo. Abandonó los temas anteriores y comenzó a pintar al aire libre, dejándose invadir por la luz y el color del Mediterráneo. Son precisamente las obras de colores claros y pincelada vigorosa que reproducen escenas a orillas del mar las que más se identifican con el arte de Sorolla.Sin embargo, fue un artista muy activo, que realizó también numerosos retratos de personalidades españolas y algunas obras de denuncia social bajo la influencia de su amigo Blasco Ibáñez.Su estilo agradable y fácil hizo que recibiera innumerables encargos, que le permitieron gozar de una desahogada posición social. Su fama rebasó las fronteras españolas para extenderse por toda Europa y Estados Unidos, donde expuso en varias ocasiones. De 1910 a 1920 pintó una serie de murales con temas regionales para la Hispanic Society of America de Nueva York.En el estilo más característico de Sorolla, el de técnica y concepción impresionista, destaca la representación de la figura humana (niños desnudos, mujeres con vestidos vaporosos) sobre un fondo de playa o de paisaje, donde los reflejos, las sombras, las transparencias, la intensidad de la luz y el color transfiguran la imagen y dan valor a temas en sí mismo intrascendentes.Algunos críticos consideran estas obras un cruce entre los impresionistas franceses y los acuarelistas ingleses. Existe una importante colección de pintura suya en el Museo Sorolla de Madrid..(Fig 2, 3, 4, 5: Details)...

text: Benin Bronze collection at the British Museum. Over 1000 metal plaques and sculptures from the 13th century, in the Kingdom of Benin, now known as Nigeria. Ironically... Not all are bronze but are also examples in brass, wood, and even ivory! *oink!* How exciting! 🏺Very controversial. British were meanies and looted many many relics from the Nigerian people back in ye olde days. Should we give them back? On one trotter, Brits did steal them... But on the other, collections all over the globe mean we can preserve and display the wonderful art to many more pigs and people. Hmm... 🇳🇬 Piggy eyes couldn't see the ones at the top, but each piece is supposedly different! Over 1000 different pieces!? You'd be there for aaaages of you had all of them together 👀⏱️ #pigproblems #pigtureperfect #pignplaces #pig #controversial #benin #bronze #beninbronze #art #nigeria #britishmuseum #relic #stuffedtoysofinstagram #london #museum #plaque

name: 2019-09-23 02.51.17 2138714666866792235_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🌬@ancienthistoryart ⠀⠀🏷An angel is generally a supernaturalbeing found in various religions andmythologies. Abrahamic religionsoften depict angels as benevolent celestial beings who act as intermediaries between God (or Heaven) and humanity. Other roles of angels include protecting and guiding human beings, and carrying out tasks on behalf of God. Abrahamic religions often organize angels into hierarchies, although such rankings may vary between sects in each religion. Such angels may receive specific names (such as Gabriel or Michael) or titles (such as seraph or archangel). People have also extended the use of the term "angel" to various notions of spirits or figures found in other religious traditions. The theological study of angels is known as "angelology". Angels expelled from Heaven are referred to as fallen angels as distinct from the heavenly host.⠀〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️⠀🏷 Melek genellikle çeşitli dinlerde ve mitolojilerde bulunan doğaüstü bir şeydir. İbrahimi dinler genellikle melekleri Tanrı (ya da Cennet) ve insanlık arasında aracı olarak hareket eden yardımsever göksel varlıklar olarak tasvir eder.Diğer melek rolleri arasında insanları korumak ve yönlendirmek ve Tanrı adına görevlerini yerine getirmek vardır. İbrahimi dinler genellikle melekleri hiyerarşiler halinde düzenler, ancak bu tür sıralamalar her dinde mezhepler arasında değişebilir. Bu tür melekler belirli isimler (Gabriel veya Michael gibi) veya unvanlar (seraph veya başmelek gibi) alabilir. İnsanlar ayrıca “melek” teriminin kullanımını, diğer dini geleneklerde bulunan çeşitli ruh halleri veya figürler kavramlarına da genişletmiştir. Meleklerin teolojik incelemesi "melekoloji" olarak bilinir. ⠀⠀⠀🏷⠀Design Crouching Angel Garden Statue ⠀⠀🌟@ancientarcheology ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#art #sanat #artwork #museitaliani #sculpture #italia #beniculturali30 #escultura #statue #louvre #historic #scultura #statues #tesori_italiani #beniculturali #italy #louvremuseum #italianart #italianartist #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-23 03.13.33 2138725873275241771_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Myra'daki kaya mezarları/Antalya________Myra’da iki Likya nekropolü vardır, bunlar tiyatronun üzerindeki kayalıkta ve onun doğusunda nehir nekropolü olarak adlandırılan bölgede toplanmıştır. Kaya mezarlarının çoğu uzaktan büyük bir ev gibi görünürler, bazıları da tapınak şeklindedir. Nehir nekropolünün en dikkat çeken mezarı gezgin Charles Fellows'ın 1840 yılında kaya mezarlarını gördüğü zaman hala kırmızı, sarı, mavi ve mor renkleri seçebildiğini söylediği “Resimli Mezar”dır, günümüzde bu renkler görülemez sadece kırmızı ve mavi renklerden izler vardır. Bu mezarda diğer bir dikkat çeken şey gerçek ölçülerde kabartma şeklinde yapılmış on bir insan figürüdür._________Rock tombs in Myra./Antalya-Turkey..There are two Lycian necropolises in Myra, which are gathered in the rock above the theater and in the east of the river necropolis. Most of the rock tombs appear to be a large house in the distance, some are in the form of a temple. The most striking tomb of the river necropolis is the pictorial grave of the traveler Charles Fellows, who, when he saw the rock tombs in 1840, was still able to choose red, yellow, blue and purple colors. Nowadays, these colors cannot be seen only red and blue color traces. Another remarkable thing in this grave is the figure of eleven human figures in the form of reliefs.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road ________Contact Pages: @sevgiiyenerr ______Photo by: @baya_iyi ______#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #anatolia #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #volgoarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #masterpieces #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-09-23 04.54.22 2138776616048822147_britishmuseum.jpg
text: An update for those of you with tickets for my talk on Friday evening - part of the Totally Thames Foragers of the Foreshore Exhibition.... The bar is confirmed!Also, and more importantly, both of my guests are primed and ready. I will be delving even deeper into the mud to explore the notions of POSESSION and OBSESSION. I'll be talking to Stuart Wyatt from the Museum of London about posession. He's the man that identifies and records all objects of any significance from foreshore - nobody knows more about the river's trove. And I'll be discussing obsession with type designer Robert Green, whose own obsession with Doves (the lost Thames type) took him inside the mind of its equally obsessed creator.Even if you can't make the talk, swing by and say hello on Friday afternoon - I'll be there signing books between 2.30 and 5.00. You can look around at the mudlarked finds, photographs, paintings, ceramics and crafts, and there's even a short film that will transport you down onto the foreshore itself.See you there!#LondonMudlark #Mudlark #Mudlarking

text: A beautiful piece of old wood was washed up on the foreshore on Friday. I’m not sure what it’s from, perhaps part of a ship, but it’s there because the foreshore is literally washing away, which is a double edged sword. Erosion reveals the contents of old barge beds (rubbish and spoil), but it’s also washing away valuable archeology.#Londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking

name: 2019-09-23 07.20.50 2138850330691409809_britishmuseum.jpg
text: An interesting and terrifying ghost on London Underground can be found at the abandoned British Museum station. The station closed on the 25 September, 1933. Some people claim that the British Museum station on the Central Line is haunted by the ghost of an ancient Egyptian mummy from the nearby Museum.The ghost is connected to the curse of the Amen-Ra's tomb also know as the unlucky mummy. Dressed in an impressive headdress, the figure of an Egyptian Princess would return from the grave late at night and would wail and scream in the tunnels. A more recent report states that these sounds can now be heard further down the track, at Holborn station.The rumours of the ghost grew so strong that a newspaper offered a reward to anyone who would spend the night there. No one volunteered to do this.In 1935, two years after the station's closure, the story takes a stranger turn. The comedy thriller, Bulldog Jack, used the legend as its premise which included a secret tunnel from the station to the Egyptian room at the Museum. On the same night that the film was released, two women disappeared from the platform at Holborn (the next station along from where British Museum was) Marks were later found on the walls of the closed station.More sightings of the ghost were reported along with strange moanings from the walls of the tunnels. Eventually the story was hushed up as London Underground has always denied the existence of the tunnel from the station to the Egyptian Room.

text: Los asirios son los aborígenes de Mesopotamia. Los herederos de esta vasta civilización mesopotámica alcanzan hoy los 4,5 millones y habitan principalmente en Irak, Siria, Líbano, Irán y Turquía, aunque un tercio de ellos vive en la diáspora y tienen una historia de más de 6.700 años. Definitivamente algo de lo que más me gusto del #britishmuseum que increíble poder conocer y apreciar más de todas las culturas del mundo 🗺 💙 #love #culture #culturageneral #asiria #mesopotamia #museum #london🇬🇧

name: 2019-09-23 11.06.14 2138963778075068939_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #PawsHistory Lesson:“When we think of an ancient dog, we probably think of something almost more jackal-like or wolf-like, and we definitely seen representations like that, especially in Egyptian art, but we also see, for example, mastiffs. That’s very much what you’d expect a pet dog to look like, right?A lot of the dog votives that we know of came from what’s now Iraq. Some of them were made for royal patrons, but others were commissioned by average lay people. There’s a healing goddess whose main attribute is a dog, the [Mesopotamian] goddess Gula, and we see her and her dog on a number of monumental stelae, as well as smaller objects like cylinder seals and stamp seals.So they occur in the visual record as both as pets and as these wild creatures. There’s that dual aspect to them. On the one hand, they are icons of the power of beastly nature, so they’re these fierce hunters. But at the same time they’re also definitely these extensions of us or things that work in tandem with humans.” —@jakestavis, curatorial fellow at @metmuseum and art history doctoral candidate at @Columbia, dog dad to @animalhaven rescue, Sandy

name: 2019-09-23 17.06.38 2139145175171555881_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Repost by @britishmuseum———This Dante Gabriel Rossetti watercolour is on public display for the first time in decades – catch it in our free prints and drawings exhibition in Room 90a.It was painted by the artist in the 1850s, and sold to his friend William Morris as part of a series of seven medieval-inspired watercolours. The grisly scene shows two knights – Dinadan and Breuze – from the legend of King Arthur fighting while a dead man hangs from a tree behind, and a woman is held against her will.Find out more about this painting’s story and discover other works recently donated from the collection of art historian, curator and collector John Christian in our free display – find out more via the link in our bio.#BritishMuseum #Rosetti #PreRaphaelite #PreRaphaelites #WilliamMorris #VictorianHistory #art #painting #watercolour #exhibition #London

name: 2019-09-23 17.14.38 2139149200024153451_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Repost by @britishmuseum🐉 This colourful cloisonné jar was made in 15th-century China. The enamel decoration shows a vigorous-looking dragon chasing a pearl through clouds.Brightly coloured enamelled objects like this were once thought to be vulgar and garish, but by the early 1400s they were considered suitable for the emperor’s palace – the reign mark suggests this jar was used in the Imperial Household.In Room 33 you can learn more about the fascinating history of China from 5000 BC to the present.#BritishMuseum #China #ChineseHistory #cloisonné #art #design #London #Museum #Ming

name: 2019-09-23 17.34.32 2139159215000122003_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Didyouknow that the British Museum’s reading room had the second-largest dome in the world when it was built?⠀The round Reading Room was built in the museum’s central courtyard in 1857, 100 years after the museum first opened. With a diameter of 42.6m the dome was the second-largest in the world at the time, second only to the Pantheon in Rome. For perspective, the dome of St Paul’s Cathedral is 34m across.⠀The library was eventually moved in 1997 to the new British Library building near St Pancras. The distinctive ceiling, designed by Sir Norman Foster, was added in 2000 and made the Great Court Europe’s largest covered public square.⠀⠀📸1 @ottoberkeley📸2 British Museum blog on the Reading Room⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#londonhistory #museum #facts #historicalfacts #london #britishmuseum #archaeology #architecture #londonarchitecture

name: 2019-09-23 18.31.33 2139187915809639460_britishmuseum.jpg
text: UK🇬🇧Day4💂🏻‍♂️Sep.7th***続いて向かったのは大英博物館。ここも絶対に行きたかった場所！ただ辿り着いたのが閉館1時間前😱全然時間が足りず、絶対見たかったものを早足でめぐる。。。まずはなんと言っても #ロゼッタストーン ！ヒエログリフ解読の鍵になった世界史で出てくる有名な石。そしてエジプトの関連の石像やミイラたち。さすが大英帝国 、過去に収集された世界中の宝物がこの博物館に集結している。見応えのあったエジプトエリア、ミイラもたくさん展示されていたけど、そもそもご遺体だし、写真に残す気持ちになれず、棺だけ。 #ルイスのチェス駒 も見たかったもののひとつ。セイウチの牙で作られていて、何とも可愛らしい。これもまた #ハリーポッターと賢者の石 の映画に小道具として出てきているものなので要チェック✔️展示室は閉館時間ピッタリに閉まるけど、ミュージアムショップはその後もやっていました。ミュージアムショップを見るのも博物館に行く時の楽しみの１つ🎶展示品に関するものから、ピーターラビットやアリス等のイギリスならではの可愛いものがたくさん売ってた🤡展示物の1割も見れていないため、いつかリベンジしたい。というかもはやイギリス住みたい😂***怒涛の大英博物館見学を終え、徒歩で #コベントガーデン へ🚶‍♀️これまたGoogle様々。ここで後輩ちゃんと合流🥰コベントガーデンには色んなお店がたくさんあって、買い物するにはとてもよかった！そしてそして、この旅で楽しみにしていたものの１つ、#ミュージカル鑑賞 ✨オペラ座の怪人と迷いに迷い、#マンマミーア にして大正解🙆‍♀️英語が流暢すぎて分からなくてもストーリーは知っているし、何にせよ歌が最高😭ロンドンのお客さんのノリもよくて、いつかブロードウェイでもマンマミーア見てみたいなぁと思った。***旅行の時はとてもよく歩くんだけど、連日2万歩超えてた！スニーカー必須。#britishmuseum #大英博物館#ラムセス2世像  #ミイラの棺#モアイ像 #🗿 #大英博物館のアヒル #mammamia

name: 2019-09-23 18.33.28 2139188877922139809_britishmuseum.jpg
text: There's nothing like cozying up with a hot cup of tea when it's getting cold outside. However, the only thing better is a cup of tea spiked with little something extra. To inspire our beloved customers to drinking tea everyday, we come up with an idea of spiking teas with liquors to find out which pairings are best. The Wellness Tea Workshop & Tasting entitles you to a tea talk with Ajit Madan - the UKs first ITEI Master Tea Sommelier, Tea Tour to experience more than 100 types of tea, a complimentary Wellness tea cocktails, and so on. 3 days left to the event. Get your tickets in-store or online: https://bit.ly/2kp1IiH. . . #tea #camelliasteahouse #britishmuseum #teaparty #teapartytheme #londontearoom #londontea #londonteatime #afternoontealondon #afternoontea #englishtea #traditionaltea #teatime #teaobsessed #teacocktail #teaholic #tealover #londoncocktails #teapairing #visitlondon #explorelondon

name: 2019-09-23 21.09.32 2139267429317141562_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Kerrrrrrang!.Manga is a contradiction. It’s a global phenomenon but is still deeply rooted in Japanese culture. It’s big business too but with enough genres to cater for tastes from the everyday to the perverse. But trying to make sense of all of manga’s contradictions can result in more hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang. It’s best to find your own corner of the manga world to enjoy.If you’re interested in reading more, my article ‘More hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang! The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ’ can be found by clicking the link in the bio (August 2019).Gengoro Tagame (b. 1964), My Brother’s Husband (2014 – 2017) © Gengoro Tagame from The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ at the British Museum, London from 23rd May to 26th August 2019.#manga #anime #hokusai #katushikahokusai #kyosai #kawanabekyosai #hagio #motohagio #tagame #gengorotagame #britishmuseum #japan #japaneseart #talkingaboutart #art

name: 2019-09-23 21.48.16 2139286931155046478_britishmuseum.jpg
text: People would shave their eyebrows because of cats? 🙀It is thought cats were originally domesticated because they hunted mice that would eat stored grains, but a recent study found that cats domesticated themselves. They were never specifically sought out for domestication like dogs were but their coexistence with humans naturally developed from the mutually beneficial nature of the relationship, with their hunting protecting the food stores. While the exact history of human interaction with cats is still somewhat vague, a shallow grave site discovered in 1983 in Cyprus, dating to 7500 BCE, during the Neolithic period, contains the skeleton of a human, buried ceremonially with stone tools. In its own tiny grave 40 centimeters from the human grave was an eight-month-old cat, its body oriented in the same westward direction as the human skeleton.Cats, known in ancient Egypt as the "mau", played a large role in ancient Egyptian society. They were associated with the goddesses Isis and Ba'at. Cats were sacred animals! Killing a cat was absolutely forbidden and the Greek historian Herodotus reports that, whenever a household cat died, the entire family would mourn and shave their eyebrows. They would then mummify them like humans and burry them in a sacred city. ..Group of cat mummies: Roman period, linen, @britishmuseum..Image rights: @britishmuseum#cat #cats #catcontent #kitty #kitten #catworld #catlover #catsofinstagram #catsinsta #catsofinsta #animals #kittens #feline #pet #animal #katze #chat #ancient #greek #roman #egypt #culture #art #arthistory #history #artblog #britishmuseum #london #mummy

name: 2019-09-23 23.18.14 2139332211651493454_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 1st Century AD Roman auxiliary cavalry helmet..Dating from around 50 AD, and discovered in the 1870s near Ely, Cambridgeshire, the wearer of this helmet was evidently involved in the Roman conquest of Britain which took place in the decades following the Claudian invasion of AD 43. It’s possible that the owner was an auxiliary trooper making up part of the campaign waged against the Iceni tribe of Eastern Britain by Governor Ostorius Scapula from AD 47-52..Today, only the helmet’s decorative copper alloy casing remains, which would have imparted very little protection by itself. However, it originally encased an iron core that has long since corroded away. The cap, neck guard, and cheek guards were tinned, which would have created the appearance of a gold band surrounding a silver helm. This resplendent appearance would have been completed by a plumed crest affixed to the top of the helmet, which has also been lost to decay....#BritishMuseum #TheBritishMuseum #BritishMuseumLondon #Londinium #AncientRome #Artefacts  #RomanEmpire #Archaeology #ArchaeologyLovers #Helmets #RomanBritain #RomanHelmet #HistoricMonument  #History #HistoryLover #London #HistoricLondon #AncientHistory #MuseumLover #MuseumDay #Museums #HistoryNerd  #ClassicalHistory #WitchamGravelHelmet #Ely #EastAnglia #Iceni

text: A Young Girl in Profile (c.1881).🎨 Painted by William-Adolphe Bouguereau.Born: 30 November 1825, La Rochelle, France.Died: 19 August 1905, La Rochelle, France. (aged 79).🖼 Oil on canvas 40 x 33 cm..📝 His work was characterized by a highly finished, technically impeccable realism and a sentimental interpretation of his subject matter.Bouguereau received many honours in the 1860s and ’70s and became for a time the most famous French painter of his day.In his later years he decorated the chapels of several Parisian churches and painted religious compositions in a Pre-Raphaelite style.Throughout the course of his life, Bouguereau executed 822 known finished paintings, although the whereabouts of many are still unknown..(Fig 2, 3, 4: Details).....#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #realism #williamadolphebouguereau #larochelle #france #yourarttimes

text: We’re thrilled to announce that our brilliant former volunteer Jo Foster-Murdoch is the Joint East of England Regional Winner of the @britishmuseum’s Marsh Trust Award, for her work on the #DesireLoveIdentity exhibition. Jo helped establish a young people’s LGBT+ history group, worked tirelessly to collect LGBT+ material for our collection, and brought the past to life by organising numerous events and activities. We’re very proud! 🥳🌈 #marshtrust #marshawards #marshtrustawards #britishmuseum #volunteer #volunteering #volunteeraward #norwich #norfolk #history #heritage #lgbthistory #lgbtqhistory #norwichpride

name: 2019-09-24 03.18.06 2139452942176931383_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ☥Tutankhamun’s Crook & Flail☥ The crook and flail were originally attributes of Osiris that became insignia of pharaonic authority. The shepherd's crook stood for kingship and the flail stood for the fertility of the land. By late Predynastic times, the shepherd's crook was already an established symbol of rule. The flail initially remained separate, being depicted alone on some earliest representations of royal ceremonial. Approximately by the time of the Second Dynasty the crook and flail became paired. The only extant pharaonic examples of both the crook and flail come from the tomb of Tutankhamun. The crook made of heavy bronze covered with alternating stripes of blue glass, obsidian, and gold, while the flail's beads are made of gilded wood. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~📆 New Kingdom. 18th Dynasty.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 🌍 Valley of the Kings, Luxor, Egypt. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 📸Photo: tutankhamun-london.com~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #tutankhamun #tut #kingtut #pharaoh #pharoah #hieroglyphics #museum #britishmuseum #london #egypt #valleyofthekings #luxor #cairo #crook #tomb #facts #instafacts #facts💯 #hiero #hieroglyphics #heiroglyphics #heiro #archeology #artefacts #artifacts #archaeology #gold #treasures #ancient #𓁟

name: 2019-09-24 04.23.49 2139486014415033949_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Yunanistan'da yer alan Epidaurus Antik Kenti tiyatrosu. MÖ 4. yüzyılda atlet heykeltraşı ve mimar olan Genç Polykleitos tarafından yapılmıştır. Son derece kaliteli akustiği ve simetrisi ile büyüleyici bir tiyatrodur. Antik Yunan döneminde 34 oturma sırası varken Antik Roma döneminde 21 sıra daha eklenerek kullanılmıştır._______________Epidaurus was a small polis in ancient Greece, on the Argolid Peninsula at the Saronic Gulf. The prosperity brought by the asclepeion enabled Epidaurus to construct civic monuments, including the huge theatre that delighted Pausanias for its symmetry and beauty. The ancient theatre of Epidaurus was designed by Polykleitos the Younger in the 4th century BC. The original 34 rows were extended in Roman times by another 21 rows._________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road _________#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #sanat #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #volgoarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #masterpieces #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-09-24 04.30.05 2139489168950956343_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Olmec devasa taş heykeli. La Venta, Tabasco. ______1938'den başlayarak, Smithsonian Amerikan Etnoloji Bürosu şefi Matthew Stirling, Meksika'da Tabasco ve Veracruz'a, National Geographic destekli sekiz keşif gezisine öncülük etti. Onbeş yüzyıl boyunca gömülü olan antik Olmec medeniyetinin kanıtı olan 11 devasa taş başını ortaya çıkardı.La Venta, Meksika'nın körfez kıyısında, modern Tabasco ve Veracruz eyaletlerinin sınırına yakın bir yerde bulunan eski Olmec yerleşimi. Aslen şimdi büyük bir bataklığın parçası olan Tonalá Nehri'ndeki bir adada inşa edildi. Petrolün orada bulunmasından sonra, birçok eser batıdan 129 km uzaklıktaki Villahermosa şehrinin eteklerinde arkeolojik bir parka taşındı._________________Olmec colossal stone head. La Venta, Tabasco, Mexico. Photo by Richard Hewitt Stewart.Beginning in 1938, Matthew Stirling, chief of the Smithsonian Bureau of American Ethnology, led eight National Geographic-sponsored expeditions to Tabasco and Veracruz in Mexico. He uncovered 11 colossal stone heads, evidence of the ancient Olmec civilization that had lain buried for 15 centuries.La Venta, ancient Olmec settlement, located near the border of modern Tabasco and Veracruz states, on the gulf coast of Mexico. La Venta was originally built on an island in the Tonalá River; now it is part of a large swamp. After petroleum was found there, many of the artifacts were moved to an archaeological park on the outskirts of the city of Villahermosa, some 80 miles (129 km) to the west.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road ______Contact Pages : @sevgiiyenerr __________#archeobilgi #archaeology #museitaliani #arteitaliana #sculpture #italia #beniculturali30 #escultura #statue #uffizi #louvre #historic #scultura #statua #arkeoloji #italianart #statues #emperor #tesori_italiani #beniculturali #louvremuseum #romanempire #italianart #italianartist #greeks #archeologia #britishmuseum #sanat #azteca #aztec #arqueologia

name: 2019-09-24 05.12.39 2139510589394763604_britishmuseum.jpg
text: EXPOSICIÓN EN EL MUSEO DE SAN JUAN DE LA MATAEl 19 de julio de 2019 se ha inaugurado una nueva  exposición con el título : EL FUEGO EN EL PRADOHomenaje al Museo del Prado en su Bicentenario Complementa y amplía la exposición anterior sobre el mismo tema pero con obras pertenecientes al Museo del Prado: Velázquez, Rubens, Goya, El Bosco, Cossiers,.....Y como plato fuerte:“Un cuadro viviente...”!!!!!! Santalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.EXHIBITION AT THE SAN JUAN DE LA MATA MUSEUMOn July 19, 2019 a new exhibition with the title was inaugurated:THE FIRE IN THE PRADOTribute to the Prado Museum in its BicentennialIt complements and extends the previous exhibition on the same subject but with works belonging to the Museo del Prado: Velázquez, Rubens, Goya, El Bosco, Cossiers, .....And as a main course:"A living painting ..." !!!!!! Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose goal is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.#museodelprado  #reinasofiamuseum #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma #modernart #museedorsay #louvre #met  #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #yaleartgallery #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 07.44.31 2139587025626716402_britishmuseum.jpg
text: London Highlights Day 4 - We spent a good portion of our day at the British Museum. I was psyched to see The Rosetta Stone and all of the Egyptian artifacts. Lots of cool Greek and Roman pieces too. We looked at so many greek vases, so many. Next up was Buckingham Palace. Walked to Trafalgar Square and then on to Piccadilly Circus where we tried to watch some American football. The early games started at 6:00 pm for us. #london #britishmuseum #buckinghampalace #trafalgarsquare #picadillycircus #10yeartrip

name: 2019-09-24 08.39.49 2139614866612557428_britishmuseum.jpg
text: مجسمه ی نیم تنه ی رامسس دوم ، موزه ی بریتانیا ، لندن . رامسس دوم ، سومین پادشاه سلسله ی نوزدهم پادشاهی مصر که۶۶ سال حکومت کرد (۱۲۱۳-۱۲۷۹ پیش از میلاد )وی سربازی شجاع و‌پادشاهی مقتدر و توانا برای مصر بود . از جمله کارهای که کرد  دستور ساخت معابد زیاد و مجسمه های عظیم از خودش بود که در مناطق مختلف مصر توسط هنرمندان ساخته می شد . همچنین او در کتیبه ها و‌نوشتهدهای پادشاهان پیش از خودش دست برده و یا اینکه به آنها مطالبی در باره ی خودش و کارهایش اضافه کرده است و‌هدفی جز ماندگاری نامش در دوره های بعد به عنوان پادشاهی نیکو کار و توانا نداشته است . مجسمه ی نیم تنه ی رامسس از سنگ گرانیتی دو رنگ توسط هنرمندی ماهر ساخته شده است که از این خاصیت دورنگی طبیعی سنگ بهره برده است و سر و نیم تنه را با دورنگ متفاوت تراشیده است . به این صورت که سر به رنگ قهوه ای -خاکستری است و‌نیم تنه به رنگ صورتی ملایم . مجسمه در جوانی رامسس ساخته شده و رامسس تاج حلقوی و سربند مخصوص فراعنه مصر را بر سر دارد .  بلندی مجسمه ۲۶۶سانتی متر و عرض آن ازشانه راست تا شانه ی چپ ۲۰۳ سانتی متر می باشد . در قسمت پشت مجسمه با خط هیروگلیف به صورت عمودی نام پادشاه  و عنوانش و بخش از هدایا و نذوراتش به خدای رع یا خورشید ، بزرگترین خدای مصریان ، حک شده است .‌برای اولین بار در سال ۱۷۹۸ سربازان ناپلئون بناپارت در مصر تلاش کردند این مجسمه را از زیر خاک بیرون بکشند اما موفق نشدند و در نهایت در سال ۱۸۱۵ توسط جیوانی بلزونی  Giovanni Belzoni به سواحل رود نیا منتقل شد و در نهایت در سال ۱۸۳۰ به موزه ی بریتانیا راه یافت . #britishmuseum #london_city_photo #londonmuseum #londonartscene #unitedkingdon #artmuseums #londonhistory #egyptology#egyptianhistory#egyptianmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 12.09.33 2139720424659886629_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Repost @ancientarcheology with @get_repost・・・🌬@ancienthistoryart ⠀⠀🏷An angel is generally a supernaturalbeing found in various religions andmythologies. Abrahamic religionsoften depict angels as benevolent celestial beings who act as intermediaries between God (or Heaven) and humanity. Other roles of angels include protecting and guiding human beings, and carrying out tasks on behalf of God. Abrahamic religions often organize angels into hierarchies, although such rankings may vary between sects in each religion. Such angels may receive specific names (such as Gabriel or Michael) or titles (such as seraph or archangel). People have also extended the use of the term "angel" to various notions of spirits or figures found in other religious traditions. The theological study of angels is known as "angelology". Angels expelled from Heaven are referred to as fallen angels as distinct from the heavenly host.⠀〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️〽️⠀🏷 Melek genellikle çeşitli dinlerde ve mitolojilerde bulunan doğaüstü bir şeydir. İbrahimi dinler genellikle melekleri Tanrı (ya da Cennet) ve insanlık arasında aracı olarak hareket eden yardımsever göksel varlıklar olarak tasvir eder.Diğer melek rolleri arasında insanları korumak ve yönlendirmek ve Tanrı adına görevlerini yerine getirmek vardır. İbrahimi dinler genellikle melekleri hiyerarşiler halinde düzenler, ancak bu tür sıralamalar her dinde mezhepler arasında değişebilir. Bu tür melekler belirli isimler (Gabriel veya Michael gibi) veya unvanlar (seraph veya başmelek gibi) alabilir. İnsanlar ayrıca “melek” teriminin kullanımını, diğer dini geleneklerde bulunan çeşitli ruh halleri veya figürler kavramlarına da genişletmiştir. Meleklerin teolojik incelemesi "melekoloji" olarak bilinir. ⠀⠀⠀🏷⠀Design Crouching Angel Garden Statue ⠀⠀🌟@ancientarcheology ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#art #sanat #artwork #museitaliani #sculpture #italia #beniculturali30 #escultura #statue #louvre #historic #scultura #statues #tesori_italiani #beniculturali #italy #louvremuseum #italianart #italianartist #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 12.29.51 2139730643856546851_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 190715In the morning, I bought a musical ticket, Mamma Mia. And then, I went to the British Museum. It was really big but it was enough for me to see everything in 2 hours. I went to Primark and bought a dress. Also I went to lego and M&M store. After dinner, finally, i watched Mamma Mia. It was really really amazing! While i was watching musical, I cried little bit. because I felt actually that my exchange student life is finished. And also just grateful that I could see this great musical in London. I think it’s not enough to see everything in London just for 3 days. Next time, i want to travel London with my mom..#유럽#europe#영국#England#런던#london#데이시트#맘마미아#Mammamia#대영박물관#britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 14.07.44 2139779910158463752_britishmuseum.jpg
text: “Nara Sacred images from early Japan” will be held from October 3rd to November 24th, 2019 at the British Museum in London. The national treasures from representative temples and shrine in Nara will be exhibited.From Todaiji temple, “Buddha at Birth and ablution basin” & “Bodhisattva playing symbals, panel from an octagonal lantern” will be exhibited.  Both national treasures were made for the ceremony to consecrate the Great Buddha in around 752.  Image of the Buddha at Birth are the main object of devotion in the “Birth of the Buddha Geathering” (Busshoe), which celebrates his birth on the 8th of April.https://www.thecultureconcept.com/nara-sacred-images-from-early-japan-the-british-museum  #nationaltreasure #nationaltreasures #britishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #thebritishmuseum #nara #buddha #todaiji #Japanphotography #japanphoto #japantourism #japan_gallery #beautifuljapan #vscojapan #japan_focus #unlimitedjapan #japanstagram #visitjapanjp #amazingjapan #super_japan_channel #discoverasia #exploringasia #travelasia #exploreasia #thisisasia #amazingasia #asiatravels

name: 2019-09-24 15.21.03 2139816811636532499_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Box Seats at the Theater, the Gentleman and the Lady (c.1909).🎨 Painted by Felix Vallotton.Born: 28 December 1865, Lausanne, Switzerland.Died: 29 December 1925, Paris, France..🖼 Oil on canvas 46 x 38 cm..📝 He was a member the Nabis group who, at the end of the 19th century, combined the Post-Impressionist techniques and style with new avant-garde methods. Although he never achieved the same level of prestige as Pierre Bonnard, the leader of the Nabis, Vallotton is a regular name in art auctions and his works are exhibited in the most reputable museums and galleries.In his early years he became interested in portrait painting. He occasionally returned to Switzerland, where he painted landscapes in the region of Vaud. In Paris he became interested in the art of engraving. Two of his etchings were inspired by Jean-François Millet and Rembrandt.In 1891, he produced his first woodcuts and presented ten paintings in his debut at the Salon des Indépendants. Around this time, he was initiated into the Nabis, along with Édouard Vuillard, Paul Sérusier and Bonnard. The Nabis, which translates as the “Prophets,” based their style, subject matters, and techniques on the works of Paul Gauguin, Vincent Van Gogh, Toulouse-Lautrec, and others. The Nabis merged these separate styles into a single defined style that was later taken up by famous artists like Cézanne and Matisse.He exhibited with the Nabis in the Ambroise Vollard Gallery in Paris in 1897 and two years later in the Durand Ruel in the same city.In 1900, he obtained French nationality.The First World War had repercussions on their sales and caused financial problems. Vallotton produced several works inspired by the conflict. He went to live in Cagnes-sur-Mer in the winter of 1920. In November 1925, he was hospitalized and died after an operation for cancer. A foundation for the study and promotion of the art of Vallotton was established in Lausanne in 1998.Between realism, simplified stylisation, and bitter criticism of the society of his time, Félix Vallotton was above all a tireless worker, creating more than 1,700 canvases and 200 engravings during his life....

name: 2019-09-24 18.28.41 2139911243910082057_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Today is Heritage Day in South Africa – a day for honouring the cultural history and diversity of the country. The holiday is known by two other names, Shaka Day and Braai Day. The first commemorates King Shaka Zulu (c.1787-1828), who was noted for uniting various clans into one Zulu kingdom and was the original focus of the 24 September celebrations before 1995. The second celebrates the longstanding South African tradition of the braai, or the grilling of meat over an open fire.⁣⁣Our first watercolour is by an Unknown artist and depicts a Zulu warrior bearing the shield that Shaka is credited for introducing. In our second painting by Dutch explorer Robert Jacob Gordon, made a decade or so before Shaka’s birth, you can see members of the Gqunukhwebe clan enjoying braai.⁣⁣Image Details: https://buff.ly/2mh8pEc Zulu Warrior, 19th Century, Unknown Artist. © Trustees of the British Museum, CC BY-NC-SA 4.0; https://buff.ly/2mh8kjS The kraal of “Captain” Coba (or Kobé), a chief of the Gqunukhwebe, 1777, Robert Jacob Gordon. Image courtesy Rijksmuseum, Public Domain.⁣⁣#HeritageDay #Braaiday #SouthAfrica #shakazulu #zulu #braai #watercolour #watercolourworld #britishmuseum #rijksmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 19.35.09 2139944703793921325_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ Anglo-Saxon enthusiast and Theatre of War promoter Kieran wearing the Staffordshire Hoard, "Dave" pommel shirt. The design is based on a 7th century AD silver-gilded pommel, named by conservators as the "Dave Pommel". Believed to have been made in Scandinavia or Germany, the pommel displays a bearded male head, flanked either side by animals legs ending with paws. The style is said to be inspired by continental Roman belt buckles, originally displaying a male head, proposed to be Neptune with dolphins shown either side of him.This pommel comprised part of The Staffordshire Hoard, the largest hoard of Anglo-Saxon gold and silver metalwork yet found. #theatreofwarclothing #britishhistory #britishmuseum #stokepotteriesmuseum #staffordshirehoard #staffordshirehoardhelmet #anglosaxon #archaeologist #staffordshirehoard #mercia #anglosaxonperiod #anglosaxonking #birminghammuseumandartgallery #potteriesmuseum

text: 一說好要去倫敦🇬🇧玩，@yybecs 立馬手刀光速訂了在大英博物館🗿對面的英式下午茶 ☕️@camellias_teahouse🥺🥺🥺 據說這種三層有鹹有甜的貴婦下午茶完全是我們這種外國觀光客對大英帝國的誤解，當地人平常是沒有在去的啦！我們當天點的是兩人份的下午茶，包括兩壺茶和三層點心，點心方面一人會分到四種不同口味的半片三明治、兩個原味司康配奶油和果醬、一個巧克力蛋糕、一個檸檬罌粟籽蛋糕和一個像是無餡的泡芙，份量超大，即使沒吃早餐就進城的我們，根本無法當場吃完，還默默打包了司康回去。整個點心盤裡，最讓我意外的是我平常沒什麼興趣的點心，它都做得很好吃🤔(?)鹹點我很喜歡它的堅果餡的三明治，其他的吐司體都有點乾，但堅果意外不乾又不會讓喉頭癢癢的，很順很順！更讓我驚豔的卻是那不起眼的巧克力蛋糕！！不僅一反大英常態甜到讓人懷疑家裡開糖廠外，濃郁卻又不會卡喉嚨，想立馬灌兩杯老人茶，蛋糕體質地介於磅蛋糕和海綿蛋糕之間，鬆散又濕潤，搭配巧克力抹醬，馬上忽略它的大尺寸，瞬間一口接一口迅速完食，還逼飽到要死的 @yybecs 一定要當場嘗試，它真的好吃到我可以為了它再去倫敦忍耐其他可怕的食物🥺🥺🥺#teahouse #teatime #unitedkingdom🇬🇧 #UK #london #camelliasteahouse #camelliatea #britishmuseum #touristday #tourist #scone #cake #sandwich #lemonpoppyseed #貴婦下午茶 #下午茶 #英式下午茶 #大英博物館 #英國 #倫敦 #friends #觀光客行程

name: 2019-09-24 19.44.09 2139949232761522945_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ Now available @theatreofwar.bigcartel.comIn Black, Grey, Red & Green, the Sutton Hoo Tiw T-shirtThe design is based on an ornamentation found on a purse lid from the famous Anglo-Saxon ship burial at Sutton Hoo dated to the early 7th century AD. The image depicted is proposed to be Tiw or Tyr (Old Norse), Tiw was another deity of chief importance to the Anglo-Saxons as he was the god of war, swordplay and the sky. The purse lid from Sutton Hoo is the richest of its kind yet found.The lid was made to cover a leather pouch containing gold coins. It hung by three hinged straps from the waist belt, and was fastened by a gold buckle. The lid had totally decayed but was probably made of whalebone—a precious material in early Anglo-Saxon England. #anglosaxonperiod#england #englisheritage #anglosaxon #anglosaxonengland #suttonhoonationaltrust #suffolk #suttonhoo #anglian #anglosaxonking #theatreofwarclothing #northerneuropean #britishhistory #britishmuseum #suttonhoo #suttonhoohelmet #englishhistory #theatreofwarclothing

name: 2019-09-24 21.07.04 2139990968718410448_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Kerrrrrrang!.Manga is a contradiction. It’s a global phenomenon but is still deeply rooted in Japanese culture. It’s big business too but with enough genres to cater for tastes from the everyday to the perverse. But trying to make sense of all of manga’s contradictions can result in more hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang. It’s best to find your own corner of the manga world to enjoy.If you’re interested in reading more, my article ‘More hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang! The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ’ can be found by clicking the link in the bio (August 2019).Virtual reproduction of Tokyo’s oldest manga bookstore (since closed!) from The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ at the British Museum, London from 23rd May to 26th August 2019 (personal photo).#manga #anime #hokusai #katushikahokusai #kyosai #kawanabekyosai #hagio #motohagio #tagame #gengorotagame #britishmuseum #japan #japaneseart #talkingaboutart #art

text: Attended the Lecture for members of British Museum yesterday with my wife. The Great Cities through the eyes of the travellers . Interesting talk about the various places and their descriptions across the ages by various people. What makes City great? And other questions raised throughout the lecture. It’s great to be able to visit British Museum after it’s closed. Empty halls gives the sense of grandeur and you can almost taste the silence in here.

text: A rare Bow porcelain inkwell, decorated in famille rose colours with a banded hedge design and flowering branches. The upper surface bears the enamelled inscription ‘MADE AT NEW CANTON 1750’.-Originally based in Bow, the works had moved to the east side of the river Lea, Essex, by 1749, operating from the ‘New Canton’ manufactory.-On display @britishmuseum.-For more examples of Bow soft paste porcelain wares from this innovative firm, please visit the JunoAntiques.com website via the link in the bio.-#bow #bowporcelain #newcanton #inkwell #britishmuseum #famillerose #englishporcelain #britishporcelain #inkpot #softpasteporcelain #antiqueporcelain #familleroseporcelain #antiqueenglishporcelain #18thcenturyporcelain #junoantiques

text: On occasion of today’s decision that Johnson acted unlawfully, here’s another PM who was accused of having autocratic aspirations.This etching from the late-1820s depicts Prime Minister Wellington dressed as a giant lobster. Wellington was pressured to resign from his military position as many in the government felt it was inappropriate for the PM to hold such a position. ”Lobster”, on the other hand, was an insulting moniker referring to a soldier.Image © The Trustees of the British Museum#prints #etching #satire #humour #brexit #britishhistory #history #nineteenthcentury #19thcentury #19thcenturyart #art #arthistory #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-24 23.35.37 2140065737136514367_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Knidos: Denizlerin Buluştuğu Kent@knidos_kazi_ve_arastirmalari ________Datça ilçesinde bulunan Knidos Antik Kenti, bilime, sanata önem vermesi ve bu alanda önemli insanlar yetiştirmesi açısından önemli. Astronomi ve matematik alanında ünlü bilim insanı Eudoksus, tıp bilim insanı Euryphon, ressam Polygnotos ve dünyanın yedi harikasından biri olan İskenderiye Feneri’nin mimarı Sostratos'ın Knidoslu olduğu düşünülüyor. Ayrıca şehir yönetimi Pers’lerin istilasından korktukları için yarım adayı tamamen ada haline getirmek isteyip başarısızlıkla sonuçlanan bir projeye kalkışmıştı. Günümüzde bu antik kentte görülecek yapılar arasında, yuvarlak tapınak, Dionysos Stoası ve Tapınağı, Apollon tapınağı, Bolukrates Çeşmesi ve yaklaşık 5.000 kapasiteli küçük tiyatrosu yer alıyor._______________Knidos: city where seas meet@knidos_kazi_ve_arastirmalari _________The ancient city of Knidos, located in modern Datça in Turkey, is important in terms of giving importance to science and art and raising important people in this field. Eudoksus, the famous scientist in the field of astronomy and mathematics, Euryphon the medical scientist, the painter Polygnotos and Sostratos, the architect of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, one of the seven wonders of the world, are thought to be from Knidos. Among the buildings to be seen in this ancient city today are the round temple, the Stoa and Temple of Dionysus, the Temple of Apollo, the Bolukrates Fountain and a small theater with a capacity of about 5,000.Via: @archeo.travel ___________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @ancient.road __________#archeotravel #archaeology #arqueologia #museitaliani #arteitaliana #sculpture #italia #beniculturali30 #escultura #statue #uffizi #louvre #historic #scultura #marmol #statua #arkeoloji #italianart #knidos #statues #marmol #tesori_italiani #beniculturali #italy #louvremuseum #romanempire #italianart #italianartist #greeks #britishmuseum #sanat #archeologia

name: 2019-09-24 23.49.33 2140072746525456279_britishmuseum.jpg
text: INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT THE BRITISH MUSEUM⠀💡The Museum had its own tube station for over 30 years.The station opened in 1900, but was closed in September 1933 when the new Holborn station opened.⠀💡The Museum gate was once guarded by a cat named Mike.He guarded the main gate between 1909 and 1929. When he died, his obituary appeared in the Evening Standard and TIME magazine.⠀💡The Museum’s collection was evacuated during the Second World War⠀💡Banksy had an unofficial exhibit at the MuseumIn May 2005, world-famous street artist Banksy snuck a rock depicting a caveman with a shopping trolley into the British Museum. It stayed there for two days before anyone noticed it.⠀💡Mozart visited the Museum in the 1760s.⠀📌Which fact surprised you the most? ⬇️
