text: Hogshead Air of John Bill Ricketts, oil on linen, 40cm x 35cm. Benefit night ticket designed in ink & wash by Thomas Bewick for Mr. Ricketts in 1789. Mr. Ricketts was an accomplished equestrian of his generation and in 1793 took the concept of the modern circus to America. Here, he will leap from two horses through a hogshead suspended in the Air, and then recover his situation, all with horses going full speed. #thomasbewick #newcastleartists #whatisart #nightticket #penandwashsketching #equestrian #equestrianrider #1789 #horseleap #earlycircushistory #royalcircus #theforth #theforthnewcastle #circuslane #engravings #woodengraving #britishmuseum #forthcircus #horsemen #thomasbewickbirthplace #discoverymuseum #northumberlandcounty #northumberlandarchives #cherryburn #baccaralaroux

text: Les journées pluvieuses sont faites pour se cultiver!🏛Conçue en collaboration avec le renommé British Museum de Londres, l’exposition « Momies égyptiennes » à l’affiche au MBAM nous propose une incursion au-delà des bandelettes, à mi-chemin entre archéologie, anthropologie et médecine, en allant à la rencontre de six momies dont les secrets de conservation ont été révélés grâce aux rayons X.🧬Avec son décor raffiné, ses traces de dorure sur le visage et ses yeux incrustés, le cartonnage de la dame Tayesmoutengebtiou (Tamout pour les intimes), pièce maîtresse de cette excellente expo, donne l’impression d’avoir été peint hier malgré ses presque trois mille ans. #MomiesÉgyptiennes #MBAM #mbamtl #museedesbeauxartsdemontreal #égypteancienne #momie #ancientegypt #britishmuseum #egyptianmummies #mtlmoments

name: 2019-09-25 01.35.29 2140126065121412731_britishmuseum.jpg
text: In my hunt for authentic Xi'an food in London, I tracked down Chef Wei at her latest venture, Bloomsbury restaurant Master Wei. The restaurant opened on March 15th 2019. "Because that's my birthday" says Wei with a smile.The area around the British Museum is filling up with Chinese restaurants. Master Wei is a five minute walk from the current home of the Elgin Marbles, located in a quiet side street with a pleasant outdoor seating area.The interior of the restaurant is bright and spacious. A bar with a map of Shaanxi province as a backdrop lines the rear wall. The guests are mostly Chinese with a few Westerners. Tilly, Wei's assistant says this is a great compliment "If the Chinese come, it means the flavour is authentic" she confides.Wei makes everything, and I mean EVERYTHING from scratch. She creates a spice water by boiling dried spices until they release their aromas. Her sauces are layered in flavour : she is careful with chilli and Sichuan peppercorn, lest they mask the more delicate notes in her dishes. Making the dough both for noodles and bread is a drawn-out process - with bursts of labour and long intervals where the dough must rest.Her dishes look so simple, but the effort that she puts into each component is huge. Highly recommended.Who can name all the spices in the photo?#masterwei #xianfood #foodwriter #foodblogger #xiancuisine #chineserestaurant #londonchinese #noodles #biangbiangnoodles #instafood #foodie #foodporn #foodgram #chefsofinstagram #cheflife #foodies #carbs #delicious #northernchinesefood #chinesefood #london #bloomsbury #londonrestaurants #chef #britishmuseum #londonfood #vegetarian #plantbased

name: 2019-09-25 02.22.42 2140149830224267844_britishmuseum.jpg
text: THE LYCURGUS CUP📍British museum, LondonTypology: Historical artefact/design elementYear: 4th-century A.D.Engineering means also chemistry and physics. The Lycurgus Cup is a Roman cup made of a particular glass, which shows a different colour depending on whether or not light is passing through it: red when lit from behind and green when lit from in front. This type of glass is a perfect example of "nanotechnology" that can be used for a structural project.

name: 2019-09-25 03.19.59 2140178659066238596_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Laurence Stephen Lowry RBA RA (1887- 1976)... The undisputed King of the North West!! 😍.Lowry is famous for painting scenes of life in the industrial districts of North West England in the mid-20th century. He developed a distinctive style of painting and is best known for his urban landscapes peopled with human figures often referred to as "matchstick men". He painted mysterious unpopulated landscapes, brooding portraits and the unpublished "marionette" works. Due to his use of stylized figures and the lack of weather effects in many of his landscapes he is sometimes characterized as a naïve..My favourite period of Lowry was  from 1925-1950 where he really captured the bleak English condition of the age. I also love his lonely, sparse, still seascapes but unfortunately got hounded for taking photos, so didn't get any photos of them... These are some of my favourite Lowry's seen in The Lowry Collection in Salford & the Manchester Art Gallery... A truly unique artist!!.#england #englishart #britishhistory#britishmuseum #britishart #britain #lowry #lslowry #naive #naiveart #stickfigures #modernist #modernart #modernism #salford #manchester #manchesterart #manchesterartgallery #salfordart #salfordartgallery #industrial #industrialart #interior #interiordesign  #london #europeanart #europe

name: 2019-09-25 03.40.01 2140188748825117904_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Repost @antiktarih (@get_repost)・・・Etrüsklere ait, bronz Minerva (Athena) figürini. M.Ö. 500 - 475, Umbria, İtalya. British Müzesi.Minerva, Roma Mitolojisinde bilgelik, şifa, sanat, bilim, ticaret, el sanatları ve savaş tanrıçasının adı olup, Etrüsk kökenli olmasına ve Numa döneminde (M.Ö. 715–673) Roma panteonuna kabul edilmesine karşın zamanla Yunan tanrıçası Athena ile özdeşleştirilmiştir. Jüpiter’in kızı olan bu tanrıça adına her yıl 19-23 Mart tarihinde Quinquatria’da festival düzenlenmekte ve Capitoline ile Aventine tepelerinde birer tapınağı bulunmaktaydı.Antik Çağ hakkında bilgilenmesini istediğiniz arkadaşlarınızı etiketleyerek, paylaşımlarımızı beğenerek ve yorum yaparak bize destek olabilirsiniz. 👉 @antiktarih_ 🇬🇧 Minerva as goddess of war, bronze figurine, early Etruscan, ca. 500 - 475 B.C. Umbria, Italy. British Museum.Minerva, in Roman religion, the goddess of handicrafts, the professions, the arts, and, later, war; she was commonly identified with the Greek Athena. Some scholars believe that her cult was that of Athena introduced at Rome from Etruria. This is reinforced by the fact that she was one of the Capitoline triad, in association with Jupiter and Juno. Her shrine on the Aventine in Rome was a meeting place for guilds of craftsmen, including at one time dramatic poets and actors.Follow us @antiktarih 👈_#antiktarih #arkeoloji #sanattarihi #mitoloji #britishmuseum #archaeology #archeology #archeologia #arqueologia #etruscan #archaeologylife

name: 2019-09-25 10.33.23 2140396800698879591_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The God AkerAker appears as a pair of twin lions, one named Duaj (meaning “yesterday”) and the other Sefer (meaning “tomorrow”). Aker was thus often titled “He who’s looking forward and behind”. Vignette from a papyrus, The Book of the Dead of Ani, Theban scribe,  frame 7. New Kingdom, 19th Dynasty, reign of Ramesses II, around 1250 BC. Now in the British Museum. EA 10470,7#ancientegypt #ancientegyptianblog #egypt #kemet #egittologia #madeinegypt #egyptianart #worldart #civilization #african #archeology #egyptology #egyptian #antiguoegipto #iloveegypt #visitegypt #ancientegyptian #ancientegyptiancivilization #hieroglyphs #egiptian #egipt #ancient #ancienthistory #ancientkemet #ancient #ancientegyptians #loveegypt #britishmuseum #godaker #egyptianbookofthedead #kemeticyoga

text: Reposted from @archeo.travel (@get_regrann) -  6000 yıllık Sonsuz AşkValdaro Aşıkları 🌸❣️___________________Kimsenin haberi olmadan 6000 yıldır toprak altında bile aşklarını sürdüren, biribirlerine sarılı halde bulunan ve 20 yaşlarında olduğu tahmin edilen bu iki genç 2007 yılında Elena Maria Menotti’nin önderliğinde İtalya’nın kuzey lombardiya bölgesindeki Mantova yakınlarında bulundu._____6000 years of Infinite LoveValdaro of Lovers🌸❣️___________________These two young people, who have kept their love even under the earth for 6,000 years without anyone knowing, were found to be around 20 years old, were found in 2007 near Mantova in the northern part of Italy, under the leadership of Elena Maria Menotti.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel ______Contact Pages : @basileons ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte # #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #volgoarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #masterpieces #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum #gothic #love

name: 2019-09-25 15.07.17 2140534655416467543_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Sometimes it's the tiniest of objects that tell the greatest stories.This piece of roof tile has been in a serious fire. It's blackened, twisted and almost vitrified on one side. I picked it up from the foreshore in central London, almost exactly where Samuel Pepys sat off shore in a boat 353 years ago watching London burn. For four long days the Great Fire raged through the City and the docks along the riverside. It destroyed 13,500 houses and 87 churches, and burned the wings of the pigeons that roosted in their eaves so that they fell down into the inferno below. Liquid lead from the roof of Old St Paul's ran through the streets and the fire was so hot it melted steel that was stored in the docks.When the fire was over, London was in ashes. A city that was made of wood was rebuilt in brick and stone. The charred rubble it left behind was used to fill holes and taken east by the cartload to stabilise the marshes at Wapping. In the turmoil some might have been dumped in the river, which is how this burned fragment of roof tile, with its round hole for the wooden peg that once held it on the roof of a medieval building, ended up on the foreshore.#Londonmudlark #Mudlark #Mudlarking #Mudlarkingbook

name: 2019-09-25 15.20.30 2140541306636402885_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ Theatre of War promoter Grace @_boginka_ wearing a shirt displaying a design based on on the early 7th century AD "Dancing-Warrior" pressblech from the helmet found in Mound 1 at Sutton Hoo, Suffolk, England.The "Dancing Warriors" or "Spear Dancers"  image is shown on many artefacts found across Northern Europe and is believed to be emblematic of a religious ceremony invoking Odin (Woden/Wotan). This is symbolised by the dancer's headwear being comprised of two birds, believed to be Odin's ravens (Huginn & Munnin) terminating in the centre.  The earliest known images made by Germanic people's alluding to the weapon dancer's is the sword dancers from Flimlingoje in East Sealand, Denmark. The motifs are embossed on gilt silver foils on a pair of 3rd century  AD cups, showing naked dancers leaping with drawn swords and animals bound about in scenes full of life and ecstasy. Many further examples are shown on scenes from the 5th century AD Gallehus Horns, the 6th century AD bronze cast plates from Björnhovda in Torslunda on Öland, the fragmentary 7th century AD silver foil from Caenby, Lincolnshire and on the 7th century AD silver foil from Obrigheim, Germany.#theatreofwarclothing#ironage #ironagehistory #suttonhoo #nationalmuseet #britishmuseum #britishhistory #britishart #britisharchaeology #germanic  #wolfwarrior #northerneuropean  #germanicironage #sweden_nature #sweden🇸🇪 #nationalmuseet #nationalmuseetcopenhagen #nationalmuseumstockholm #swedishhistory #icelandicsagas #vikingtattoo #northeurope

name: 2019-09-25 15.30.56 2140546562812363265_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ History enthusiast and German Viking reenactor Tobi @tobi_schnobi wearing the Spear Dancer T-shirt.The design is based on one of four cast bronze 6th-8th century AD pressblechs from Torslunda, Öland, Sweden showing a"spear dancer"image believed to emulating a religious procession in honour of Odin (Woden-Wotan), with a Úlfhéðnar or wolf-coat.#theatreofwarclothing#suttonhoo #suttonhoohelmet #roman #romanhistory #anglosaxon #anglosaxons #saxon #ukarchaeology #britisharchaeology #englishheritage #germanic #vendel #lombards #langobards #bracteate #britishmuseum #englishheritage #england🇬🇧 #norway #vikinghistory #germanicironage #livinghistory #denmark #nationalmuseet #nationalmuseetstockholm #danishnationalmuseum #danishhistory #torslunda #woden

name: 2019-09-25 16.51.02 2140585900843744770_britishmuseum.jpg
text: INTERNATIONAL COMICS⁣⁣Did you know that comics have been enjoyed across the world from as early as 1200CE? On #nationalcomicbookday, we’re looking back to ‘Manga マンガ’, an exhibition which closed just last month at the British Museum. ⁣⁣The largest exhibition of Manga outside of Japan, it presented the dynamic interplay between art and storytelling captured in this global graphic phenomenon.⁣⁣Images left to right:Tale of the Monkeys (Artist unknown), Untitled (Katsushika Hokusai), Garo Magazine. All images courtesy of @britishmuseum⁣

text: Issue 16 of our spin-off show Four Colour Corner is now in the regular podcast feed! @benecilin, @garbzy talk about their time in London checking out the the British Library’s Manga Exhibition and Japan House’s Naoki Urasawa Exhibit. @kentuckyzissoufly discusses his journey reading the Judge Dredd Case Files and Mister Miracle and that’s not all! name: 2019-09-25 18.11.53 2140627567380380739_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This dazzling gold object was made for a member of the imperial family in China in the early 1400s. It was part of a pair that were used to decorate the ends of a pillow.The design features two dragons and the object is inlaid with semi-precious stones imported to China from Southeast Asia, India and Sri Lanka – all important places for Chinese trade during the Ming dynasty.See this object on display and discover more about Chinese history in Room 33.#BritishMuseum #China #ChineseHistory #gold #gemstones #art #design #London #Museum #Ming

name: 2019-09-25 18.53.41 2140648607760571692_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Kerrrrrrang!.Manga is a contradiction. It’s a global phenomenon but is still deeply rooted in Japanese culture. It’s big business too but with enough genres to cater for tastes from the everyday to the perverse. But trying to make sense of all of manga’s contradictions can result in more hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang. It’s best to find your own corner of the manga world to enjoy.If you’re interested in reading more, my article ‘More hrrrrrumph than kerrrrrang! The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ’ can be found by clicking the link in the bio (August 2019).Colossal Titan from ‘Attack of the Titans’ (originally featured in Naruto by Kishimoto Masahi b. 1974) from The Citi Exhibition Manga マンガ at the British Museum, London from 23rd May to 26th August 2019 (personal photo).#manga #anime #hokusai #katushikahokusai #kyosai #kawanabekyosai #hagio #motohagio #tagame #gengorotagame #britishmuseum #japan #japaneseart #talkingaboutart #art

name: 2019-09-25 20.01.27 2140682718258654730_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Üzerinde Grekçe “Neşe” yazan iskeletli mozaik. Roma dönemi, MS 3. yüzyıl. 2013 yılında Antiocheia Antik Kenti’nde bir evin yemek odasında bulundu. Antakya, Hatay.Hafifçe uzanarak bir yastığa dayanmış, bir elinde içki kabı tutan iskeletin yanında şarap amforası, ekmek ve Grekçe “Neşe” kelimesi bulunuyor.________________ The skeleton mosaic with the Greek word “euphrosynos” (meaning Cheer). From the Roman era in the third century AD. Found in 2013 in the dining room of a house in the ancient city of Antiocheia. Hatay, Turkey.Next to the skeleton, which is leaning on a pillow and holding a drink container, is a wine amphora, two loaves of bread and the Greek word “euphrosynos.” ______________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road _______#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #greekisland #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum #greekmythology #ancient

text: We must have a thing for Equestrian statues at #thatmuse ... this is our #Louvre meeting point. If stretched out, the #paris grandfather to museums would measure 8 miles. Too small for the likes of Louis XIV, the man on the horse (by none other than Bernini). Our British Museum Start Point is a Roman equestrian prince, under Norman Foster’s glass ceiling. Also filled with triangles, like IM Pei’s Louvre pyramid. . . . . . .#equestrian #statue #sculpture #louisxiv #pyramid #louvrepyramid #igersparis #paris_enthusiasts #parisjetaime #britishmuseum #treasurehunting #treasurehunt #museum #museumfun #museums #impei #normanfoster #london #tourism #travelingfamilies

name: 2019-09-26 00.04.30 2140799071345123438_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This piece was created based on a sketch form the British Museum, I was drawing the Sekhmet statues, spent a lot of time looking, with my thoughts wandering aimlessly. The Egyptian section of the museum is always so busy, but I find the cool stone statues extremely atmospheric and I was always drawn to these strong anthrophomorphic female statues. I started resarching wwax anatomical models at the time and reading about the anatomical Venuses of the European 18th century anatomical collections. My brain couldn't resist the idea of combining the two, especially with the ancient Egyptianss relationship to anatomy. Swipe right for detail #draing #polychromos #colouringpencils #graphite #britishmuseum #sekhmet #goddess #egyptian #egyptiansculpture #dissection #anatomicalvenus #anatomicalmodel

name: 2019-09-26 00.30.31 2140818140222010320_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Британский музей завораживает. Не думаю, что реально посмотреть такую богатую экспозицию меньше, чем за неделю. Подлиники Рафаэля и Леонардо, античные скульптуры, настольные игры древних правителей, редчайшая коллекция  монет и часовых механизмов, знаменитая статуя с острова Пасхи Хоа-Хакананайя, Розеттский камень, уникальные шахматы с острова Льюис и многое-многое другое... блестяще! Сердце империи по праву собрало все лучшее. А меня в этот раз почему-то особенно увлекла Африка. Такие яркие маски, атмосферные костюмы и сочные цвета. Категорически рекомендую. Вход, кстати, абсолютно бесплатный) #uk #gbr #london #england #britain #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-26 02.10.50 2140868631242964819_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Liverpool... I'm having a ripper time up North. Manchester was great, but Liverpool knocked my socks off!! Unbelievable town so rich with history and the architecture on par with Paris or Rome....The Walker Art Gallery has the best collection of Victorian and Pre-Raphaelite art I've ever seen... Even many artists which are prevalent in the Belle Epoque Collection like Albert Moore, Henry Fuseli, George Romney, David Hockney, Frederick Leighton, Gustave Dore & John William Waterhouse!! Plus the Glasgow Boys & Sickert!! And everything is The Beatles... I'm still giddy from my day visit. I will visit again soon, what a city!! 😍.#england #englishart #britishhistory#britishmuseum #britishart #britain #lowry #lslowry #naive #naiveart #stickfigures #modernist #modernart #modernism #thebeatles #manchester #manchesterart #manchesterartgallery #livepool #walkerartgallery #industrial #industrialart #interior #interiordesign  #london #europeanart #europe

text: I laughed so hard when I saw this tiny figurine😂 I almost missed it but the Spirit Babies said "wait wait wait!", put their tiny hands on my face and turned my head to look at it.Take a moment to look at the figurine. Do you see the woman and the angel (SB) around a clock? The woman (the DFs) are trying to figure out when divine timing will release their unions (the SB are showing me the DFs saying "is it here yet? How about now? Is it here?"😂), meanwhile the SB are doing that 'what the heck face' (swipe for meme reference) and they're saying "it's in DIVINE timing, not YOUR timing" (they're showing me Hermione saying "it's LeviOsa, not LevioSA" for reference😂). Real talk: who else has been questioning when union is coming? I know I do it sometimes, especially when I'm guided not to date other people. By the way, this is actually a porcelain scent bottle c. Late 1700s #spiritbabies #divinetiming #divinefeminine #union #hermione #cheeky #spiritualjourney #london #Britishmuseum #porcelain #scentbottle

text: #Wcw to my dear friend Christine who whisked me away to England and Scotland twice over the past 4 years. Highclere Castle was a major highlight. Thank you @johnaash for an absolutely incredible private tour of the castle and grounds. Johna is an actor and was in most of the Harry Potter films. I am wearing my British Museum hieroglyphics scarf in honor of the discovery of King Tut’s tomb by Lord Carnarvon (5th Earl of Carnarvon) of Highclere and Howard Carter, 1922. Alnwick Castle (4th photo) took my breath away. Downton Abbey and Harry Potter filmed here. Thank you Christine. Unforgettable!!! #HighclereCastle #AlnwickCastle #DowntonAbbey #TV #Series #JulianFellows #HarryPotter #England #Film #BritishMuseum #KingTutankhamun #KingTut #LordCarnarvon #HowardCarter #Archaeology #Egyptology #Hieroglyphics 👑

Sus colecciones abarcan campos diversos del saber humano, como la historia, la arqueología, la etnografía y el arte. name: 2019-09-26 09.53.41 2141101596510944545_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 雖然一早就被大雨搞得要搭uber 才能出門 但是到大英就結束下雨了排隊過安檢 帶小包包一切方便 不用買門票超值埃及區真的好神奇 看到真實木乃伊太酷了 進去到處看都有一種很感動的感覺 但是因為要趕著去市集所以只看了一點點就離開了 下次再去慢慢看到市集的時候已經快結束了嗚嗚 但是有很多古著跟小吃還有各種攤販 人好多 還有街頭賣藝！看到很多打扮很酷的人 大家都很活得自己 不用在意別人的眼光～最後去了倫敦塔橋 剛好夕陽下山 雖然有點陰天 但是完全不影響美麗的景觀嗚嗚 在旁邊慢慢走慢慢拍照慢慢散步就覺得好幸福了！#leedsuniversity #插畫 #繪畫 #手繪 #電繪 #淳的英國留學日常 #ipencil #ipadpro #淳淳art #倫敦 #london #view #towerbridge #britishmuseum  #market

name: 2019-09-26 14.47.29 2141249468257843013_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Feel privileged to have my portrait and a selection of finds featured in the Foragers of the Foreshore exhibition, the most expansive display of artefacts recovered from the Thames ever staged. It's taking place at the Bargehouse, Oxo Wharf until this Sunday..Each mudlark featured has been interviewed about the attractions of searching the foreshore and their favourite finds. Myself and @edjbucknall can be heard chatting 17th Century boozing, roman hair pins, medieval harp music, Soviet WW2 ammo, prehistoric beads and suitable footwear among other topics, at the link below:.https://totallythames.org/foragers/ed-bucknall-malcolm-russell.Shouts out to awesome photographer @han_smiles who braved a cold February foreshore to accompany me on a nightlark, conceiver and curator of the exhibition @flo_finds,  @totallythames who have made Foragers a key part of this year's Thames Festival and the entire mudlarking community..#mudlarkingfinds #mudlarking #mudlark #beachcombing #seaglass #totallythames #london #riverthames #southbank #oxotower #treasurehunting #vintage #archaeology #britishmuseum #museumoflondon #metaldetecting #metaldetctingfinds #antique #beachcombing #foundobjects #foundobject #art #tatemodern #tudor #history #historylesson #arthistory

name: 2019-09-26 16.24.21 2141298220758886073_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This is the smallest stoneware ink pot I’ve ever found. Usually they are the size of the larger one in the second picture and look very much like pork pies. Before the 19th century ink production was pretty much a cottage industry, but with the increasing number of people able to write, more ink was needed and production was commercialised.Stoneware ink pots like this, corked and sealed with wax, were sold for just a penny. Stoneware ink bottles had the benefit of keeping the ink away from the light.#Londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking

text: #caadevents: "A View From Cairo" with Mohamed El-Shahed the curator of the British Museum's Modern Egypt Project and Egypt's winning pavilion, Modernist Indignation, at the 2018 London Design Biennale. He blogged at cairobserver.com from 2011 to 2016 with six printed issues of the magazine by the same name. ⁣​⁣​He is the author of Cairo Since 1900: An Architectural Guide (AUC Press, January 2020), the first comprehensive survey of Cairo's modern architecture.⁣​⁣​This lecture is free and open to the public.⁣​⁣​⁣​⁣​#caadaus #caadlectures #Egypt #Cairo #curation #narratives #BritishMuseum #london #NationalPavilion #ModernArchitecture #guide #AUC #urbanism #Cairobserver #magazines #blogger #author #print #issues #AUSharjah #sharjah #designschool

name: 2019-09-26 16.38.44 2141305460840593385_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ⁣⁣⁣⁣📌 Mayaların bizim bildiğimiz DC Comics karakteri Batman'den 2500 yıl önce Camazotz adında, insan vücuduna sahip ancak yarasa kafalı bir tanrıya inandıklarını biliyor muydunuz ?⁣⁣⁣Maya mitolojisinde Camazotz adındaki yarasa tanrıya ulaşmamız mümkün. Ancak fotoğtafta gördüğünüz Mayalara ait antik bir eser değil. Bu eser 2014 yılında sanatçı Kimball tarafından yapıldı ve Meksika Tasarım Müzesi'nde sergilenmekte.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣⁣ 〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️ Did you know that the ancient Maya worshiped Camazotz - a god that had the body of a person, the head of a bat and pointy ears – long before DC Comics introduced us to Batman, 2,500 years ago to be precise?⁣⁣⁣⁣A bat god named Camazotz can be found in Mayan mythology, but this image does not depict an ancient sculpture made by the Mayans. This is actually a modern artwork created in 2014 by the artist Kimball for an exhibit at the Mexican Museum of Design.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️Via: @arkeomega Follow us for more : @archeo.travel @ancient.road 〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️ #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia ⁣⁣⁣⁣

name: 2019-09-26 18.49.26 2141371243356842123_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Cosplay Journal Vol 4 – PRE-ORDER NOW!It’s finally time, volume 4 of The Cosplay Journal is coming! And it’s bigger than ever! Featuring an exclusive interview with Nicole Rousmaniere the curator of The British Museum’s Citi Manga Exhibition, and a photoshoot in The British Museum itself!On top of this, this volume looks at how cosplay can positively help your mental health and wellbeing with an interview with Wish Godmother who uses cosplay to combat her PTSD, as well as talking with disabled cosplay activist Ekko Cosplay about how disability is viewed in the geek community. Woodsmoke and Words tells us about gender and cosplay and what it’s like being a non-binary cosplayer with help from an amazing group of trans non-binary costume makers.There are all the regular features and much more in volume 4!The Cosplay Journal is a coffee table periodical focusing on the Diversity and Craft of cosplay. We want to show that not only can anyone from any walk of life be involved in cosplay, but also that we are all capable of learning new skills, creating amazing things and bringing joy into our own and other people’s lives through the art form of costume making.The Cosplay Journal’s mission is to dispel the myths about cosplay and cosplayers, as well as promoting cosplay as way into a new world and maybe even a new career.The Cosplay Journal Vol 4 features 100 pages of stunning photography, interviews and articles and is available to pre-order now from the links on the News page on our website (link in bio) now!https://markosia.com/2019/09/26/the-cosplay-journal-vol-4-pre-order-now/#markosia #cosplay #costume #captainmarvel #ukcosplay #discworld #manga #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-26 20.19.04 2141416355614765984_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Stasera alle 21 vi aspettiamo sul nostro Canale Twitch ( www.twitch.tv/progettogaming ), poiché abbiamo ricevuto l'invito per un evento più che esclusivo! Una Oneshot orchestrata dalla nostra ospite Alessia Sagnotti (@smiling_marauder ) vincitrice di un nostro contest tenutosi durante la campagna di Journey di Ragnarok. Insieme a lei, a comporre il party di investigatori, ci saranno gli altri due vincitori del contest, Ilaria Corbelli e Andrea Bergamelli (@andre.driziel ) di Fantasika (@fantasika_group ), accompagnati dal nostro anfitrione Elvis Lupo, e Gabriele Tacito, master proprio della nostra ultima campagna a tema norreno. Fateci compagnia, poiché ci aspettiamo strani ed inspiegabili avvenimenti in questa visita del British Museum!#gdr #mondoditenebra #britishmuseum#art

name: 2019-09-26 21.46.26 2141460334946631612_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Celebrating 25 years of Iniva⠀⠀The 1994 exhibition ‘Time Machine: Ancient Egypt and Contemporary Art’ contested the idea that ancient Egyptian artefacts, held by the British Museum, were stagnant remnants of the past, disconnected from the present.⠀⠀Installed in the vast Egyptian Sculpture gallery, the works by twelve artists achieved a rare juxtaposition of ancient and contemporary art. Featured artists included: Liliane Karnouk, Rita Keegan, Marc Quinn, Peter Randall-Page, Alexander Mihaylovich, David Hiscock, Igor Mitroraj, Jiri Kolar, Kate Whiteford, Martin Riches, Stephen Cox, Andy Goldsworthy and James Putnam.⠀⠀Image credit: Liliane Karanouk, 1994, detail of installation showing railings, test-tubes with palms,and side of the sarcophagus decorated with frieze of gods.⠀⠀#Iniva25 #timemachine #contemporaryart #exhibition #britishmuseum⠀#LilianeKarnouk #RitaKeegan #MarcQuinn #PeterRandallPage #AlexanderMihaylovich #DavidHiscock #IgorMitroraj #JiriKolar #KateWhiteford #MartinRiches #StephenCox #AndyGoldsworthy #JamesPutnam

text: ▶︎2019.09.06-16◀︎✈️茂津目旅行記22(イギリス①)✈️飛行機は空飛ぶ冷蔵庫と呼ばれる理由が分かった気がしました❄️去年の教訓を活かしてジェラピケを持っていって来ていたら隣の女の子たちに笑われました💃結局は寒がっていたから貸してあげるジェントルマンを発揮したんですが！🕺初日は定番観光地をかなり回りましたね！まずは、大英博物館にロビンを連れて行くの忘れたので、ポーネグリフ(ロゼッタストーン)を解読できませんでした😂次にトラファルガー広場でたくさんの外国人と仲良くなりました👨‍🦰👨🏻‍🦰👨🏼‍🦰👨🏽‍🦰👨🏾‍🦰👨🏿‍🦰ライオンの顔の中に頭を入れる人はケニア人だけでしょう🇰🇪これで、神優大のミスターコン連覇に死角はありません🥇そのあとは、ナショナルギャラリーに入ってゴッホとマネの絵を鑑賞したのですが、神優大の絵とあんまり変わりません🖼次に国会議事堂付近を探索しましたが、若者がデモを起こしていたので、とても怖い思いをしました。＊でーもん閣下に似た人に声をかけられた🦹‍♂️もづランドは世界では知名度なし🥰＊#イギリス #イギリス旅行 #ロンドン #ロンドン旅行 #大英博物館 #ロゼッタストーン #トラファルガー広場 #ナショナルギャラリー #ウェストミンスター寺院 #ウェストミンスター宮殿 #旅行#unitedkingdom #britishmuseum #london #trafalgarsquare #nationalgallery #westminster #trip #いいね返し #いいね #いいね返しは絶対 #lll #l4l #fff #f4f

name: 2019-09-26 22.43.51 2141489229843330581_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Ετρουσκική σαρκοφάγος της αριστοκράτισσας Seianti Hanunia Tlesnasa | 250-150 π.Χ.▪︎Αυτό το αριστούργημα ετρουσκικής τέχνης βρέθηκε το 1886 κοντά στην Τοσκάνη και πουλήθηκε, μαζί με τα περιεχόμενά του (το σκελετό και κτερίσματα) στο Βρετανικό Μουσείο.Η νεκρή Seianti, το όνομα της οποία αναγράφεται στη βάση της σαρκοφάγου, θα πρέπει να ανήκε στις πιο πλούσιες οικογένειες του Chiusi. Απεικονίζεται ως ώριμη γυναίκα η οποία γέρνει αναπαυτικά πάνω σε μαξιλάρι. Με το ένα χέρι προσαρμόζει το πέπλο της, ενώ στο άλλο κρατάει έναν καθρέφτη, ατενίζοντας στο βάθος.▪︎Painted sarcophagus of Seianti Hanunia Tlesnasa | 250-150 BCE▪︎The brightly painted sarcophagus of the Etruscan aristocratic woman Seianti was discovered in 1886 near Tuscany and was subsequently sold, along with its contents (a skeleton and some grave belongings), to the British Museum. The deceased woman's name is inscribed in Etruscan along the base of the chest. She must have belonged to one of the richest families of Chiusi. She has been depicted as a mature lady, who gestures to adjust her veil. She leans against a pillow and holds a mirror in her other hand, gazing into the distance.▪︎#archaeologicalmuseum #archaeologia #archaeology #archaeologylife #historylovers #archaeologylove #museum #museum_lovers #etruscanart #history #britishmuseum #etruscan #antiquity #sculptures #art #arthistory #culture #storiantica #throwback #london #historia #museumsaroundtheworld #archaeologist #ancientcivilization #artefacts #historicalplace #igworldclub_archaeology #sarcophagus

name: 2019-09-26 22.49.39 2141492148204255667_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Vezüv Yanardağı, MS 79'dan bu yana, 172, 203, 222'de, muhtemelen 303'te, 379, 472, 512, 536, 685, 787, 860, 900, 968, 991, 999, 1006, 1037, 1049’da, 1073, 1139, 1150 ve 1270, 1347 ve 1500'de patladı.Yanardağ, 1631'de, 18. yüzyılda altı kez (1779 ve 1794 dahil), 19. yüzyılda sekiz kez ve 1906, 1929 ve 1944'te tekrar patladı.1944'ten beri hiç patlama olmadı ve MS 79'dan sonraki patlamaların hiçbiri Pompei'yi küle gömen patlama kadar büyük ya da yıkıcı değildi._______________Since AD 79, the Vesuvius has erupted repeatedly, in 172, 203, 222, possibly in 303, 379, 472, 512, 536, 685, 787, 860, 900, 968, 991, 999, 1006, 1037, 1049, 1073, 1139, 1150, and there may have been eruptions in 1270, 1347, and 1500. The volcano erupted again in 1631, six times in the 18th century (including 1779 and 1794), eight times in the 19th century, and in 1906, 1929 and 1944. There have been no eruptions since 1944, and none of the eruptions after AD 79 were as large or destructive as the Pompeian one.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us @archeo.travel @ancient.road @ancient.road ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #pompeii #storiadellarte #volgoarte #heritage #artes #museos #greekmythology #vesuvius #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: Yesterday was my first day off in a while and definitely feel I made the most of it. Belatedly made it to the @vamuseum Food: Bigger Than The Plate exhibition where I particularly liked the vintage orange wrappers (not pictured but beautiful) and the algorithm-created canapé. ⁣⁣Then hand-pulled noodles, XinJiang Style for lunch at @master.wei.3150 and the Pushing Paper drawing exhibition at the @britishmuseum ⁣⁣Last - but not least - a joyful evening at @brasseriezedel @thecrazycoqspresents with At The Drop Of A Hippopotamus, Tim FitzHigham and Duncan Walsh Atkins’ Flanders & Swann tribute act. Had never heard the Heal’s mention in Design For Living before!⁣Back to work today but feeling revived. ⁣⁣#dayoff #biggerthantheplate #vamuseum #britishmuseum #noodles #masterwei #timfitzhigham #duncanwalshatkins #flandersandswann

name: 2019-09-27 01.03.02 2141559279979560047_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Käthe Kollwitz ‘Self Portrait’ 1902 and 1924 ‘Call of Death’ 1937 It is a fortunate coincidence that the @britishmuseum is showing a selection of Käthe Kollwitz prints at the same time as the exhibition on Helene Schjerfbeck @royalacademyarts. These two great women artists were not only contemporaries but they both produced a number of scrutinising and strong Self-Portraits throughout their lives.It is interesting to compare their self portraits which share an uncompromising way of confronting age and mortality reflecting the intensity and darkness of the troubled times they both lived through.#käthekollwitz #britishmuseum #exhibition #portraitofanartist #selfportrait #selbstbildnis #prints #druckgraphik  #departmentofdrawingsandprints #lithograph #callofdeath #RufdesTodes #heleneschjerfbeck #royalacademy #comparison #womenartists #germanartist #finnishartist #womanartist #femaleartist #künstlerin #troubledtimes

name: 2019-09-27 02.23.05 2141599568624870124_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Elegant Lady with a Bouquet of Roses..🎨 Painted by Emile Vernon.Born: 14 March 1872, Blois, France.Died: 31 January 1920, Blois, France. (aged 48).📝 First studied design at the School of Fine Arts in Tours where he won the first prize for design in 1888 at the age of sixteen.He moved to Paris when he was eighteen to study with the famed teachers and artists, William Bouguereau and Auguste Trupheme at the Ecole Des Beaux Arts.In 1898, he had two exhibitions, first, he participated at The Exposition of Fine Arts and Decorative Arts in Paris and later the same year exhibited at the Salon des Artistes Francais, and from then on, Emile Vernon exhibited regularly at the Paris Salon from 1898 to 1913.Vernon specialised in painting portraits and genre scenes.The fact that he mastered the graphics of his work, and painted the lighting in a clever, seductive manner, made his portraits charming and of a very high quality, and are much in demand in the America, Canada, and Japan.Emile Vernon also received numerous commissions for decorative murals as well as oil painting for the theater of Chatellerault in 1898. He also created paintings for the Nevers Theater. In 1904, he exhibited at The Royal Academy in London the floral painting Roses. Emile Vernon died in 1920 at the age of 48..(Fig 2, 3, 4: Details)...#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #bouquet #roses #emilevernon #blois #france #yourarttimes

text: La momificación en el Antiguo Egipto es el proceso por el que se impedía a un cadáver que llegase a su putrefacción natural. Se inscribía en un complejo ritual funerario egipcio en este mismo el cuerpo era identificado por los ritos de Osiris pensaban en la inmortalidad, Osiris lo protegían de los espíritus malignos.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: La momificación.Tras comprobar que la persona estaba muerta, los embalsamadores limpiaban el cuerpo, sacaban los órganos y las vísceras de las cavidades interiores y extraían el cerebro por la nariz con un gancho, pues pensaban que el único órgano que se necesitaba una vez muerto era el corazón. text: Two Chelsea porcelain cane handles of tau form, decorated with European flowers in the Meissen style (deutsche Blumen), the terminals modelled as a fashionable lady and a comic figure.-Dating from the Red Anchor period, 1750s.-On display at the British Museum.-Intended to express affection and esteem, cane handles were made as luxury gifts to be exchanged between ladies and gentlemen of fashion.-Please visit the JunoAntiques.com website for a selection of 18th Century porcelain cane handles available to purchase. Link in bio.-#junoantiques #antiqueporcelain #britishmuseum #canehandle #chelseaporcelainfactory #deutscheblumen #stcloudporcelain #stcloudporcelaine #chelseaporcelain #saintcloudporcelain #saintcloudporcelaine #18thcenturyfashion #18thcentury #chelseaporcelainworks #walkingcane #walkingcanes #walkingstick #meissenstyle #swaggerstick #luxuryporcelain

text: "...ed Elio infaticato, c'hè simile in tutto ai Celesti,ed ai mortali e ai Numi d'Olimpo la luce partisce,sopra il suo carro movendo. Terribili fulgono gli occhidi sotto all'elmo d'oro, scintillano lucidi raggi,sfavillando da lui, d'intorno alle tempie, le chiomelucide, ombreggiano giù dal capo l'amabile voltolungi veggente, lampeggia sul corpo una fulgida veste,fine lavoro, ai soffi del vento; e quando i cavallie il carro dall'aureo giogo dirige a vespro, dalle cime del cielo entro ai gorghi del mare."-Inni Omerici, "Inno a Elio"#elio #helios #godofthesun#godofsun #diodelsole #omero #inniomerici #innoaelio #sunchariot #carrodelsole #calyxkrater #cratere #cratereacalice #britishmuseum #londra #london #vacanza #vacanze #fotodarchivio

name: 2019-09-27 06.00.12 2141708853933711508_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Thirty years ago to the day, aged twenty six, I took a #RoyalJordanian flight from #KuwaitCity to #London in order to pursue my postgraduate studies in 'Aquatic Resource Management' at King's College London.I was unable to continue my studies, largely due to an overwhelming sense of 'ancestral' loss, and the questioning of whether or not I was meant to be a biologist. I left college after passing my exams (2A's & 1B), and my professor encouraged me to hand in my thesis the following year.Then, #SaddamHussein decided to invade the land of my formative years, and the whole world collapsed on my already crushed head. Overnight, I became homeless, penniless, and nation-less. The darkest hour of my life to date.Working as a musician at the much lamented #MuseumOfMankind of the  #BritishMuseum for the #PalestinianCostumeExhibition saved my life - literally so. It helped turn me into a musicologist; and so the 'ology' travelled from 'Bio' to 'Music'! Being an independent musician remains the greatest struggle. More than any other! Contrary to what many may believe, being based in the #UK as a practitioner of the #neocolonialist tag that's (so)called #WorldMusic has hindered my career, rather than help it. It's time for shedding, and for a possibly different career.Life has not been easy since I 'returned' to the land of my birth, and yet, I am grateful for each and every day. I am grateful to my husband, my in-laws, my neighbours and my friends for giving me a permanent makeshift home that is floating somewhere between #Palestine and #Kuwait.As for the latter, I feel it's time to open the golden box in which I hid it all these years. I simply wanted to protect myself from all the pain of what had happened to my family and childhood friends as a result of a reckless and evil invasion that has left the #MiddleEast in the gory state of chaos we're all witnessing today. Thank you, dear God, for everything!#26September1989 #26September2019 #HomePhoto: #BoushahriPhotoStudio, Salmiya, Kuwait, 1989

text: VASOS CANOPOSExistían cuatro tipos de vasos canopos que, a su vez, venían a representar a los hijos de Horus: Amset, la vasija con cabeza humana, preservaba el hígado; Hapy era el vaso que poseía la tapa con forma de cabeza de papión y en él se guardaban los pulmones; Kebeshenuef era la vasija con cabeza de halcón, para albergar los intestinos, y Duamutef tenía forma de chacal y conservaba el estómago del muerto.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: Cyrus Cylinder 539 - 530BC.This clay cylinder was found in the ruins of Babylon (present day Iraq). The cuneiform text retells the biblical account for what happened to the Israelites after the Persian conquest. Many other artefacts found in the @britishmuseum bring the Bible to life in the 21st century! name: 2019-09-27 06.38.54 2141728334345317488_britishmuseum.jpg
text: El embalsamamientoembalsamar significa literalmente “introducir en bálsamo”; procede también del término senefer, cuyo significado sería “volver a dar vigor”, Se introducía el cadáver en un recipiente especial lleno de natrum o natrón, líquido viscoso que mana de ciertas montañas en la provincia de Fayun.Pasados los 70 días rituales, el cadáver era retirado del recipiente de natrón y mostraba una integridad tan perfecta, que hasta las pestañas y las cejas permanecen intactos, cambiando muy poco el aspecto del cuerpo. Se le trenzaba el cabello y le ponían ojos esmaltados; se lavaba el cuerpo con natrón líquido y lo embadurnaban con óleos perfumados. Recubrían el cadáver con resina fundida y teñían los dedos con alheña; ya estaba todo preparado para la complicada ceremonia ritual del vendaje.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia#mummy #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: LAS MASCARAS FUNERARIAS EN EL ANTIGUO EGIPTOLa técnica que se utilizó para elaborar los moldes de estas máscaras de los muertos es conocida como cartonaje. A base de capas que incluían lino, fibras de madera diferentes y un yeso a base de cal, esta técnica egipcia  fue evolucionando con los siglos, con ella  se elbaboraban magníficos moldes humanos sobre los rostos de los difuntos.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon#funeral mask #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-27 13.58.28 2141949566358690233_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 8.25. @ #london #hillsongchurch #shakeshack #britishmuseum #tatemodern #thaifood #busaba #coventgardenmarket 영국 여행의 마지막날! 아침부터 부랴부랴 예배드리러 힐송처치를 다녀왔다.  시드니에 이어 두번째로 다른 나라의 힐송교회를 가본택인데, 시드니보다 작긴 하지만 분위기는 비슷했다! 세션이 잘 갖춰져있어서 개인적으로는 훨씬 더 짜임새있고 꽉 찬 느낌이었다. 예배마친 후 근처에서 쉑쉑버거를 먹고 (역시나 육즙이 탁월함) 저번 런던방문에서 아쉽게 많이 둘러보지 못했던 대영박물관에서 가이드 투어를 두개 정도 선택해서 한 다음, 마지막 날이라 아쉬워서 테이트모던에도 문닫을때 쯤 들어가서 후루룩 보고 왔다(엄청 바쁜 일정, 여유를 찾을 수 없음ㅋㅋㅋ) 영국에서의 마지막 저녁식사로는 국물이 있고, 매콤한 음식이 있는 태국음식을 먹으러 갔다. ‘부사바’라는 음식점인데, 생각보다 많이 알려진 곳이었어서 약 30분정도 웨이팅을 했었어야 했지만, 그만큼 맛있었다.

name: 2019-09-27 14.39.51 2141970397493589749_britishmuseum.jpg
text: A Girl in the Garden (c.1881).🎨 Painted by Olga Wisinger-Florian.Born: 1 November 1844, Vienna, Austria.Died: 27 February 1926, Grafenegg, Austria. (aged 81).🖼 Oil on canvas 38,5 x 31,5 cm..📝 Olga Wisinger-Florian, the most important representative of the Austrian Mood Impressionism („Stimmungsimpressionismus“), was born in a middle class family in Vienna. She first studied piano and became a solo concert pianist. Her piano instructor was Julius Epstein who was also Gustav Mahler’s music teacher, at the Vienna Conservatory. In 1873 her music career ended due to a hand injury. She got married shortly after, to a pharmacist, Franz Wisinger and had a son, Oskar in 1875. During the mid 1870’s Wisinger-Florian turned to painting. She studied painting with Melchor Fritsch and August Schaeffer and from 1880 - 1884 was the first private student of painter Emil Jakob Schindler. Along with Schindler and his disciples Carl Moll, Marie Egner and Tina Blau-Lang, Olga Wisinger-Florian made many study trips. They famously painted together in the Plankenberg area.As of 1881 her paintings were regularly seen at  annual exhibitions at the Künstlerhaus as well as the Secession. As a young painter Wisinger-Florian was completely under her mentor Schindler’s influence. Her painting of light and mood as well as her choice of motifs (alleys, gardens, fields) show strong similarities to Schinder’s works.After breaking with Schindler in 1884 Wisinger-Florian developed an increasingly more independent style. She then used intense colors and moved from realistic landscape expressionism to dynamic landscape and flower images that were ahead of her time. Olga Wisinger-Florian was one of the most important painters of the century. Her social contacts provided her with an elite circle of buyers. Vistors to her studio included Archduchess Clothilde, Bavaria’s Prince Regent Luitpold, and the King of Bulgaria. Emperor Franz Joseph I. purchased one of her paintings.In 1910, with her vision diminishing, Olga Wisinger-Florian withdrew from her active social life. She died in Grafenegg, Lower Austria. She received an honorary grave in Vienna's Central Cemetery....

name: 2019-09-27 15.01.55 2141981506436631787_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Sitting. Исторические руины и памятники далёкого прошлого всегда приводили меня в восторг, чего не могу сказать про старые вещи в целом, От рухляди и старья предпочитаю избавляться и вряд ли потащу в дом антиквариат и винтаж, каким бы дорогим или модным он  не был. Все древнее предпочитаю рассматривать в музеях или же в естественном антураже. От прогулок по руинам Ангкора или старым улицам Оксфорда у меня получается подзарядиться, а от владения возрастными раритетами - вообще никак. -Да, бывают исключения. Например, в моей семье есть маленькая бронзовая иконка ( не знаю как правильно она называется), которой лет двести-триста, может и больше. Но она помещается в руке, не занимает места и имеет какую-то ценность, так как передается долго из поколения в поколение. Просто нечто старое, громоздкое и "чужое" я бы в дом не тащила. А вы?#британскиймузей #египет #древности #тысячелетие #britishmuseum #sculpture #egyptian #новоестарое

text: The reason I actually came to London are these guys. 2 lamassu from Nimrud, north west palace flanking a doorway into the throne room from Ashurnasirpal II, so around 860 BC!!!!! After reading below text about Ashurnasirpal II ... not sure I like Assyrians that much 😅🙈 .Their men young and old I took prisoners. Of some I cut off their feet and hands; of others I cut off the ears noses and lips; of the young men's ears I made a heap; of the old men's heads I made a minaret. I exposed their heads as a trophy in front of their city. The male children and the female children I burned in flames; the city I destroyed, and consumed with fire.#ashurnasirpal#assyria #nimrud #ancienthistory #archeology #archaeology #history #antiqua_archeologia #BBCTravel #britishmuseum #london #uk

text: What makes people happy? In his new book Happy Ever After, best-selling happiness expert Professor Paul Dolan draws on a variety of studies ranging from wellbeing to inequality and discrimination, to bust the common myths about our happiness. At a special event at the British Museum on Thursday 10 October, Professor Paul Dolan will discuss how there can be many unexpected paths to lasting fulfilment • This event is part of this year’s Mental Wealth Festival and tickets can be booked via www.citylit.ac.uk/mwf • #happiness #pauldolan #britishmuseum #mentalwealthfestival #mentalwealth2019 #fulfilment #joy #happy

name: 2019-09-27 18.01.14 2142071758956759426_britishmuseum.jpg
text: When we think of the British Museum we see a grand neo-classical building built from Portland stone.However, before the building that we know today was built, there was an earlier museum housed in #MontaguHouse, a late 17th-century mansion in #GreatRussellStreet, in the #Bloomsbury.Montagu House was built for Ralph Montagu, 1st Duke of Montagu, and was the grandest aristocratic residence erected in London (although actually in the county of Middlesex) at the time.It would remain the London home of the Montagu family until being sold to the Trustees of the #BritishMuseum in 1759, becoming then the home of the museum until demolition in the 1840s to make way for larger premises. Founded in 1753, the British Museum was essentially the collections of the Irish physician and scientist #SirHansSloane. However, in acquiring Montagu House, the museum's trustees had bought a property and site befitting what was destined to become a national, indeed international, collection.Our antique print from the collection of Frontispiece Ltd was published on this day, September 27th. in 1845, and recorded the demolition of Montagu House.In a supporting article, the 'Illustrated London News' states, "As Montague House (the old British Museum) is disappearing by piecemeal, and the ornate 'French plan' is giving way to to the comparatively severe portico and colonnade of Sir Sir Robert Smirke's new Museum, we have deemed the present state of the two buildings a fit subject for illustration."I have known this antique print for very many years but it was not until this morning that, on reading the accompanying text, did I realise that both the old and new museum appear in the illustration for, peering through the centre of the engraving is the facade of the newly erected structure.

name: 2019-09-27 18.06.39 2142074487728961898_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Sütun başlığı detayı, Antik Mısır tanrısı Khnum’a adanmış Esna tapınağı.Tapınak, modern Mısır kenti Esna’da (antik Mısırlılar için lunyt veya Ta-senet), Luksor’un (antik Thebes) yaklaşık 50 km güneyinde yer alır. Tapınak, Khnum dışında, en ünlüsü Neith ve Heka olan başka tanrılara da adanmıştı. Metinler, III. Tuthmosis döneminde inşa edilmiş bir tapınak alanına inşa edildiğinden bahseder. 18. Hanedan dönemine ait olan daha önceki yapısının bazı blokları korunmuştur. Mevcut yapı, Yunan ve Roma dönemlerine aittir ve antik Mısırlılar tarafından yaptırılmış en son tapınaklardan biridir._____________ Capital of a large column, detail. Temple of Khnum at EsnaThe modern Egyptian town of Esna (Iunyt or Ta-senet to the ancient Egyptians) was built in the area of is roughly 50 km south of Luxor (ancient Thebes). Besides Khnum, the temple was dedicated to several other deities, the most prominent of whom were Neith and Heka. Texts mention that it was built on the site of a temple that may have been constructed as early as the reign of Tuthmosis III. Some blocks of the earlier 18th Dynasty structure are preserved. The present structure dates to the Greek and Roman periods and is one of the latest temples to have been built by the ancient Egyptians. ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road ______Contact Pages : @sevgiiyenerr ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: 🌬@ancientarcheology ⠀▪️Marble and bronze bust of helmeted Athena. Roman culture, 2nd century AD. Found in the Villa Casali in 1783. Rome, Italy. British Museum, London.⠀⠀Roman version of a Greek work of the 4th century BC. Bronzework restored by sculptor Carlo Albacini in 1783. The eyes anciently were formed of precious stones or vitrified pastes. ⠀🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️🔹️⠀▪️Miğferli Athena, mermer ve bronz büstü. Roma kültürü, MS 2. yüzyıl. 1783 yılında Villa Casali’de bulundu. Roma, İtalya. British Museum, Londra.⠀⠀MÖ 4. yüzyılda yapılmış bir Grek eserinin Roma versiyonu. Bronz işi heykeltıraş Carlo Albacini tarafından 1783 yılında restore edildi. name: 2019-09-27 22.28.27 2142206251732241245_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🔝Дайджест главных выставок Лондона: осень 2019 - зима 2020🔝⠀🚩Специально для вас мы составили список самых интересных и ожидаемых культурных событий Лондона на осень и начало следующего года.⠀✔️Мы будем рады организовать для вас программу экскурсий с лучшими гидами и предложить самые выгодные цены на отели и экскурсии по вашему запросу.⠀🔝William Blake✔️Tate Britain Museum до 2.02.'20Самая большая за последние 20 лет выставка поэта и художника Уильяма Блейка. В музее воссоздадут зал, где прошла его знаменитая выставка 1809 года. Здесь с помощью технологий мультимедиа воплотят в жизнь мечту Блейка и представят его работы гигантского размера: мастер намеревался повторить некоторые полотна на стенах Парламента, о чем написал в сопровождавшем выставку каталоге. В экспозиции более 300 работ.⠀🔝Tim Walker: Wonderful Things✔️V&A Museum до 8.03.'20Этой осенью музей V&A представит работы одного из самых ярких и изобретательных фотографов современности — Тима Уолкера. Выставка расскажет о вкладе мастера в искусство фотографии. Центром экспозиции станут десять новых работ Тима Уолкера, созданные под влиянием редких артефактов — монументальных витражей, индийских миниатюр, золотых башмачков и расписных шкатулок.⠀🔝Antony Gormley✔️Royal Academy of Art до 3.12.'19Победитель национальной премии Тернера скульптор-монументалист известен широкой публике благодаря своей работе «Ангел Севера». Сейчас же мастер готовит по-настоящему амбициозную выставку за последние десять лет своего творчества, собирая многотонные инсталляции из металла прямо в зале Академии.⠀🔝Rembrandt's Light✔️Dulwich Picture Gallery до 2.02.'20В октябре открывается выставка Рембрандта, приуроченная к 350-летию со дня смерти художника. В экспозицию войдет около 35 работ, наиболее ярко отражающих его талант как мастера светотени. За световое оформление экспозиции отвечает Питер Сушицки, известный по работе над такими фильмами, как «Звездные войны» Ирвина Кершнера и «Марс атакует!» Тима Бертона.⠀🔝Gauguin Portraits✔️The National Gallery7.10.'19 до 26.01.'20 🔜

name: 2019-09-27 23.58.00 2142251329753072619_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🇬🇧 Happy Friday to everyone!! Some fact about us when we visit a museum:Antonio really likes to stop and read everything, he (sometimes) takes the audioguides for more information. He is really patient, he is calm and he doesn’t rush anything 🤓. I (Marina) am like a child in a museum, depending of what I see, I will stop to read or just to look at it or not. I’m really impatient and I’m always looking for something to catch my attention. Sometimes this is a good thing, like this view from a small window of the inside of the British Museum. For the rest... I envy Antonio a lot!! 😃...🇪🇸 Feliz viernes a todos!! Algunos hechos sobre nosotros cuando visitamos museos:A Antonio le gusta pararse y leer todo, a veces coge las audioguías para tener aún más información. Es tranquilo, paciente y no le gusta tener prisa por nada 🤓. Yo (Marina) soy como un niño en un museo, dependiendo de lo que vea, me paro y lo miro o no. Soy siempre impaciente y espero a que algo llame mi atención. A veces, esto es bueno, como esta vista desde una pequeña ventana del interior del Museo Británico. Por el resto... envidio muchísimo a Antonio 😃

name: 2019-09-27 23.58.18 2142251478996141515_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Emperor Pertinax, rather overlooked in the British Museum’s entrance hall. He climbed the greasy pole to enjoy power for a mere three months before a palace coup in 193 AD. Shortest ruling emperor, but at least his reputation was as ‘a good and upright man’...The wonderful Payne Knight bought this handsome bust at the sale of Nollekens’ effects.

text: “ロンドンに飽きた者は人生に飽きた者だ”日本から離れた本初子午線は、驚きに溢れていた。街並みはどこを歩いてもUSJロンドンバスは至る所にあるし、コンビニ並に見かけるPubは昼間から飲んでるし、フィッシュアンドチップスはでかい。国会議事堂の前で若い人達がデモをしていたり、ストライキで地下鉄が利用出来なかったり、政治的な面でも違いが醸し出されていた。1万キロ離れるとそこには、全く違う文化があった。1ミリも飽きることの無い滞在だった。 #london  #sherlockhomes #piccadillycircus #britishpub #buckinghampalace #westminster #londonbridge #nottinghill #platform9¾ #britishmuseum #harrods #arsenal #emiratesstadium

name: 2019-09-28 01.58.40 2142312057805119407_britishmuseum.jpg
text: How often do we have a perception of how things are from afar or who people are and it isn’t until we get the opportunity or take the time to look deeply at an issue, a person or a piece of art to see the depth, the work, the intricacies of what lies within.... I looked at this “robe” and thought it was a beautiful piece of fabric only to see how much more there was to this exceptional piece of art... imagine the work, patience and time to create a masterpiece of over 10,000 porcelain butterflies- it is even greater than I initially perceived it to be.  I wonder what else I’ve missed in life because I didn’t take the time, I made a judgement or I was disinterested.#takethetime#butterflies#porcelainbutterflies #mandarinbutterflyseries#carolineyicheng #britishmuseum #wellagedliving #babyboomertravel #midlifetravel #londonmuseums

text: What about cheering up your rainy day at the British Museum? 😊Besides the vast collection of world art and artefacts, you can find this stunning glass and steel roof. Did you know that the roof was constructed out of 3,312 panes of glass, and they are all different from each other! 😱⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀The museum opens daily from 10:00 to 17:30 and the admission is free! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#london #museum #londoners #ilovelondon #rainyday #culture #visitlondon #thisislondon #londonlife #travelguide #britishmuseum #uk #travelerinlondon #londonsbest #art #history #passionpassport

text: This towering sculpture is from the Mausoleum at Halikarnassos, a tomb built for Mausollos, a ruler of the ancient province of Karia in the Persian Empire. The site was one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, and the word mausoleum is derived from the name Mausolus.#halikarnassos #halicarnassus #mausoleumathalicarnassus #mausoleumathalikarnassos #marble #marblesculpture #marbleart #ancientsculpture #ancientart #ancienthistory #mausolus #mausoleum #mausolusoriginofmausoleum #museum #museumart #britishmuseum #funeraryart #ancientpersia #sevenwonders #sevenwondersoftheancientworld #7wondersoftheancientworld #photography #museumphotography #canon #canoneos600d

name: 2019-09-28 10.24.36 2142566708865828155_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Exposición (900-300 a. C.) en @caixaforum: “Lujo. De los asirios a Alejandro Magno”. Con acierto se ha dicho que, en el Próximo Oriente antiguo, época anterior a la de este vaso iraquí con forma de mujer (700-600 a. C.), el período del Bronce final (1550-1100 a. C.) fue el más intenso en cuanto a relaciones internacionales de todo el mundo antiguo. Marfiles, joyas, relieves, vidrio, oro y metales de todas las partes del antiguo Oriente Próximo nos muestran la importancia del lujo en las relaciones de comercio y poder. Entre las fuentes que manejamos, destacan por su importancia las cartas del Amarna -la correspondencia real de los faraones hallada en 1887 en la residencia de Neferjeperura Amenhotep o Akenatón (1372-1336 a. C.) formada por miles de tablillas cuneiformes procedentes de las principales cancillerías de Asiria, Babilonia, Mitanni y Canaán- y los archivos reales de Boğazköy, hallados en 1906 en la capital hitita de Hattusa. #españa #madrid #lujocaixaforum #britishcaixaforum #britishmuseum #expo #lujo #asirios #alejandromagno #proximooriente #mujer #sippar #irak #bronce #amarna #faraon #akenaton #asiria #babilonia #mitanni #canaan #bogazkoy #hititas #hattusa #turquia

text: Museums are free in #london which makes it the perfect place to entertain kids! As a sample: the #naturalhistorymuseumlondon has an interactive dinosaur exhibit, the #sciencemuseumlondon has an out of this world space exhibit and the #britishmuseum has fascinating exhibits from ancient Egypt and Greece. I especially loved an exhibit from Mozambique, a country torn by gun violence. The artists asked people to turn in their guns and artillery which were then used to to create giant sculptures of nature.

It is among the most comprehensive in the world,  first opening to the public in 1759. name: 2019-09-28 15.18.30 2142714628705203201_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Young Woman Wearing a Hat..🎨 Painted by Pierre-Auguste Renoir.Born: 25 February 1841, Limoges, France.Died: 3 December 1919, Cagnes-sur-Mer, France. (aged 78).📝 His father was a tailor, and Renoir was given an apprenticeship at a porcelain painter. He then had the opportunity to study at the Ecole des Beaux Arts. He was a fellow student of Monet, Sisley and Bazille; he went on summer painting trips with them to Chailly and Fountainbleau.He studied the eighteenth century paintings in the Louvre and also met Corot, Millet and Diaz.His art was noted for its vibrant combination of colours. In classic impressionist style, he avoided rigid lines and merged objects giving a sense of dream-like consciousness. He also painted many portraits of women often in nude.In 1881, he visited Algeria and then Italy. In Italy, he was deeply impressed by the Italian Masters. After meeting Cezanne near Marseilles, Renoir sought to break away from Impressionism by developing a new structural style of his own.Yet, he never abandoned his techniques of colour that he learnt during his impressionist period and he developed a combination of classical styles of applying paint with an impressionist perspective of colour.In 1890, he married Aline Victorine Charigot, a dressmaker twenty years his junior. Renoir included her in many of his future paintings depicting family life. They had three children, including Jean Renoir (1894-1979) a noted filmmaker.Towards the end of the nineteenth century, he gained increasing fame and respect. In 1892, the French state bought one of his paintings – ‘At the Piano.’ During the last 20 years of his life Renoir was crippled by arthritis; unable to move his hands freely, he continued to paint some great masterpieces using a brush strapped to his arm......#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #hat #renoir #limoges #cagnessurmer #france #ecoledesbeauxarts #yourarttimes

name: 2019-09-28 18.00.01 2142795927142875146_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Have you spotted the Albrecht Dürer exhibition that’s just opened at the Albertina in Vienna? Learn more here: https://buff.ly/2mUwGQN ⠀⠀Dürer was an exceptional painter who created detailed studies of animals and plants. This picture of a rock face details the texture, colour and irregularities in each layer of rock, as well as the plants and mosses that have found a footing on it. ⠀Here’s a painting he made of the muzzle of an ox, which picks out the cracked skin on its dark nose and every stray hair https://buff.ly/2lPhsfP ⠀Some of Dürer’s landscapes look surprisingly modern, like this study of a lake and trees where the cloudy but sun-splashed sky is only hastily described with colourful washes of paint https://buff.ly/2ns6AEQ ⠀⠀Image Details: https://buff.ly/2mRG6MX  Untitled (Study of a rock-face), c.1496-1497, Albrecht Dürer. ©  Trustees of the British Museum, CC BY-NC-SA 4.0. #albrechtdurer #albertina #vienna #watercolour #thewatercolourworld #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-28 19.49.52 2142851216282222920_britishmuseum.jpg
text: One of my favourite works in the British Museum. Tucked away on an obscure shelf I was lost for words when I first saw it. It had a modest scale and devotional skill in the carving. It's nice to see works so slow in their making, with that almost filmic quality of revealed narrative. In this it seems an early Proustian "search for lost time" a quality that I love to put into my own paintings.#detailedart #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-28 22.46.49 2142940277036141085_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Repost @mythology_in_art• • • • • •Astarte is the Hellenized form of the Middle Eastern goddess Astoreth (Northwest Semitic), a form of Ishtar (East Semitic), worshipped from the Bronze Age through classical antiquity. The name is particularly associated with her worship in the ancient Levant among the Canaanites and Phoenicians. She was also celebrated in Egypt following the importation of Levantine cults there. The name Astarte is sometimes also applied to her cults in Mesopotamian cultures like Assyria and Babylonia. Astarte was connected with fertility, sexuality, and war. Her symbols were the lion, the horse, the sphinx, the dove, and a star within a circle indicating the planet Venus.  She has been known as the deified morning and/or evening star.⠀📸 Queen of the Night relief, old Babylonian period, 1800-1750 BC. From Southern Mesopotamia, may represent the goddesses Ishtar, Lilith, or Ereshkigal. The #BritishMuseum, #London@britishmuseum⠀#astarte #ishtar #JohnSingerSargent #mythology #mythologyart

name: 2019-09-29 00.34.11 2142994310692411183_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Watched “Hokusai by British Museum” tonight and was a bit disappointed... the movie is actually a promo video for the Hokusai exhibition in 2017. It emphasised on how great Hokusai was in the eyes of the westerners, but told little about how the Japanese culture, social and political situation in Japan affected Hokusai. i was impressed by scholar ROGER KEYES who spent his own life on studying ukiyoe and Hokusai. He cried a bit when he was making compliments to Hokusai, and i could feel the same as i cried every time when watching Hokusai’s documentary. he was really a hero in the art history and role model for those who love arts and crafts 😭...#hokusai#britishmuseum#greatwave#北齋#神奈川沖浪裏#k11#musea#ua

I’d also like to say a special thank you to Adrian and Eva @totallythames for producing and facilitating the Foragers of the Foreshore exhibition - without them it wouldn’t have happened and with them at the helm it has been a most wonderful and  inclusive exhibition. name: 2019-09-29 01.58.46 2143036887903755715_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 2019.09 我一直是一個很愛規劃旅行、做功課的人，到現在都是，規劃旅行讓我不至於太漫無目的，錯過許多經典景點。不過慢慢的發現有時給自己留一點彈性，也能有意外驚喜。每天起床就看著列下的景點，依著心情決定，每天都是充滿驚喜的一天。.出訪大英博物館這天一早下起滂沱大雨，好在沒有什麼必去的行程，不至於受影響。下榻的青旅離大英博物館不遠，步行二十分鐘左右可以到達，想想室內行程似乎特別適合陰雨的今天，便邁開步伐出發了。.開館不久就到了門口，沒想到人龍排到轉了好幾個彎，看來每個人打著一樣的算盤，下雨天不去博物館要幹嘛！那就等吧，反正旅行時間正多。最後應該排了有四十分鐘才順利進入。大英博物館果真是贓物聚集地，全世界搜刮來的寶物都放在這了。可惜大英博物館腹地廣大，最後還是淪為走馬看花，但親眼看見著名文物，甚至是木乃伊，還是相當震撼！.照片中的貓也是展出的文物之一。Half day visit to British museum is a must in the pouring rainy day.#英國 #英國旅遊 #倫敦 #歐洲旅遊 #英倫 #倫敦旅遊 #倫敦景點 #london #uk #londontravel #travel #europetravel #solotrip #自助旅行 #獨旅 #台灣人在歐洲 #londonstreetstyle #大英博物館 #thebritishmuseum #britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-29 04.55.35 2143125883611514080_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Beads 'n' boobs 😈 ...the brooches are a mid 6th century example of cruciform brooches replicating those found in grave 10, Snape, Suffolk. They were sculpted by myself and cast in Bronze by Dave Roper of @ganderwick_creations. Necklace based on the same grave contains amber beads made by myself along with a mixture of rock crystal and glass beads made by @tillermanbeads . The swags are almost entirely Tillerman beads (mostly Anglo-saxon) with a few bone and roman glass beads thrown in for good measure. Being at the @britishmuseum with @wulfheodenas was a good excuse to #blingupmyboobs 😂#earlyanglosaxon #anglosaxons #historicalbeads #bronzejewellery #6thcentury #britishmuseum #wulfheodenas #snæp

text: Statue of Tutankhamun,18th dynasty,c.1336 to 1327BC,from Thebes,Karnak,the Temple of Amun-Ra.Tutankhamun’s reign included the restoration of traditional Egyptian religion and culture and returning the capital to Thebes from Amarna,the city built by his father.Tutankhamun is estimated to have been just 19 when he died,and theories of his death include a chariot accident,that he was murdered by one of his advisors by a blow to the head,and death by natural causes due to various possible ailments #lovelondon #london #londoner #londonpop #london #londonist #londonart #londontown #london🇬🇧 #londonlove #londonlife #britishmuseum #uk #uk🇬🇧 #uktour #visitlondon #europe #europetravel #visitlondon

name: 2019-09-29 05.16.50 2143136576729899957_britishmuseum.jpg
text: MUSEO SOBRE CASTILLO EN PONFERRADACasi todo preparado !!! Inauguración: 9.10.2019 (Capicúa del año !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082 . 2019“El puente en el Arte”63 obras pictóricas de grandes artistas mundiales a lo largo de 63 semanas.Santalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.Los tres primeros museos ya se han inaugurado en Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata y Madrid. El próximo será el de Ponferrada.MUSEUM ON CASTLE IN PONFERRADAAlmost everything prepared !!!Inauguration: 9.10.2019 (Capicúa of the year !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082. 2019“The bridge in Art”63 pictorial works of great world artists over 63 weeks.Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose purpose is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.The first three museums have already opened in Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata and Madrid. The next will be Ponferrada.  #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma  #museedorsay #louvre #met #salvadordalimuseum #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #yaleartgallery #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

name: 2019-09-29 05.58.58 2143157779473306026_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Kraliçe Nefertiti"___________Nefertiti (MÖ 1370–1330), bir Mısır kraliçesi olup, tek tanrılı Atenizim dinini yayan Firavun Akhenaton’un eşidir. Eski Mısır tarihine ait bütün kitaplar, onun dillere destan güzelliğinden bahseder. Adı; “güzellik geliyor”, “güzel olan” ya da “güzelden gelen” anlamlarına geliyor. Kimi kaynaklarda Nefertiti’nin asıl adının Tadukhepa olduğu, ünlü güzelliğinden dolayı Nefertiti ismiyle anıldığı ifade ediliyor._Kraliçe Nefertiti’nin, nerden geldiği ve kökeni tam olarak bilinmemekte olup bununla ilgili, çeşitli varsayımlar vardır. Bunlardan en kabul göreni; Firavunların üç nesilden beri dost ülkelerle iyi ilişkilerini sürdürmek için onların prenseslerini alma alışkanlığı edindikleri 18. Hanedanlık zamanına götürüyor bizi; Mezopotamya ile Kafkaslar arasında bulunan Mitanni devletine._____________Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road ______Contact Pages : @basileons ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: 今日は打ち合わせやアポイントが無いので、在ロンドン歴17年にもなる友人と10数年ぶりに再会。テートモダンや大英博物館をはじめ、ロンドンをサクッと案内してもらった。ロンドンは奥深いく、非常に興味深い街だ。ヤバい！普段は街にはあまり興味のない自分ですら、虜にさせる何かがある。#london #city #explore #tetemodern #britishmuseum #art #england

name: 2019-09-29 07.45.05 2143211192464825253_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Day two: made breakfast at the air bnb and then went to the history museum to see a lot (and I mean a lot) of historical artifacts. Then we went to instagrams most popular cafe in selfridges EL&N cafe! There I had the most memorable thing happen to me: my boyfriend of almost two and a half years decided to pop the question! He had a selfie latte saying “will you marry me?” And they also had their Instagram photographer there to capture the moment (perfect timing)! We strolled in Hyde park and took the tube to whalburgers in Covent garden. Then headed back to the air bnb for some celebratory champagne (where Gary spilt most of it when he popped it)and enjoy our last night at the air bnb. #britishmuseum #london2019trip #el&ncafe #engagement #surprised #havepassportwilltravel #couplesgoals #coupleswhotraveltogetherstaytogether

name: 2019-09-29 17.11.28 2143496268043643218_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Käthe Kollwitz ‘Handstudies’ 1891 for many artists like Kollwitz drawing their own hands was another form of self portrait. She made a number of sensitive studies of her own as well as other people’s hands as she was interested in their expressive qualities. It looks as if she used a mirror drawing her hands in which case what looks like her right hand, her artist’s tool, is actually her left. This work is also in the exhibition on the artist @britishmuseum #britishmuseum #exhibition #käthekollwitz #womanartist #femaleartist #selfportrait #hands #artistshands #artisttools #drawing #penandink #reflection #mirror #germanartist #künstlerhände #selbstporträt #federzeichnung #künstlerin #deutschekünstlerin

name: 2019-09-29 17.16.39 2143498871356300732_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 先程羽田に到着。明日から仕事なのでロンドン編連投です。20190928ロンドン市内観光。24年振りに#abbeyroad  も渡ってきました。交差している女性は関係ありません、#bigben  は改装中、#towerbridge 、いい感じです。#britishmuseum  も時間なくて駆け足でしたが、#thequeenofthenight  というレリーフが引っかかったので写真に撮ってきました。ウィキ.ではバーニーの浮彫（バーニーのうきぼり、英: Burney Relief、夜の女王としても知られる) は、メソポタミアのイシン・ラルサ期または古バビロン期のテラコッタで作られた高浮彫であり、翼を持つヌードの女神の姿を描いている。フクロウが傍に控え二頭のライオンの上に立っている。

name: 2019-09-29 17.48.03 2143514678754702012_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Timgad (eski adı ile, Thamugas veya Thamugadi), Cezayir'in Aurès Dağları'ndaki bir Roman-Berberi kasabasıydı. MS 100 yılı civarında İmparator Trajan tarafından kurulmuştur. Kasabanın tam adı Colonia Marciana Ulpia Traiana Thamugadi'dir. Trajan şehri annesi Marcia, büyük kız kardeşi Ulpia Marciana ve babası Marcus Ulpius Traianus anısına kurmuştur.Batna kasabasının yaklaşık 35 km doğusunda bulunan kalıntılar, Roma şehir planlamasında kullanılan en iyi mevcut grid planlarından birini temsil ettiği için dikkat çekicidir.Timgad, 1982'de UNESCO tarafından bir Dünya Mirası Alanı olarak ilan edilmiştir_____________________Timgad (formerly known as Thamugas or Thamugadi) was a Roman-Berber town in the Aurès Mountains of Algeria. MS was founded by Emperor Trajan for 100 years. The name of the town is Colonia Marciana Ulpia Traiana Thamugadi. Trajan's mother Marcia, her older sister Ulpia Marciana, and her father, Marcus Ulpius, in memory of Traianus.Remains of about 35 km of Batna town are remarkable to represent one of the best existing grid plans used in Roman city planning.Timgad was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1982. ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road _______#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #algeria #byzantine #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #masterpieces #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-09-29 19.06.06 2143553960559281263_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The British Museum adalah salah satu museum terbesar yg didedikasikan untuk sejarah manusia, seni dan budaya dengan koleksi sekitar 8 juta karya dari berbagai penjuru dunia. Mendokumentasikan lengkap ttg sejarah manusia sejak zaman dulu. Mulai di buka tahun 1759 dan saat ini dikunjungi sekitar 6-7 juta pengunjung tiap tahun. Museum ini sangat luas dengan koleksi dari berbagai peradaban bangsa bangsa didunia mulai dari Mesir Kuno, Timur tengah, Mesopotamia, Yunani kuno, Romawi kuno, Eropa, Afrika, Asia dan Amerika.Karena luas dan banyak koleksinya kali ini saya hanya mengunjungi bagian Mesir kuno dan Timur Tengah yg saat ini sedang saya teliti untuk bahan buku Perjalanan di Bumi para nabi yg kedua. Mau lihat kan koleksi2nya yang ok dan itu lho Patung Firaun Rameses II 😀😀😀 Free entrance dan kalo mau donasi kotak donasi tersedia di tiap pojok. #britishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #humancivilization #oldegypt #egypthistory #pharaohramesses #firaunramses2 #bukuaqsha #bukuaqshaperjalanandibumiparanabi #perjalanandibumiparanabi #bukumesir #Kisahfiraunnabimusaasdanbaniisrail #masruraramidjal

name: 2019-09-29 22.42.45 2143663003126774707_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Throw back to the British Museum! 🏛️ Egyptian section, utterly fascinating. Beautiful! Tres ples! So much to see... Mummies! They even wrapped animals *rheeet!* I wonder what pigs did in the egyptian afterlife? 🇪🇬 Some of the statues were huuuuge (pig for scale). Imagine carrying that into your back garden. Lovely ornament! 🗿Anyone wanting a good and free day out... BM is the place to be! 🐖#pigtureperfect #pig #pignplaces #stuffedtoysofinstagram #boarontour #britishmuseum #egypt #museum #history #ancientegyptians #heiroglyphs
