name: 2019-09-29 22.52.22 2143667842239053587_britishmuseum.jpg
text: A colossal statue of Ramesses II (the Great),Third Pharaoh of the 19th Dynasty (reigned 1279 to 1213 BC),from the Ramasseum,his huge memorial temple in Thebes,part of modern Luxor.Ramesses' other monumental buildings included the mighty temple at Abu Simbel.He is also known as Ozymandias,notably in Shelley's poem of 1818,which might have been inspired by this marvellous statue "My name is Ozymandias, king of kings; Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!'Nothing beside remains. Round the decay, Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bareThe lone and level sands stretch far away" #lovelondon #london #londoner #londonpop #london #londonist #londonart #londontown #london🇬🇧 #londonlove #londonlife #britishmuseum #uk #uk🇬🇧 #uktour #visitlondon #europe #europetravel #visitlondon

name: 2019-09-29 23.00.11 2143671774901942434_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Well as if by magic we have arrived. The architecture at The British Museum is so beautiful and is photographed so frequently⁠.⁠Lots of tourists here today so took a while for mum to get that perfect shot with as less of people in the background as possible. Photography can always be a little stressful, especially with people who walk right out into your shot, especially a manners cost nothing⁠.⁠BUT....we managed to get a shot for me at this beautiful place and I'm so chuffed. Now off to find some food, I'm hungry⁠.⁠⁠⁠#London #londondaytrip #daytriptolondon #londondayout #londonadventures #siteseeing #victoriastation #trainstation #architecture #photography #photographydayout #takingphotos #dayout #britishmuseum

text: #unitedkingdom🇬🇧 #london #britishmuseum 영국에 있는 박물관들은 대부분 입장료가 무료다! 이런 엄청난 혜택이 있다니! 무료라길래 큰 기대없이 갔다가 엄청난 규모에 놀랐다. 대충 보고 나가자고 해놓고 세시간을 훌쩍 넘겼다. 한번 들어가면 출구도 찾기 어려운 그런곳.... 거기에 여기서도 한국을 만나서 국뽕에 취한다. 캬흐....✨ 근데 솔직히 한국 전시관은 많이많이 아쉽다. #영국 #런던 #영국여행 #런던여행 #영국대영박물관 #대영박물관 #국뽕 #국뽕에취한여행자 #부부여행 #부부세계여행 #부부배낭여행

name: 2019-09-30 01.19.50 2143742055491567270_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🐚 Nautilus pompilius...This standing cup is made from a nautilus shell mounted in silver, gilt and chased..The shell is engraved with dragons among clouds. The engraved band around lip are supported at sides by marine terminal figures. In front by band of strapwork with grotesque mask..The back of the mounted shell represent a sea monster with open mouth. On its back there is the infant Hercules with a serpent in one hand, the other hand holds a modern spear. .The baluster stem with festoons of fruit. The base in form of bird's claw..@britishmuseum...Standing cup, Made in Padua, Italy, or in Germany for the mounts circa 1550 and Guangzhou, China, for the nautilus shell carving in the late 15th century or the early 16th century, Gilded silver and nautilus shell, British Museum, London | @britishmuseum.Coupe montée, Réalisé à Padoue, Italie, ou en Allemagne pour les montures vers 1550 et Guangzhou, Chine, pour le la coquille de Nautile sculptée à la fin du XVème ou au début du XVIème siècle, Argent doré et coquille de Nautile, British Museum, Londres | @britishmuseum...🗓 265th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Unusual materials

name: 2019-09-30 01.35.00 2143749695960068672_britishmuseum.jpg
text: A few shots from the #BritishMuseum in London. The detail that the Egyptian and Assyrian artist put into their work is mind boggling. All of these carvings were done by hand into stone, with little room to correct even the smallest mistakes. It raises the question, is human art evolving or devolving? At any rate, much respect to the ancients. #immortal #timeless #art #artwork #history #creative #designer #createsomething #inspiration

name: 2019-09-30 01.39.34 2143751996711268388_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Repost @britishmuseum@trijota1963 👆 👇 • • • • •This Dante Gabriel Rossetti watercolour is on public display for the first time in decades – catch it in our free prints and drawings exhibition in Room 90a.It was painted by the artist in the 1850s, and sold to his friend William Morris as part of a series of seven medieval-inspired watercolours. The grisly scene shows two knights – Dinadan and Breuze – from the legend of King Arthur fighting while a dead man hangs from a tree behind, and a woman is held against her will.Find out more about this painting’s story and discover other works recently donated from the collection of art historian, curator and collector John Christian in our free display – find out more via the link in our bio.#BritishMuseum #Rosetti #PreRaphaelite #PreRaphaelites #WilliamMorris #VictorianHistory #art #painting #watercolour #exhibition #London

name: 2019-09-30 05.18.26 2143862158505523553_britishmuseum.jpg
text: UK Travel 2019 - Today has been mostly overcast and showery. This morning I set off to Camden in the northwest of London. Camden is known for its trendy street shopping, the Camden markets and canals. It’s Sunday here so I was expecting it to be busy, but not as crowd crushingly so as it was. It was still a good morning though, despite the crowds and rain. I could have made lots of purchases in the interesting craft and antiques stalls but resisted. On the high street shopping precinct there seemed to be competition between the shop owners see who could out do each another with their elaborate decorative facades above the shopfronts. The many food stalls and eating places looked interesting and smelled great but lunch was elsewhere so I caught the Tube back to Euston station and my lunch appointment for gluten free cod and chips at a recommended pub (the Lord John Russell) near my accommodation. They lived up to the recommendation so I’ll probably return before I leave. After lunch I strolled down Oxford Street (I was good today so no shopping apart from a more sturdy travel umbrella) and ended up at Marble Arch where I reacquainted myself with the Still Water horse head sculpture. It was raining fairly heavy by now so I decided to catch the Tube back towards my accommodation and spend the rest of the afternoon at the British Museum which is just around the corner. Tomorrow I’m off to Canterbury and Margate. #u2019 #london #camden #camdenmarket #britishmuseum #lordjohnrussellpub

name: 2019-09-30 12.49.13 2144089042667438369_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Julia Margaret Cameron (c.1852).🎨 Painted by George Frederic Watts.Born: 23 February 1817, Marylebone, Middlesex, England.Died: 1 July 1904, Compton, Surrey, England..🖼 Oil on canvas 61 × 50 cm..📝 Watts was frequently ill during childhood and spent a great deal of time in bed drawing stories for himself. His first major success as painter took place in the spring of 1843. Watts entered the competition for the decoration of the Houses of Parliament and won the prize of £300 for his drawing of "Caractacus led Captive through the Streets of Rome." He brilliant depiction of historical personalities impressed the judges and set the stage for a lucrative art career. His fellow competitors included historical painter Benjamin Haydon.  Haydon whom was beset by financial difficulties became so upset over the younger artists win that he took his own life.Watts used his winnings to travel to Italy. According to Art historian, William Loftus Hare "Italy, and particularly Florence, was perpetual fascination and inspiration to Watts. There he imbibed the influences of Orcagna and Titian"In 1864 Watts fell in love with a beautiful young actress young enough to be his daughter. The artist courted Miss Ellen Terry with old fashioned gallantry and road to her home on a white horse begging her to marry him.Terry was impressed with the art and elegance of his lifestyle and wished to please her parents by making an advantageous marriage.They married on 20 February 1864, shortly before her 17th birthday, when Watts was 46.Terry and Watts were separated after only ten months of marriage, during which she took a break from the stage, returning by 1866.The great artist was variable and uncertain. Though humble and self-deprecatory to an extreme degree, he made mistakes from which he could escape only with great difficulty; and he suffered much from depression and melancholy.The aging painter continued to earn great renown for his luminous portraits and monumental allegorical paintings.Towards the end of his life Watts gave most of his work to British museums..(Fig 2, 3, 4, 5: Details)...

name: 2019-09-30 13.09.40 2144099337580099341_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Bodhisattva of Compassion 🙏🙂🌷(Dream-changing Kannon)Gilt, bronze, AD late 600s – early 700s. Hōryūji temple, National Treasure. Photo by Sasaki Kyosuke, provided by Nara National Museum.Nara, in the Yamato region of Japan, was the country’s capital fromAD 710–784 – and the cradle of traditional Japanese culture.This special display runs in two rooms: the Asahi Shimbun Displays (Room 3) has treasures from Hōryūji, one of Japan’s oldest Buddhist temples, dating between the AD 600s and 700s. The Mitsubishi Corporation Japanese Galleries feature sacred sculptures and paintings from the great temples and shrines of Nara, from the AD 700s to the 1400s.Sourcehttps://britishmuseum.org/whats_on/exhibitions/nara.aspx--------------------------------Bodhisattva de la Compasión (Kannon que cambia los sueños) 🙏🙂🌷Bronce dorado, escultura, finales de los años 600 y principios de los 700.  Templo Hōryūji, Tesoro Nacional.  Foto de Sasaki Kyosuke (Museo Nacional de Nara). Nara, en la región de Yamato de Japón, era la capital del país desde AD 710–784 - y la cuna de la cultura tradicional japonesa.  Esta exhibición especial se ejecuta en dos salas: las exhibiciones Asahi Shimbun (Sala 3) tienen tesoros de Hōryūji, uno de los templos budistas más antiguos de Japón, que data de los años 600 y 700 d. C.  Las galerías japonesas de la Corporación Mitsubishi presentan esculturas sagradas y pinturas de los grandes templos y santuarios de Nara, desde los años 700 d. C. hasta los años 1400.Fuentehttps://britishmuseum.org/whats_on/exhibitions/nara.aspx#kannon #kannonbosatsu #japanesetraditional #japaneseculture #arts #japanesearts #buddhistarts #buddhastatue #buddhaspirit #buddha #buddhism #japanesebuddhism #nara #britishmuseum #🙏🙏🙏 #🙏🌟🙏🌟🙏🌟🙏🌟

name: 2019-09-30 14.48.17 2144148974634080755_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🏛️EARLY MORNING EXPLORERS AT THE BRITISH MUSEUM⁠🏛️.⁠I had a dream... that we were the only people in the British Museum. Madness, right? Well this dream came true yesterday when we attended the first #EarlyMorningExplorers @BritishMuseum.⁠.⁠I'll stop being flippant.The fact is that noisy, bright and busy environments are completely unmanageable for families with children on the autism spectrum. And the lack of understanding from others makes the inevitable meltdowns even harder to cope with. So the treasures which are our national museum, packed to the rafters with tourists and day trippers, are out of bounds for many families.⁠.⁠The good news is that many museums now run special events, aimed at families with children on the autism spectrum and others who would benefit from a quieter environment. There's less people, lights are dimmed or dark areas lit, hand driers are turned off, and special sensory areas are set up. Staff are trained - and even better, there won't be a single raised eyebrow as every parent will have first hand experience of autistic behaviours.⁠.⁠For their first Early Morning Explorers, the British Museum opened up their Greek galleries, and put on brilliant interactive storytelling (with warnings about any noises), make your own Trojan horse crafts, object handling and sensory play trays. It was brilliant to be able enjoy this museum with the kids, one we normally avoid. More pics in story highlights 👆⁠.⁠AUTISM IN MUSEUM EVENTS⁠* The next Early Morning Explorers at the BM will be on Sunday 16 February 2020. FREE, booking required.⁠* Follow @autisminmuseums, run by @tinctureofmuseum, for more museum autism events⁠.⁠If you know anyone who might benefit from this post, please send it to them. I had the most heartwarming response to one of my stories from a parent who dreams of taking their child with autism to a big museum, but hadn't before realised that these events run. Hopefully by sharing events like this, this parent, and others like them, can have their dreams come true, for a few hours at least.⁠.⁠If you could have one museum all to yourself, which would it be? #autismfriendly #britishmuseum #kidsinmuseums

text: ‘In my mind she’s rather rotund, red in the face and tottering down the busy causeway at Wapping Old Stairs to a waiting wherry. Her iron pattens are ringing like the hooves of a newly shod pony when suddenly there’s a scrape, a faint crack, a yelp and she’s come crashing to the ground amid the sludge. In the confusion that follows, her right shoe is pulled off, and together with its patten is lost in the mud’Mudlarking: Lost and Found on the River Thames by Lara Maiklem (Bloomsbury)#londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking

text: United Kingdom🇬🇧 Day1-London✈️好久沒有飛這麼遠，期待好久的旅程，感謝我的好旅伴安安@jennifer157963 一起規劃了跨國行英法自助旅行，落地後第一餐就嘗試了英國的麥當勞🍟，跟台灣的味道似乎沒差太多，只是可以選的產品更多樣化。第一站來到British museum大英博物館🏛️是開放免費參觀，是世界上規模最大、最著名的博物館之一，在進入之前還要安檢，整個博物館的展覽很用心，總共包含了非洲、大洋洲、美洲館、古埃及、蘇丹館、亞洲館、不列顛、歐洲等等十個館，整個歷史年代的文物很齊全。第二站Covent Garden柯芬園市集，吃了在英國第一隻冰淇淋🍦，Venchi Gelato來自意大利佛羅倫斯很繽紛的一家冰淇淋店，聽說義大利的冰淇淋隨意吃都不會踩雷，來英國可以吃到義大利很有名的冰淇淋也很幸運，還有英國必買的茶Whittard of Chelsea☕,Whittard在英格蘭創立於1886年，到現在已經有百年歷史了,每款包裝都好美好有質感，挑了皮卡迪里(Piccadilly Blend)這款紅茶有著玫瑰、草莓、蓮花等香氣，喝來有如莓果茶般；還挑了即溶茶Flavour Instant Tea特別的口味Lychee &Mango喝起來淡淡的甜味與荔枝芒果果香味。搭了英國雙層巴士🚃到了倫敦眼London Eye🎡，英國為了慶祝2,000年（千禧年）來臨而興建的暫時性建築景點，所以又被稱為千禧之輪（Millennium Wheel）🎡，於倫敦泰晤士河南畔的蘭貝斯區，面向坐擁國會大樓與大笨鐘的西敏市。是很熱鬧的一帶，我們先在網路上買了搭乘London eye摩天輪的票，搭上摩天輪可以一覽整個泰晤士河畔景色與西敏寺跟大笨鐘，可惜大笨鐘還在維修中所以整個被包了起來，但還是不減在摩天輪上放眼望去的美景，搭乘完London eye，買個餐車食物在河畔欣賞美景、看看街頭表演也是很愜意的一個下午時光。再回飯店前看了倫敦塔橋Tower Bridge是英國倫敦一座橫跨泰晤士河的一座高塔式鐵橋，也位於倫敦塔附近，倫敦塔橋常常被誤稱為倫敦橋London Bridge，從小聽到的兒歌“倫敦鐵橋垮下來(London Bridge Is Falling Down)”指的是倫敦橋 而不是倫敦塔橋唷~~最後用倫敦塔橋作為英國旅程第一天完美的結尾💯💯 ..#大英博物館British museum開放時間：每日10：00～17：30／週五至20：30 （每年1/1、復活節週五、12/24～26閉館）#義大利佛羅倫斯VENCHI CIOCCOLAT-Covent Garden柯芬園營業時間：週一 ~週日 10:00 – 20:30地址：18b The Marketplace, The Piazza. Covent Garden, London, WC2E 8RB#Whittard-Covent Garden柯芬園地址：18b The Marketplace, The Piazza. Covent Garden, London, WC2E 8RB營業時間：週一~日 09:30 - 21:00#倫敦眼 London Eye 時間：9月~5月 11:00～18:00；6月~8月 10:00~20:30（夜間開放時間請參考官網）地點：The London Eye, Westminster Bridge Road, London, SE1 7PB#倫敦塔橋 Tower Bridge地址:TOWER ROAD,LONDON,SE12UP#太多遊客要p掉真心覺得累，只p了一張後面都放棄，還好國外天空怎麼拍怎麼美不太需要套濾鏡😆#20190912#travelindependently #London🇬🇧 #britishmuseum #VEnNCHICIOCCOLAT #whittardchelsea1886 #coventgarden #ℒondonℰye🎡🇬🇧 #towerbridge🌉

name: 2019-09-30 20.11.25 2144311611102640563_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🏛LANDMARKS 🏛.Throughout our lives we all have landmarks and yesterday I went back to one for me. I spent several happy years in this beautiful mansion house on Great Russell Street and every morning I woke up to the view of the British Museum...and the odd mouse scurrying across the carpet of my bedroom. The souvenir of Victorian architecture is mice finding warmth and shelter from the London rain.I found going back quite emotional. It’s my old stomping ground when I first started working in London and I have many happy memories of hosting roast dinners, friends staying over, meeting an international set of flat mates (some of whom I adore...that’s you Grace and Eleanora by the way!!) and the Rosetta Stone being housed across the road from me.You know that Frank Sinatra line “regrets, I’ve had a few”? Well that was how I was feeling yesterday. When I lived in Bloomsbury I was so big and I struggled to walk to the end of the street. Taxis were used to go everywhere. I must have funded the corner shop and the fish and chip shop was as far as I could waddle.Yesterday reminiscing it felt like back then I was trapped when essentially I was anything but that. I had all the means to go anywhere and don’t get me wrong I was living a good life but it wasn’t healthy. I had London on my doorstep and yesterday I was wishing I had turned things around sooner.I then had a word with myself and told myself NO! What is the point in having regrets. I cannot change the past but I do have the power to change the now and my future. I get asked from people who want to loose weight is how do I get started? How do I stick to it? How do I not give up? My answer is do it when it’s right for you. Don’t be forced into it. You don’t have to do it. You need to want to do it for YOU! When your mind is in the right space it will happen. This is what happened for me and once I started it was like going downhill, you build on each step and before you know it it will be part of your routine.For your little piece of Monday motivation take advice from old blue eyes. I may have a few regrets but I DID IT MY WAY. If I can do it, so can you 💕

name: 2019-09-30 20.12.44 2144312264770106926_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Das Logo von ADWDas Logo von ADW – ein springender Wolf – geht auf ein keltisches Vorbild zurück. Die Umzeichnung basiert auf dem Griff einer keltischen Schnabelkanne aus Basse-Yutz, Frankreich. Dort wurden im Jahr 1927 beim Bau einer Straße mehrere bronzene Gefäße aus der Latènezeit geborgen. Zwei der Gefäße sind reich verzierte Schnabelkannen, die deutliche etruskische und griechische Einflüsse aufweisen. Neben Einlagen aus Koralle und Glas sind vor allem die plastischen Tierfiguren von Interesse: der Henkel ist ein springender Wolf, zwei weitere, stilistisch gleiche Tiere liegen mit Blick in Richtung Ausguss. Hier findet sich ein besonders charmantes Detail: die Figur einer kleinen Ente ist so angebracht, dass sie auf dem Strom aus Wein zu schwimmen scheint, sobald aus der Kanne ausgeschenkt wird. In neueren Publikationen werden die dargestellten Caniden als Hunde – nicht Wölfe - angesprochen. Darstellungen von Wölfen sind in der Eisenzeit tatsächlich sehr rar, weshalb es schwierig ist, die dargestellten Tiere eindeutig zuzuordnen. Die Schnabelkannen von Basse-Yutz befinden sich heute im British Museum in London. #ADW #Archäologie #Eisenzeit #Archaeology #IronAge #Basse-Yutz #BritishMuseum #flagon Literatur: A. Haffner, Die keltischen Schnabelkannen von Basse-Yutz in Lothringen. Archaeologica Mosellana 2 (1993), 337-3360.J. Megaw-M. Megaw, The Basse-Yutz Find. Reports Res. Comm.Soc. Antiq. London 46 (London 1990)A. Scheibner, Der Hund in der mitteleuropäischen Eisenzeit. Berliner Archäologische Forschungen 12. (Rahden/Westf. 2013)https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schnabelkannen_von_Basse_Yutzhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/ahistoryoftheworld/objects/O7nfGEryTSGFLgOPodM4tQ Bildquellen: British museumhttps://www.britishmuseum.org/research/collection_online/collection_object_details/collection_image_gallery.aspx?assetId=32229001&objectId=827612&partId=1&fbclid=IwAR0IzaPboE2ydsxKMnnryZObivdBUyGwWBnwn9Vk3XsQ6cDn5EaSkUCyHBg Wikimedia commonshttps://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schnabelkannen_von_Basse_Yutz#/media/Datei:Brit_Mus_17sept_049_(1).jpg

name: 2019-09-30 22.33.46 2144383258337580235_britishmuseum.jpg
text: I took myself on a quick date to the British Museum after my exam today. It would have been even quicker if I hadn’t got lost trying to figure out where the lord the European exhibition was. I thought it would cheer me up after a rather dubious exam. Fact is, I probably didn’t pick the best place to go as I’m now questioning all my life choices and wondering why I didn’t just stick with a job in archeology instead of switching to the wonderful world of finance. There is however a positive to getting lost in the British Museum. My step count for the day is off the chart which means I may have to leave my 2K erg test to another day so that it’s a fair representation. Silver linings and all.

text: Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. text: Londres é uma das cidades mais visitadas do mundo, e possui uma arquitetura muito interessante já que mistura traços modernos com antigos. Para essa semana, separamos alguns dos lugares que possuem uma arquitetura incrível e que valem muito a pena conhecer.Museu Britânico: com um acervo incrível, o British Museum, é uma visita obrigatória para quem vai passear por Londres. As obras históricas fantásticas, ficam ainda mais impressionantes com a arquitetura magnífica que as abrigam, e ainda possuem um atrativo extra, é totalmente gratuito para todos os visitantes. (Fotos 1, 2 e 3)The National Gallery: outro ponto presente na maioria dos roteiros de viagens, é The National Gallery, outro museu incrível, localizado na Trafalgar Square. Considerado o museu de arte mais importante de Londres, a galeria possui um acervo enorme que prende sua atenção por horas. Sua fachada e algumas áreas internas já foram fundo para produções como a série “Sherlock” e o filme “007 – Operação Skyfall”, e também possui entrada gratuita. (Fotos 4.5 e vídeo - 6)The Gherkin: não muito presente nos roteiros convencionais, o edifício “30 St. Mary Axe” popularmente conhecido como “The Gherkin”, é a mais famosa criação do renomado arquiteto Norman Foster. Localizado na parte mais moderna de Londres, o edifício não fica aberto ao público com frequência, já que é um prédio comercial, então são poucas as oportunidades que os turistas têm de conhecer esse marco da arquitetura. (Fotos 7 e 8)Com lugares tão fantasticos quem aí não gostaria de fazer uma visita? ....#studioatrio #studioatrioviaja #arquitetura #londres #london #reinounido #uk #museubritanico #britishmuseum #thenationalgallery #30stmaryaxe #thegherkin #normanfoster #arquiteturapelomundo #instaviagem

text: Posted @withrepost • @annunakihistory Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow >>>@ancient.road Contact Pages : @basileons @archeo.travel  #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum REGISTER FOR THE EGYPTIAN MYSTERY SCHOOL TAUGHT BY Billy Carson Oct 12-13. name: 2019-10-01 00.28.26 2144440968748403002_britishmuseum.jpg
text: El ureo era una cobra erguida en posición de ataque. Solía aparecer representada en la frente del faraón, protegiéndolo y transmitiéndole su poder amenazador.  La cobra podía simbolizar a diversas deidades. Este ureo procedente de algún mueble, lleva la corona del Bajo Egipto. Podría representar a la diosa Uadjet, patrona de esa región, y llamada también "la gran hechicera". #egypt #ancientegypt #archeology #pharaoh #diosesegipcios #uadjet #mitologiaegipcia #britishmuseum #london

name: 2019-10-01 00.31.55 2144442726397838491_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Great court at the British Museum by #fosterandpartners, completed in 2000.A glazed canopy over the courtyard brought back one of the forgotten spaces in London. The glass-and-steel roof works as a simple architecture gesture that respects the classical architecture of the original building while providing a protected civic space for all to enjoy. Second time back here, but with a different mind and heart.#greatcourtbritishmuseum #britishmuseum #london #normanfoster

text: Tutmosis IV Faraón egipcio de la XVIII dinastía (1425-1405 a.J.C.). Hijo del faraón Amenofis II. Adoptó el acadio como lengua diplomática, mantuvo una red de relaciones con sus países vecinos mediante el envío de embajadores y estableció un protocolo diplomático. Se casó con la hija del soberano de Mitanni.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: SELFIES EN EL MUSEO DE ...SAN JUAN DE LA MATASantalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.Una vez inaugurados podrán programarse  exposiciones temporales o permanentes.Los tres primeros museos ya se han inaugurado en Lapuebla de Labarca, en San Juan de la Mata y  en Madrid, y continuarán en Ponferrada, Alovera, Arganza, Sancti Petri, Vitoria, Trillo, ... SELFIES IN THE MUSEUM OF...SAN JUAN DE LA MATASantalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose goal is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.Once opened, temporary or permanent exhibitions may be scheduled.The first three museums have already opened in Lapuebla de Labarca, in San Juan de la Mata and in Madrid, and will continue in Ponferrada, Alovera, Arganza, Sancti Petri, Vitoria, Trillo, ... #selfies #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma #museedorsay #louvre #met #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #yaleartgallery #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek#rijksmuseum

text: Tutankamon Tutankamón fue un faraón notable en la restauración y armonización del Egipto posterior al periodo Amarna, pero debido a su corto reinado y la usurpación de sus pocos monumentos por parte de faraones de la XIX dinastía, no fue conocido en épocas antiguas.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: DAY 4:Spent the night on a House Boat in London. Visited the British museum during the day and it was amazing. There is so much to see inside that I definitely need to revisit. Would also love to see the national portrait gallery when I come back. Things went south and ended up spending the night on the streets of London wandering around. Met a great Swiss homeless man. Didn’t sleep at all, but London was still charming. I still have items left on my list for London so I will definitely be back, but for now on to Oxford! — enjoy my night pictures of London —

name: 2019-10-01 12.16.10 2144797183386562795_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Tableware and Fruits (c.1901).🎨 Painted by Henri Matisse.Born: 31 December 1869, Le Cateau-Cambrésis, France.Died: 3 November 1954, Nice, France. (aged 84).🖼 Oil on canvas 51 × 61,5 cm..🏛 Location: The State Hermitage Museum, Saint Petersburg..📝 Henri Matisse is widely regarded as the greatest colorist of the 20th century and as a rival to Pablo Picasso in the importance of his innovations.He emerged as a Post-Impressionist, and first achieved prominence as the leader of the French movement Fauvism. Although interested in Cubism, he rejected it, and instead sought to use color as the foundation for expressive, decorative, and often monumental paintings.As he once controversially wrote, he sought to create an art that would be "a soothing, calming influence on the mind, rather like a good armchair." Still life and the nude remained favorite subjects throughout his career; North Africa was also an important inspiration, and, towards the end of his life, he made an important contribution to collage with a series of works using cut-out shapes of color. He is also highly regarded as a sculptor.According to David Rockefeller, Matisse's final work was the design for a stained-glass window installed at the Union Church of Pocantico Hills near the Rockefeller estate north of New York City. "It was his final artistic creation; the maquette was on the wall of his bedroom when he died in November of 1954", Rockefeller writes. Installation was completed in 1956.Matisse died of a heart attack at the age of 84 on 3 November 1954. He is interred in the cemetery of the Monastère Notre Dame de Cimiez, near Nice......#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #tableware #fruits #henrimatisse #lecateaucambresis #nice #france #rockefellercenter #yourarttimes

name: 2019-10-01 13.57.55 2144848400704910930_britishmuseum.jpg
text: “Jewelry is one of the oldest forms of decorative art : beads of obsidian and shell are among the objects most commonly found in excavations at prehistoric villages in Western Asia, and the intrinsic beauty of gold and colored stones attracted craftsmen in Sumeria and ancient Egypt some 5000 years ago.”Hugh Tait, the author a former President of the Society of Jewelry Historian pens the timeline of the last seven thousand years covering distinct periods through the journey. The cover page of this grand encyclopedia showcases a polki diamond( uncut and tablecut diamonds)necklace with pearls, rubies and emeralds from the eighteenth century Deccan India exhibited at the British Museum, a fabulous example of workmanship. ....#handcraftedjewelry #indianheritagejewelry#britishmuseum#hughtait#historyofjewelry#uncutdiamonds#tablecutdiamonds#polkijewelry#kundanjewelry#deccanjewelry#vintageindianjeweley#vintagejewelry#jewelrylovers#simrangosal#anahakundanjewelry

name: 2019-10-01 14.20.41 2144859860139128793_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Stolen from Africa, LITERALLY!.These are a collection Benin Bronzes that British soldiers looted from the Kingdom of Benin during the colonial era..The Kingdon of Benin & Nigerian Government have been fighting the British Government for decadea to have them returned back..Such intricate beautifully crafted pieces demonstrating the sophistication of African art & sculptures. Sad to learn the history of their theft and the ongoing battle to have them returned. Although amazing to see, touch and feel in person, it would be a better feeling to travel to Benin to see them in their rightful home. Some Bronzes have been returned, however a majority of the collection is in the possession of European museums and private art collectors..Sadly, there are many more stolen African pieces on display in the British musem. All I could do was shake my head the whole time. #britishmuseum #london #theafrofusionspot.#ootd #art #benin #beninbronzes #nigeria #africanart #africanstyle #backgirlmagic #museum #colonialism #british #blackgirlswhoblog #melanin #ghanagirl #stylish #africanfashionbloggers #stolenfromafrica #love #toronto #africanbloggers #torontobloggers #instalike #instafashion #instastyle #picoftheday #photooftheday

name: 2019-10-01 19.35.10 2145018136327735505_britishmuseum.jpg
text: .2019.8.12.London.大英博物館へ。.実は今回、次女の幼稚園のお友達ファミリー4組と合流する予定で❤︎1組は次女が年少の時に兵庫に引っ越してしまって。もう1組は半年前にロンドンから2時間半ほどの街にお引っ越し。そしてエジプト塩のたかはしよしこファミリーと我が家。.ひとまず兵庫に引っ越ししたお友達ファミリーと大英博物館で待ち合わせ。お友達夫婦は英語堪能なので、キッズプログラムのリュックを借りてもらってクイズを出してもらいながら大英博物館内を見学しました。しかもお友達パパさんは新聞記者さん‼️とっても博学で✨好奇心旺盛の長女が色んなお話を聞けて楽しかったよう😊次女は久しぶりのお友達との再会に浮かれて一緒にいるだけで満足。。三女とお友達の弟くんも同い年で月齢が近いので行動が似てて可愛い💕リュックに入っていた虫眼鏡と双眼鏡、大活躍でした👀..#大英博物館 #britishmuseum #イギリス #イギリス旅行 #ロンドン #子連れ旅行 #子連れ海外 #子連れ #子供とお出かけ #三姉妹 #女の子 #子ども #子供と遊ぶ #お友達 #母娘 #母娘旅行 #子連れロンドン #旅の記録 #旅の思い出 #家族旅行

name: 2019-10-01 19.55.07 2145028179764280206_britishmuseum.jpg
text: British Museum - Foi o primeiro museu nacional público do mundo! É, sente só a responsa desse lugar. O mesmo possui peças que contam a historia da humanidade, desde a época da Mesopotâmia, passando por Grécia e Roma antiga até as Américas. A entrada é gratuita e o horario de funcionamento é das 10h as 17:30, exceto as sextas pois algumas galerias funcionam até as 20:30. O museu funciona todos os dias da semana. ..... #eurotrip #instatravel #trip #picoftheday #instaphoto #instagood #travelphotography #eu #europe #viajandosozinha #brasileirapelomundo #isapelomundo #inglaterra #londres #reinounido #uk #unitedkingdom #mochileira #viajantesolo #london #brasil #braziliangirl #qualeaproximaviagem #britishmuseum #museubritanico #culture

name: 2019-10-01 20.41.58 2145051758564817263_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 先程大英博物館に行ってきました。入館のさいは危険物がないかのチェックがありました。中は、とにかく混んでいました。真ん中が吹き抜けになっていて軽食スタンドと売店がありちょっとお買い物。本屋さんもあってツボだったのがここのスペースラグクラフトだけ少ないとかイギリス人の扱い方という自虐な絵本とか以前必死に英語を翻訳してお金を払い送ってもらったロゼッタストーンのマウスパッドがヘタって変色しちゃったのでまた買いました。よかった。まだ売ってます。もちろん「イギリス人の取説」は買いました。なんと3まででています。どこまで自虐なんだろ😁欲しかったんですよコレ。カフェスペースは混んでいたので袋をもらってマフィンを買いました。全部で２千円くらい。中を周るのに時間かかりそうで雨も降ってきたため一旦戻りました😅ホテルから10分かからないところなんです。時間残っていればまた行きます。でもいまは晴れているんですよ。傘は持ってないとこまりますね。#britishmuseum #london

name: 2019-10-01 21.29.54 2145075883505692181_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Great Court at the British Museum, Europe’s largest covered square, is a perfect spot to grab a coffee before the museum officially opens. This may be our favorite museum in the world; we have been here so many times and yet are always surprised and delighted by learning something new, seeing something beautiful, or just contemplating the breadth of human history. For me, no trip to London is complete without a stop here— even on business and with only an hour to spare, it was always worth the stop. But if you never visit in person, you can still have have an excellent virtual tour — I would recommend A History of the World in 100 Objects (the co-production with BBC Radio or the book), which can help put one’s arms around the incredible collection in a discrete and less-overwhelming way. #britishmuseum #greatcourt #london

name: 2019-10-01 21.44.11 2145083075906517924_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Colnaghi is pleased to present at Frieze Masters this magnificent Late Archaic bronze statuette of a Centaur from ca. 500 BC (h: 17.8 cm). The statuette was probably part of a large cauldron or a tripod stand and seems to be the largest known example from the Archaic Greek period. Unlike later representations, it depicts the hybrid creature fully human in front encumbered with half a horse in the rear. Centaurs were popular in Archaic and Classical Greek art. The most frequently depicted episode was when they were invited to attend the wedding of their half-brother Pirithous but became drunk and attempted to carry off the bride and other female guests. In the ensuing battle most of the Centaurs were killed (Homer, Odyssey 21. 293 ff). Centaurs therefore symbolized mankind's unbridled appetite for food and wine, and violent sexuality.#centaur #battleofthecentaurs #battleoflapithsandcentaurs #greekmythology #classicalmythology #parthenonsculptures #homerodyssey #ancientart #greekantiquities #greekart #greekhistory #ancientgreece #archaicgreece #regentspark #artoftheancientworld #londonartevents #timeoutlondon #timeout #benbrownfinearts #britishmuseum #colnaghi @britishmuseum @timeoutart @artnews @benbrownfinearts @friezeartfair @frieze_magazine @jorge.coll @colnaghifoundation

name: 2019-10-01 21.56.31 2145089289196993733_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The King’s Library at the British Museum,built 1823-27 and designed by Sir Robert Smirke to house George III’s library which was given to the nation by George IV and moved to the new British Library in 1997.This magnificent room now houses an exhibition on the 18th century Enlightenment and,with its classical statues and numerous cabinets of curiosities,feels like walking round a grand country house,paying tribute to the great gentlemen collectors of the period such as Sir Hans Sloane #lovelondon #london #londoner #londonpop #london #londonist #londonart #londontown #london🇬🇧 #londonlove #londonlife #britishmuseum #uk #uk🇬🇧 #uktour #visitlondon #europe #europetravel #visitlondon

name: 2019-10-01 22.10.01 2145096078961552649_britishmuseum.jpg
text: A new book by Barrister Geoffrey Robertson QC to be released in November argues for the Return of the Parthenon Marbles to Athens! According to Stephen Fry the book “proves beyond any reasonable doubt that the Parthenon Marbles belong back in Athens. Elgin’s heist prevents the modern world appreciating this ancient wonder – created by the same people who gave us democracy, philosophy and (best of all) comedy. Other cultural crimes must also be redressed, and in this important book Geoffrey Robertson shows why, and how.” #parthenon #acropolis #athens #greece #AcropolisMuseum #Ελλάδα #BritishMuseum #bringthemback #αθηνα #reunitetheparthenon

name: 2019-10-01 22.32.10 2145107227707202080_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Just a few more from the British Museum... (1) Amitābha Buddha, Buddha of Infinite Light, carved of white marble and dedicated to the Chongguang temple in Hebei in 585; composite statue with missing hands— the right hand would have been raised in the gesture of fearlessness (abhayamudra), and the left hand lowered in the gesture of bestowal (varadamudra); (2) the ‘David Vases,’ apparently the best known Chinese porcelains in the world due to their age; these altar vases were produced in 1351 and presented as gifts to a temple on Xingyuan and are some of the earliest known blue-and-white ware. They are referred to as the David Vases after the man who reunited the pair- they had become separated over the ages (3) Porcelain from Longquan, China circa 1200; the tripod item in the front is modeled after an ancient incense burner, so essentially was made as an antique reproduction at the time; we purchased a reproduction of the reproduction many years ago in China continuing the tradition 😄 #britishmuseum #london

text: Giving a guest-lecture for the University of Westminster today on 'Anglo-Saxon Kings' which included taking the students to the British Museum to explore the archaeological evidence relating to the early medieval period. I'm not really a fan of the British Museum but the students love it here! The visit also gave me lots of 'museum experience' ideas to use with my own UoB students! #guestlecture #britishmuseum #medievalhistory #historyofmonarchy #academiclife

name: 2019-10-02 01.18.58 2145191182556595937_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Мои изданные детские книги.Их пять.Придуманы, написаны и нарисованы мною. Щедро политы слезами радости и отчаяния, пока создавались😀.Первая, "Играем в искусства", сделана в небольшой доле соавторства с дизайнером книги.В порядке выхода:"Играем в искусство" -- МИФ, 2015 год."Путешествие в Средневековье" -- МИФ, 2017 год."Остановись, мгновенье!", "Увидеть невидимое", "В поисках совершенства" -- Буксмарт, 2019 год.Ссылки на книги оставляю в шапке блога.Книги глубокие и без сюсюканий, так что можете брать их для себя, даже если детей нет или они ещё маленькие. Простым, доступным языком рассказано о непростых явлениях, читается на одном дыхании. Иллюстраций очень, о-о-о-о-очень много: сначала пять раз перелистываешь страницы и любуешься рисунками, а потом только садишься читать.Надеюсь, они вам понравятся или уже нравятся и стоят на домашней полке!..

text: EOS e KEPHALOShttps://www.facebook.com/AEGERIVSLICIVSCONTINVVS/Cefalo era un uomo di grande bellezza e questo fece innamorare la dea dell'aurora Eos che lo rapì mentre stava cacciando. Cefalo però non voleva tradire #Procri, ma Eos insinuò nel giovane il dubbio che la stessa Procri era facile a tradirlo appena qualcuno le avesse fatto un regalo e per avvalorare la sua tesi lo trasformò in un'altra persona. Costui ne ebbe conferma quando, presentatosi a Procri con un regalo costoso che la dea gli aveva procurato, la donna accettò le sue avances e quando si accorse che il pretendente era il marito fuggì a #Creta.A questa evidenza #Cefalo abbandonò la moglie per cadere fra le braccia di Eos. Secondo #Esiodo da questa unione nacque FetonteEsiodo, Teogonia, 986Rilievo in terracotta di #Eos rapisce #KephalosProveniente dalle Cicladi 490 – 470 a.C. British Museum - #Londra#britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-02 05.20.38 2145312817631447348_britishmuseum.jpg
text: アウシュビッツ博物館..一度行ってみたくて行ってきた。..今回はアウシュビッツ博物館で唯一の外国人公認ガイドの中谷さんに案内してもらった。..HISで「中谷さんと行くアウシュビッツ博物館ツアー」があるくらい。..ダメもとでメールしたら快く引き受けくださったよ！..クラクフからバスで1時間半。..ツアーには他にも10人くらい参加者がいて、久々の日本語〜！..若い女の子が半分あとはおじさんおばさんだった！..中谷さんは本当に博識高く、細く、丁寧に背景を教えてくれたよ。..実際アウシュビッツ輸送に使われた列車。..この線路に降りたとき、ユダヤの人は何を思っていたのか。..負の世界遺産とは裏腹に、すごいきれいな青空でなんだか複雑..うまく言えないけど。..#アウシュビッツ強制収容所 #アウシュビッツ #aushwitzconcentrationcamp #birkenau #britishmuseum #ツアー#世界遺産 #世界遺産巡り #ポーランド #ポーランド旅行 #trip #travel #旅行#旅 #海外

name: 2019-10-02 05.21.55 2145313457774416611_britishmuseum.jpg
text: アウシュビッツ博物館②..たくさんのユダヤ人はガス室に連れて行かれ..ガス室のニセシャワーからは水が出ることはなかった..写真の天井の穴がガスの穴..最初の写真の一缶で150人死ぬらしい..一部を除くほとんどの場所で撮影は可能だったよ..実際に収容者が寝ていたベットも本物..メガネや義足など換金できなかったものは保存されていて、それが今となっては遺留品になっている..アンネフランクが収容されていた跡地も..中谷さんは伝えていくことの大切さ..ドイツ側の今、ポーランド側の今、昨今の日本に言えること。沢山のことを学べて…..本当にツアーに参加してよかった✨..あー今泊まってるドミトリー（600円）ベットのフレームギシギシで二段ベッド揺れる揺れる〜..おじさんも寝てる〜（笑）..もう無になって寝ます😂..#アウシュビッツ強制収容所 #アウシュビッツ #aushwitzconcentrationcamp #birkenau #britishmuseum #ツアー#世界遺産 #世界遺産巡り #ポーランド #ポーランド旅行 #trip #travel #旅行#旅 #海外

name: 2019-10-02 05.53.00 2145329101876237516_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Let's kick off Black History Month with this little chap, a fierce-faced rider who's sadly lost his horse. He's probably about as tall as my thumb, and cast from bronze, which makes him more fragile than iron and thus more susceptible to damage; his eyes are inlaid with silver to brighten them. While his horse hasn't survived, he still has his shield, which he holds in front of him as he rides. His other hand probably held a weapon originally. Everything about him is the model of a Roman cavalryman, from this tips of his boots to the folds of his cloak.Why start here? Because this sturdy little fellow isn't Italian, or even British; he's almost certainly Algerian or Moroccan. We can tell because his hair and beard fall round his face in dreadlocks, a look we also know from riders on Trajan's Column (a copy of which you can see at the @vamuseum if you're so minded). This is undoubtably a representation of one of the famous Mauretanian riders employed by the Roman army across the Empire. That includes Britain: the Maurorum Aurelianorum, a regiment of these soldiers, was stationed on Hadrian's Wall in the 200s BC. Our wee friend here hasn't got a specific date associated with him, but we know he was found in London.The Celts, who lived in Britain during the Iron Age, left no written histories of their civilisations. The Romans were first to do that here - which means that there have been Africans and their descendants living in Britain, quite literally, since records began.UK, bronze, Roman period. On display in gallery 49, case 8.Want more? Don't miss my tour, Remarkable Women at the British Museum, now bookable on @airbnb! See bio for link.Pssst! If you like this content, follow and share. Trying to grow followers. 🤩#blackhistorymonth #blackandbritish #blackromans #romans #romanbritain #london #londonisopen #romanafricans #africa #africanhistory #mauretania #morocco #algeria #romanarmy #cavalry #dreadlocks #locs #archaeology #ancienthistory #history #historynerd#womenshistory #remarkablewomen #museumtour#londontour #feminism #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-02 06.17.55 2145341649412461665_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 3 photos >> The first loan from an Iraqi Museum to an institution outside Iraq since 1987: This is a Traditional Kurdish shepherds bag or “Turgay Shiwan” loaned from the Kurdish Textiles Museum in Erbil, Iraq to the exhibition of my work at the University of Houston. The bag accompanies the indigo ink textiles drawings which feature in previous posts and was made int the 1900’s. The weave is the same as a kilim, and is dyed with hand made colours from plant and vegetable extracts. A real honour to have this in the exhibition. My thanks to Lolan Sipan, Director of the Kurdish Textiles Museum, who told me that in its traditional use, it would have contained bread, possibly cheese, a knife and a flute.  #erbil #kurdistan #kurdish #textile #kilim #knotted #loomweaving #dye #dyedhair #natural #organic #sheep #herd  #mountains #art #isisbulletholepainting #craft #houston  #uhcl #universityofhouston #texas #usa #gallery #unesco #fashion #532gallerythomasjaeckel #britishmuseum #pittriversmuseum #rijksmuseumamsterdam #rijksmuseumvanoudheden

name: 2019-10-02 07.49.05 2145387530651110006_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 來英國一切都是為了買劉易斯棋盤，所以跑了博物館三次，最後花了200英鎊買下它，管理員說已經sold out，但我真的很想要，於是請她把展示櫃的棋盤賣給我，時間也耗了許久，終於她賣給我了，館內的最後一件，棋盤棋子都是用石頭手工雕刻而成，重量有五公斤，是我從展示館把它拿下來的，一整個幸福美滿～是館內最大的尺寸，所以照片拍不太下，但歡迎各位來我家下西洋棋，最後附上一張哈利跟榮恩下的劉易斯棋♟#lewischessman #britishmuseum #大英博物館 #happybirthday #crewlife

name: 2019-10-02 09.10.15 2145428386452232013_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The face that welcomes you into the British Museum 😍.I love great doorways, but this wood carving is amazing! 🎉.It was very interesting how many people rushed right by without even seeing this open door off to the side of the entrance.😳.Some were confused when I stopped to appreciate the artistry and snap a pic 😂.Yes, we go to the touristy spots and make sure to see the famous pieces, but some of the best parts of travelling are finding those amazing gems hidden in plain sight!.#freedomseeker #discovermore #travelpreneur #freedomlifestyle...Click the #linkinbio to discover Life Without Reservations  today!

name: 2019-10-02 15.18.27 2145613708913556387_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Darial Gorge (c.1862).🎨 Painted by Ivan Aivazovsky.Born: 29 July 1817, Feodosia, Crimea, Ukraine.Died: 2 May 1900, Feodosia, Crimea, Ukraine..🖼 Oil on canvas 133 × 107 cm..⭐️ Famous Armenian painter who knew the sea and loved it sincerely..📝 Drawing ability of young Aivazovsky attracted the attention of A. Kaznacheyev, the town-governor, who helped Aivazovsky to enter the high school at Simferopol and in 1833, the St Petersburg Academy of Arts.At the age of twenty he graduated from the Art Academy of St. Petersburg with a gold medal. At the age of 25 he have already gained international fame.During the period of 1840-1844 Aivazovsky, as a pensioner of the Academy of Arts, spent time in Italy, traveled to Germany, France, Spain, and Holland. He worked much and had many exhibitions, meeting everywhere with success. He painted a lot of marine landscapes, which became very popular in Italy.Aivazovsky's name is intricately bound with the sea. "Perhaps no one in Europe has painted the extraordinary beauty of the sea with so much feeling and expressiveness as Aivazovsky has", writes V. Adasov.When in 1844 the artist returned to St. Petersburg, he was awarded the title of Academician, and became attached to the General Naval Headquarters. This allowed him to travel much with Russian fleet expeditions on different missions; he visited Turkey, Greece, Egypt, America. From 1846 to 1848 he painted several canvases with naval warfare as the subject; the pictures portrayed historical battles of the Russian Fleet.Neither financial security nor life in Palace interested him. He returned to his native land, built a workplace/home on the seashore and, until the last days of his life, dedicates himself to the work that he loved.Aivazovsky left more than 6000 pictures. Most of his works are world-famous....#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #art #ivanaivazovsky #feodosia #crimea #ukraine #yourarttimes

text: ᛬🜨 ᛏHEAᛏᚱE ᛟᚠ WAᚱ 🜨᛬ Design based on die-plate (patrice) found in Icklingham,Suffolk,England. The design shows intertwined "serpent" style creatures characteristically of Salin Style II, a type of zoomorphic, animal design found on artefacts dated to the mid 6th century AD. The art style comprised animals being illustrated without limbs often with elongated bodies in fluid interface patterns#anglosaxonperiod #anglosaxonarchaeology #england #englisheritage #britishhistory #britisharchaeology #anglosaxons #weststowanglosaxonvillage #anglosaxonvillage #britishmuseum

Let me know if you’re in London & fancy coming along! #rethinkceramics ‬#ceramics #sketch #sketchlondon #hitomihosono #artist #padlondon #adriansassoon #artisttalk #wedgwood #britishmuseum #manga

name: 2019-10-02 16.58.56 2145664282222722994_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Avec ce chef-d’œuvre du British Museum, l’art du camée célèbre avec brio la mythologie antique. Vénus et Mars, son amant, se retrouvent pris dans une cage que Vulcain, l’époux trompé, bâtit sous le regard des dieux de l’Olympe dont les visages entourent la scène centrale. L’artiste-glypticien Calabresi, dont on voit ici la signature, nous plonge dans la Rome antique !_____________________________________With this masterpiece from the British Museum, cameo art brilliantly celebrates Ancient Mythology. Venus and Mars, her lover, find themselves caught in a cage that Vulcan, the deceived husband, built under the eyes of the Olympus Gods whose faces surround the central scene. Glyptic artist Calabresi, whose signature is visible here, plunges us into Ancient Rome!#bijou #jewel #Rome #Roma #RomeAntique #AncientRome #Italie #Italia #Italy #Calabresi #camee #cameo #glyptique #glyptic #mythologie #mythology #Antiquité #Antiquity #1830s #Venus #Mars #Vulcain #Vulcan #Olympe #Olympus #OlympusGods #London #Londres #UK #BritishMuseum

name: 2019-10-02 17.40.25 2145685159326911310_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Medusa Başları. Yerebatan Sarnıcı, İstanbul.İstanbul’un görkemli tarihsel yapılarından birisi olan Bazilika Sarnıcı’nın (Yerebatan Sarnıcı) kuzeybatı köşesindeki iki sütunun altında kaide olarak kullanılan iki Medusa Başı, Roma Dönemi heykel sanatının şaheserlerinden kabul ediliyor. Araştırmacılar, genellikle başların sarnıcın inşası sırasında salt sütun kaidesi olarak kullanılması amacıyla getirildiğini düşünüyor. Bir efsaneye göre Medusa, Yunan mitolojisinde yeraltı dünyasının dişi canavarı olan üç Gorgona’dan biridir. Bu üç kız kardeşten yılan başlı Medusa, kendisine bakanları taşa çevirme gücüne sahiptir. Bir görüşe göre o dönemde büyük yapılar ve özel yerleri korumak için Gorgona resim ve heykelleri kullanılırdı ve Sarnıca Medusa başının konulması da bu yüzdendi.______________ The Heads of Medusa. Basilica Cistern (Yerebatan Cistern), İstanbul, Turkey.Two Medusa Heads, which are used as bases under two columns in the northwest corner of the Basilica Cistern, one of Istanbul's splendid historical buildings, are considered masterpieces of Roman sculpture art. The researchers often consider that it has been brought for being used as supports to the column at the time of construction of the cistern. According to one legend, Medusa is one of the three Gorgonas, the female monster of the underworld in Greek mythology. Medusa, the snake-headed of these three sisters, has the power to turn his ministers to stone. According to one view, Gorgona paintings and sculptures were used to preserve large structures and special places at that time, and this is why the head of the Carnica Medusa was placed. ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road ______Contact Pages : @sevgiiyenerr ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #volgoarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #loves_monuments #statue #statues #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum #heykel #scultura #sculpture

text: A recent BBC article has reported on a new study that suggests that “some premium tea bags might be leaving billions of microscopic plastic particles in your cup”. Here at Camellia’s Tea House, we would like to reassure all of our customers that all of our pyramid tea pouches, available both in our Tea House and in our online store, are plastic-free.The mesh in our tea pouches is made from a special polymer resin, which is derived from plant starch, making our pouches fully bio-degradable. . . . #tea #camelliasteahouse #britishmuseum #teaparty #teapartytheme #londontearoom #londontea #londonteatime #afternoontealondon #afternoontea #englishtea #traditionaltea #teatime #teaobsessed #teabag #teaholic #tealover #cupoftea #visitlondon

name: 2019-10-02 22.01.52 2145816750449248900_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This could be a contemporary British tabloid cartoon of Boris Johnson and Emmanuel Macron, but actually this is a satirical etching from 1803, published by William Holland.Titled ”Britannia weighing the Fate of Europe; or John Bull too heavy for Buonaparte”, the print depicts the statuesque figure of Britannia holding the scales of Justice. The diminutive Napoleon is no match to the portly, well-fed Englishman, John Bull, who tips the scales to Britain’s benefit.The speech buble for John Bull says: ”A Conceited little Boaster - to pretend to be weigh'd against me - does he think I eat Beef and pudding for nothing”. Image © The Trustees of the British Museum#prints #etching #satire #humour #britain #politics #britishhistory #britishpolitics #history #napoleon #napoleonicwars #johnbull #nineteenthcentury #19thcentury #19thcenturyart #art #arthistory #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-02 22.59.58 2145845997211975248_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Nello and Patrasche: A Dog of Flanders..📝 Nello and Patrasche is without a doubt the most beautiful story about Flanders, the Dutch-speaking part of the little country Belgium in Europe.Nello is a young orphan who has an incredible friendship with a street dog named Patrasche. Both of them are homeless and they stay a lot in the cathedral of Antwerp where they admire the works of Rubens, the world-famous painter. After a series of mishaps both day on Christmas Eve from starvation and the freezing temperature. The cathedral which was the only home they have ever known becomes the spot where they take their farewell from this cruel world, together as always, like the undivided friends they were. It is perhaps one of the saddest Christmas stories in the whole world, but people are touched by this story even until today.Based on a true story. The story unfolds in the towns of Antwerp and Hoboken in Flanders.The Flemish artist Batist Vermeulen was asked by the city of Antwerp to sculpt a statue in remembrance and celebration of this story and the protagonists. In 2016 the endearing statue was erected in the shadow of the cathedral and is a tribute to Nello and Patrasche who really lived and died there, but it is also a reminder that there is nothing worse than loneliness and that there is even in the 21st century ugly things like poverty and abandoned people in our societies.This atypical Christmas story has captured the hearts of many people especially in Japan, where this story is the most told story to the youth. The mix of true friendship, unconditional love, and a tragic end is what great stories are all about.The artist Vermeulen has captured not only the spirit of the story but also the atmosphere of Flemish traditions. Historical evidence proves that both Nello and Patrasche were real. The people of Antwerp have closed them in their hearts for centuries. The statue is a fitting modern structure to an ancient story and it shows that emotions are timeless. The pavement that is upon them as a blanket is symbolic of the city of Antwerp covering them with their respect and love.Big stories are sometimes found in little corners… ❤️...

name: 2019-10-02 23.00.05 2145846057996550284_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Fashion & Gardens, Garden Museum⁠⁠This critically acclaimed and extensively reviewed exhibition at the Garden Museum in Lambeth explored the relationship between gardening and fashion. Curated by the historian and writer Nicola Shulman, historian, writer and curator of the exhibition. Jointly organised by the Garden Museum and British Vogue, the exhibition featured works by designers such as Valentino, Alexander McQueen, Philip Treacy and Christopher Bailey as well as a number of remarkable loans from the British Museum, National Gallery and the V&A.⁠⁠⁠‘I think it is a miracle what you have achieved in such a short time on such an exceedingly short shoestring. The show looks very elegant, coherent and smart.’ Nicola Shulman⁠⁠⁠⁠#londonatelierarchitects #instadesign #ic_architecture #archicage #architecturegram #architecture_hunter #thinkingarchitecture #littleblackbox.ny #critday #studioofblo⁠ #photooftheday #instagood⁠ #exhibitiondesign⁠ #temporaryexhibition #temporaryinstallation #britishvogue #Valentino #AlexanderMcQueen #PhilipTreacy #christopherbailey #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #victoriaandalbertmuseum #furniture #modern #detail #propertydevelopment #property #propertyinvestment #realestate⁠⁠

name: 2019-10-03 02.25.31 2145949457110906560_britishmuseum.jpg
text: FARAONA HATSHEPSUT Nacida en el año 1508 antes de Cristo, Hatshepsut fue la única hija del rey egipcio Tutmosis I y de su principal esposa, la reina Ahmose. Cuando Hatshepsut tenía doce años, su padre falleció, así que se casó con su hermanastro Tutmosis II y asumió el papel de esposa principal y reina. Permaneció como reina consorte hasta que éste murió quince años después, dejando a Hatshepsut viuda a los 27 años de edad. Hatshepsut y Tutmosis II tuvieron una hija llamada Neferure. A su vez, Tutmosis II también tuvo un hijo, Tutmosis III, nacido de una concubina. Tutmosis III era sólo un bebé a la muerte de Tutmosis II, por lo que Hatshepsut se encargó de reinar como regente. Durante su niñez y adolescencia asumió el papel de faraón.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: Polyphemus başı. Yunan ya da Roma kültürü. Yaklaşık MÖ 150. Yunan adası Thassos’un dolomit mermeri ile yapılmış. Boston Güzel Sanatlar Müzesi.Polyphemus, Yunan mitolojisinde denizlerin tanrısı Poseidon ve su perisi Thossa’nın dev oğlu, aynı zamanda Homeros’un Odysseia’sında geçen Kiklops.___________________ Head of Polyphemos (detail). Greek or Roman, about 150 BC. Marble, dolomitic from the Greek island of Thassos. Museum of Fine Arts, Boston.Polyphemus is the giant son of Poseidon and Thoosa in Greek mythology, one of the Cyclopes described in Homer's Odyssey.Via: @arkeofili Follow us: @archeo.travel @ancient.road #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

name: 2019-10-03 04.23.01 2146008587185931233_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Pernah mbayangin bisa ke London nggak Jon? Jawabannya "Pernah". Lho kok pernah? Biasanya jawabannya ditanya gitu ya ''Enggak''. Lha gimana kan emang pernah hehe. Salah satu negara yg pengen banget kukunjungi di dunia ini adalah Inggris alias UK, terutama London. Dulu pas mulai usaha @coolhouse.id , gambar pertama yang aku print di kamarku sebagai produk coba coba juga gambar Big Ben. Tiap pagi malem tidur setidaknya pasti lihat itu gambar. Cuma sayangnya sekarang udah kujual. Wkwk ya namanya orang dagang. Ada yang mau ya dijual aja. Tapi mimpinya tetep. Ya..saya rasa Allah akan senang jika kita memimpikan sesuatu. Berarti kita mau akan hal itu. Allah mau ngasih juga seneng. Lha kalau gk pernah mbayangin atau mimpiin, Allah kenapa harus repot repot ngewujudin? Hehe gitu mungkin ya. Ibaratnya orang ngasih kado tuh bingung mau ngasih kado apa kalo gk tahu yang mau dikadoin tuh maunya/butuhnya apa. Dan taraa...tanpa diduga ternyata Allah ngasih jalan saya bisa kesini, padahal ya nggak punya duit kan. Alhamdulillah dapet beasiswa 1 bulan di London yang mayan banget buat bantu hidup disini (walau kalo jalan2 harus nambah duit sendiri sih) tapi ya pasti tetap bersyukur banget. Salah satu temen selalu bilang "MESTAKUNG". Semesta mendukung. Nah dari pas saat itu dia bilang jujur aja sampek sekarang selalu jadi kepercayaanku. Semesta pasti akan ngebantu, ngedukung apa yang kita inginkan asal itu baik. Semesta selalu punya jalan buat kita, asal itu baik dan emang kita niat dari dalam hati. Jadi intinya jadi orang harus mimpi yg banyak ya...tp jangan lupa bangun aja. Lalu action. Semoga hal hal baik yang kita impikan bisa terwujud...dalam banyak hal tentunya, bukan melulu soal jalan jalan. Alhamdulillah.*BTW yang di belakang itu namanya British Museum ya. Wajib pokoknya kalau ke London kesini. Selain karena Gretong alias Gratis, museum ini gede banget.  Koleksinya Komplit dan bagus banget penataanya gk horor kayak museum biasanya. Pengunjungnya rame ya jadi usahakan pagi2 kesini biar bisa selfie sepi. Wkwk. Btw saya disini sekitar 3 jam. Itupun cuma baca baca dikit. Kalo mau baca semua koleksi mah butuh berhari hari kayaknya. #britishmuseum#london #uk #solotraveler

text: ISIS bullet Hole Painting (Egyptians) 2017 at the University of Houston Clear Lake, until the 18th December. The holes were moulded from ISIS damage to recently liberated front line villages in Iraq, with the help and protection of the Peshmerga in 2015. text: L@ND0N // 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿Dónde todo es grande y monumental... Si hay monumentos enormes cada m2 y por lo general nada te va entrar en una foto, ni su egocéntrica historia.Ciudad cosmopolita donde lo que menos vas a escuchar por sus calles es el inglés, y que vas a recorrer 🚶🏼‍♀️🚴🏼‍♀️ como opciones más económicas..MUSEOS > Demasiados y todos gratis. El #britishmuseum 🗿se lleva las estrellas si querés ver la historia del mundo concentrada en un mismo lugar (si, todo se lo trajeron ahí adentro), aunque el #nationalportraitgallery no se queda atrás 🎨..PARQUES > Todos bellos y enormes ideal para bicis, rollers, skate, long, etc .Si querés ver el BIGBen sin andamios espera al 2021 y si, hay muchas cosas "reales" dando vueltas por ahí. Si te gustan las ciudades 👌 no te vas a aburrir, y sino te gustan...escápate!🤘......#london🇬🇧 #londres #city #travel #travelling #england #trip #citytour #travelgirl #travellers #londoneye

name: 2019-10-03 13.38.07 2146287984763254652_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ウジャトの目ヘアアクセサリー★お守りや魔除けにいかが？古代エジプトの神様であるホルス神の「目」。「ホルス」は、エジプト神話に登場する天空と太陽を司る隼の神。右目「ラーの目」が松果体という人間が持っている器官を表す。左目「ウジャトの目)」は「全能の目」、「万物を見通す目」と言われており、人ならざる存在、つまり神の目であることを表している。「ピラミッドに描かれた目」は、ウジャトの目で、フリーメイソンの象徴だそうな♪ 。。★久々の博多阪急★『ユトリエ』×｢洒落市場｣～英国と考古学の宴～10/2(水) ～10/8(火) 。。★初海外出展はUAE★Etihad Modern Art Gallery9th Discover the one Japanese Art 2019 in AbuDhabi11/2(土)～11/10(日)。。。#ウジャトの目 #ヘアゴム#お守り魔除け #エジプト神話#レザーアート #大英博物館#レザークラフト #髪飾り#leathercraft #hairaccesories#ujatoiseyes #event#Britishmuseum #art#amulet #thankyou

text: El papiro Harris es un texto egipcio, escrito en papiro de temas religiosos e históricos. Está dotado durante la Dinastía XX, a principios del reinado de Ramsés IV. Encontrado en una tumba en Deir El Medina y comprado por A.C Harris en 1855 ; en 1872 fue adquirido por el Brittish Museum. #egypt #ancientegypt #papyrus #mitologiaegipcia #gods #hieroglyphics #history #archeology #britishmuseum #london

name: 2019-10-03 16.18.10 2146368536642056282_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This champlevé enamel plaque in the British Museum shows Samson carrying away the gates of Gaza. It was made in the Meuse Valley, c. 1170-1180. According to Judges 16:1, Samson went to Gaza to spend the night with a prostitute. The citizens of Gaza locked the gates to keep Samson in so that they could murder him in the morning. At midnight, Samson got out of bed, tore down the gates, and carried them off.⠀⁠⠀•⁠⠀•⁠⠀•⁠⠀#medieval #middleages #medievalart #arthistory #art #history #london #britishmuseum #religion #moyenage #mittelalter #copper #gilt #enamel #old #skill #beauty #precious #arthistorian #bling #metalwork #gilding #craftsmanship #kunst #artes #medievale #gold #limoges #samson #altar

text: This watercolour by John White is an early depiction of the loggerhead turtle, painted during one of the artist’s trips to the New world. Coastal development is encroaching on the nesting habitats of turtles, one of the reasons they are likely to become endangered. For more information on loggerhead turtles and other endangered species, see our recent feature: https://buff.ly/2kO79Ig⠀Image Details: https://buff.ly/2mD6k5T Untitled (Loggerhead turtle), 1585-1593, John White. © Trustees of the British Museum, CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 #turtle #loggerheadturtle #endangered #watercolour #thewatercolourworld #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-03 18.09.32 2146424589947817755_britishmuseum.jpg
text: I found this little copper alloy acorn last week on the Thames foreshore. Even though it's small I think it's could be a button, perhaps more decorative than practical. The shank seems to have worn through, which is probably how it got lost. Acorns have been popular decorative motifs since at least Roman times - a quick wizz through the Portable Antiquities Scheme Database confirmed this with the number of buttons, mounts, brooches, spoons,buckles, strap ends that feature them and I found a few bits of 16th century Geman stoneware in my own collection with acorns and oak leaves moulded into them.Oaks are still one of our most common species of tree and have a wise and magical quality about them. Since they are usually the tallest trees in the landscape they are often hit by lightening, which may be why they were considered sacred to Zeus, Jupiter and the Celtic Dagda, each of which ruled over thunder and lightning. Druids also revered the oak, practising their rituals in oak groves and honouring the mistletoe that grows in its branches. Ancient kings and Roman Emperors wore crowns of oak leaves, and during the time of Oliver Cromwell couples were wed under oak trees.Oaks provided firewood and valuable hardwood for furniture, barrels, house beams and ships. The lower branches could be harvested as food for livestock, oak galls were used to make ink, tannin in the bark was used to tan leather, and acorns could be ground up to make flour for  bread or used to fatten up pigs. Leaves, bark and acorns were also thought to have many medicinal properties, including a cure for diarrhoea, inflammation and kidney stones. It's said old spoons often had acorn finials as protection from the 'bloody flux', so perhaps this little acorn was an added talisman against disease?#LondonMudlark #Mudlark #Mudlarking

name: 2019-10-03 21.38.59 2146530012193915367_britishmuseum.jpg
text: El Gran Atrio del British Museum fue algo que me sorprendió muchísimo. Lo había visto en fotos y me parecía imponente pero estar allí hizo que fuera más brutal aún.El edificio del medio es la Sala de Lectura fue inicialmente la biblioteca del museo y fue inaugurada en 1857. Escritores como Conan Doyle o Bram Stoker acudían allí a leer.En 2000 se construyó el Gran Atrio que rodea la Sala de Lectura y el patio interior del museo pasó a ser la plaza pública cubierta más grande de Europa. Eso demuestra la inmensidad del lugar.Las propias estancias, la propia arquitectura de los lugares dónde se encuentran estos museos, me ha sorprendido gratamente. Merece la pena visitarlo no solo por su contenido, si no también por sus formas.

name: 2019-10-03 21.48.21 2146534722984051051_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #newpost London、Paris 旅行の旅3日目朝食はホテル近くのcafe、The Monocle Cafe でcinnamon DanishとFlat Whiteをいただきました。(1枚目)のんびり朝食したあとは、Baker streetにあるThe Sherlock Holmes Museum ( @sherlock_holmes_museum )へ！9:30〜openだけど9:10に行った時にはすでに10人くらい待ってる人いた。ホームズの家を再現した建物内をじっくり1時間ちょいかけて見学。(2枚目)今度は歩いてAbbey Roadへ。Beatles のジャケ写になった横断歩道。交通量多いのに、真似して写真撮ろうと頑張る人たちを撮っといた。私は普通に渡ったよ…だって車運転してる人と喧嘩になってる人とかいたもの…。(3枚目)Abbey Road からPaddington駅に行って、初日に行かなかったPaddingtonのshopへ。ここで自分用に来年のDiaryを買った。(4枚目)この日のランチは夫の同僚の人たちとちょっと良いブリティッシュレストラン Holborn Dining room ( @holborndiningroom )に行くことに。お魚のお料理もあってお肉苦手な私も楽しめました。(5枚目)夫の同僚たち、月1でヨーロッパ旅してて、すでに14か国行った話など聞いて、羨ましすぎた〜。.ランチ後は大英博物館( @thebritishmuseum )へ。とりあえずRosetta stoneとミイラをみといた。(6枚目)ちょっと歩き疲れてMuseum内のカフェで休憩。(7枚目)その後は予約していたClaridge’s ( @claridgeshotel )のafternoon teaへ。サンドイッチとスコーンとケーキ食べて紅茶も美味しくいただいて、2時間半くらい過ごしたかなぁ。(8枚目)帰り道にReservedってアパレルショップで40%offのコートを買ってホテルに帰還。歩数:22,055steps歩行距離:8.6mi#london #england #londonfood #londoncafe #londontrip #london_city_photo #london🇬🇧 #trip #cafe #sherlockholmes #abbeyroad #beatles #paddington #holborndiningroom #britishmuseum #claridges #afternoontea #ロンドン #ロンドン旅行 #ロンドンカフェ #ロンドン観光 #ロンドン散歩 #NY駐在 #駐在妻 #カフェ巡り #cafe #美術館

name: 2019-10-03 22.28.51 2146555110497809805_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 畫花盆。台北故宮有個汝窯水仙盆，很美。我就想像，裝有水仙的水仙盆應更美。汝窯主要藏在大英博物館、北京故宮、台北故宮三處。中國的畫和瓷器製作都在兩宋(960-1279)達致頂峰。附一張數年前在大英博物館拍的汝窯照片。Painted a flower pot. The National Palace Mesuem in Taipei has a very beautiful Ru daffodil pot. I imagined it being even more beautiful with some daffodils in it. The Ru wares are now mainly collected in the British Museum, the Palace Museums in Beijing and Taipei. Both Chinese painting and porcelain making reached their apogee in the two Song dynasties (960-1279). Also attached is a picture I took of the Ru pieces displayed in the British Museum a few years ago.#香港人 #香港 #水墨 #汝窯 #水仙 #故宫 #大英博物館 #hongkong #hk #hongkonger #hkg #hkart #hkartist #hongkongartist #artcollector #hkig #hkiger #painting #peinture #hongkongais #hongkongart #artlovers #contemporaryart #inkart #daffodils #ruware #britishmuseum #nationalpalacemuseum #celadon #porcelain

name: 2019-10-04 00.36.32 2146619377536109936_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Cornish Coast..🎨 Painted by Dame Laura Knight.Born: 4 August 1877, Long Eaton, Derbyshire, England.Died: 7 July 1970, London, England. (aged 92).🖼 Oil on canvas 64,8 x 76,3 cm..🏛 Location: National Museum of Wales..📝 One of the leading female artists of the twentieth century.The youngest of the three daughters of Charles and Charlotte Johnson. Her father abandoned the family not long after her birth, and Knight grew up amid financial problems.Charlotte Johnson taught part-time at the Nottingham School of Art, and managed to have Knight enrolled as an 'artisan student' there, paying no fees, aged just 13.At the age of fifteen, and still a student herself, Knight took over her mother's teaching duties when Charlotte was diagnosed with cancer and became seriously ill.Laura met one of the most promising students, Harold Knight, then aged 17, and determined that the best method of learning was to copy Harold's technique.They became friends, and married in 1903, changing her surname from Johnson.At first they lived in an artist’s colony in Staithes, North Yorkshire, until moving to Newlyn, Cornwall, in 1907, where they became leading members of the Newlyn School of Artists.In 1919 she moved to St. John's Wood, which was to be the base for the remainder of her life.Laura was known for painting amidst the world of the theatre and ballet in London, and for being a war artist during the Second World War.She was also greatly interested in, and inspired by, marginalised communities and individuals, including Gypsies and circus performers.In 1961 Harold Knight died at Colwall; the couple had been married fifty-eight years.Laura died in 1970, aged 92, three days before a large exhibition of her work opened at the Nottingham Castle Art Gallery and Museum......#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #cornish #coast #damelauraknight #longeaton #derbyshire #london #england #nottingham #yourarttimes

name: 2019-10-04 01.35.56 2146649271322089999_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Kraliçe Nefertiti"___________Nefertiti (MÖ 1370–1330), bir Mısır kraliçesi olup, tek tanrılı Atenizim dinini yayan Firavun Akhenaton’un eşidir. Eski Mısır tarihine ait bütün kitaplar, onun dillere destan güzelliğinden bahseder. Adı; “güzellik geliyor”, “güzel olan” ya da “güzelden gelen” anlamlarına geliyor. Kimi kaynaklarda Nefertiti’nin asıl adının Tadukhepa olduğu, ünlü güzelliğinden dolayı Nefertiti ismiyle anıldığı ifade ediliyor._Kraliçe Nefertiti’nin, nerden geldiği ve kökeni tam olarak bilinmemekte olup bununla ilgili, çeşitli varsayımlar vardır. Bunlardan en kabul göreni; Firavunların üç nesilden beri dost ülkelerle iyi ilişkilerini sürdürmek için onların prenseslerini alma alışkanlığı edindikleri 18. Hanedanlık zamanına götürüyor bizi; Mezopotamya ile Kafkaslar arasında bulunan Mitanni devletine._____________Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel  @ancient.road ______Contact Pages : @sevgiiyenerr ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-10-04 01.45.31 2146654093429479401_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Art Dubai’s Artistic Director Pablo del Val and International Director Chloe Vaitsou would like to thank everybody who attended the London launch of our Art Dubai 2020 programme this morning.With particular thanks to our seven curators, who spoke about a range of themes in the lead up to the fourteenth edition: Sam Bardaouil and Till Fellrath (Art Dubai Modern); Nancy Adajania (Bawabba); Kabelo Malatsie (Residents); Nataša Petrešin-Bachelez (Art Dubai Commission, in collaboration with Jameel Arts Centre); Munira Al Sayegh (UAE NOW), and Marina Fokidis (Performance). And of course, this morning wouldn’t have been possible without the generosity of Venetia Porter, curator of Islamic and contemporary Middle East art, and the British Museum for hosting us in the Albukhary Foundation Gallery of Islamic Art.Art Dubai will return March 25-28, 2020 with a special preview on March 24. More details to come, very soon......@artdubai @pabsdv @venetia_porter @chloevaitsou @britishmuseum @munira.alsayegh @marinafokidis @adajanianancy @natasapetresin @kabelo_malatsie @sbardaouil @till.fellrath #artdubai #dubai #art #artdubai2020 #ad2020 #london #curators #BritishMuseum #uae @jameelartscentre #uaenow

name: 2019-10-04 02.29.02 2146676001865404001_britishmuseum.jpg
text: AMENHOTEP IIISu reinado, se dividió en dos grandes períodos. Durante los primeros años de gobierno, el faraón aparece como un rey joven y vigoroso, a la manera de Amenhotep II, el predecesor de su padre. Luego, en los 25 años posteriores, destaca una política de construcción de grandes obras y la corregencia con el que fue su hijo y sucesor, Amenhotep IV, el futuro Akhenatón. Uno de los acontecimientos más importantes en la vida del faraón fue su matrimonio con Tiy, la Gran Esposa Real, que se desempeñó un importante papel durante su reinado.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt#mummy #metropolitan#britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-04 05.49.59 2146777136768331603_britishmuseum.jpg
text: King of Persia Cyrus the great entered Babylon in 539 BC.This iconic clay as cylinder, known as Cyrus cylinders is inscribed in Babylonian cuneiform with an account by Cyrus of his conquest of Babylon in 539 BC and the capture of Nabonidus, the last Babylonian King.The Cylinder has sometimes been described as ‘the first charter of human rights’, as it describes measures of relief Cyrus Brought to the inhabitants of the city after its capture.@britishmuseum #ladangazor#art#artist#visualart#contemporaryart#photography#photographer#minimalart#artlovers#artworks#instaphoto#artoftheday#artsy#timeoutlondon#artsy #arte#londonart#minimalism#artistoninstagram#contemporaryphotography #photooftheday #pieceofart #iraniancontemporaryart#mobile_photography#museum #timeout#london #england #britishmuseum #history #iran

name: 2019-10-04 13.59.05 2147023311048220192_britishmuseum.jpg
text: La Femme au Chat (c.1880).🎨 Painted by Edouard Manet.Born: 23 January 1832, Paris, France.Died: 30 April 1883, Paris, France. (aged 51).🖼 Oil on canvas 92 x 73 cm..🏛 Location: Tate Museum, London..📝 Manet had an upper-class upbringing, but also led a bohemian life, and was driven to scandalize the French Salon public with his disregard for academic conventions and his strikingly modern images of urban life.He has long been associated with the Impressionists; he was certainly an important influence on them and he learned much from them himself. However, in recent years critics have acknowledged that he also learned from the Realism and Naturalism of his French contemporaries, and even from 17th century Spanish painting. This twin interest in Old Masters and contemporary Realism gave him the crucial foundation for his revolutionary approach.Manet's modernity lies above all in his eagerness to update older genres of painting by injecting new content or by altering the conventional elements.He did so with an acute sensitivity to historical tradition and contemporary reality. This was also undoubtedly the root cause of many of the scandals he provoked.He is credited with popularizing the technique of alla prima painting. Rather than build up colors in layers, Manet would immediately lay down the hue that most closely matched the final effect he sought. The approach came to be used widely by the Impressionists, who found it perfectly suited to the pressures of capturing effects of light and atmosphere whilst painting outdoors.His loose handling of paint, and his schematic rendering of volumes, led to areas of "flatness" in his pictures. In the artist's day, this flatness may have suggested popular posters or the artifice of painting - as opposed to its realism. Today, critics see this quality as the first example of "flatness" in modern art.Manet continued to paint portraits of women, still-lifes, landscapes, and flowers, even from his sickbed. Succumbing to a nervous disorder - most likely from tertiary syphilis - Manet died a horrible death after having been reduced to a wheelchair from gangrene, and even losing his leg....
