name: 2019-10-04 14.10.26 2147029022230828945_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 1923-1929 En este mismo año se embarca como grumete en uno de los últimos barcos mercantes de vela. Durante los dos años que dura su travesía se dedica a pintar en los puertos. Realiza exposiciones colectivas -Galería Buchholz entre otras- y viaja frecuentemente por Europa, la Unión Soviética y África del Norte. De regreso a Berlín se ocupa del diseño de escenografías para cine y teatro con el UFA. Trabaja como escritor y reportero en periódicos y revistas #Königsberger Hartungsche Zeitung, #Vossische Zeitung, #Berliner Börsenzeitung, #Deutscher Volkswirt, entre otros- escribiendo artículos sobre cultura general, economía y política. #Zurück #ufa #life #lieben #saemisch #art #berlinmuseum #britishmuseum #expresionism #germany #deutschland #Imjus_ac #Uam #mbellasartes #pacegallery #museodelprado #museoartemodernomx #travel #arte #subasta #jaguar #preservación

name: 2019-10-04 16.51.27 2147110068347237023_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Have you ever noticed the hundreds of tiny works of art you're treading on as you cross the Millennium Bridge? They are the work of Ben Wilson, 'outsider artist' who paints on the chewing gum that's stuck to the bridge. It's got him into a bit of trouble with the police in the past, but because he's not actually defacing private property, just painting rubbish, he's not actually breaking the law. First he melts the chewing gum with a small blow torch, then he shapes it to the desired size,  sprays it with lacquer and heats it up again to transform it into a solid disc.I've been stopping to chat to Ben for years and he's kindly painted me my own piece of mudlarking gum.Ben's art bypasses bureaucracy and the controlled spaces of galleries and similar institutions and this weekend he is opening his Gum Trail. Join him at 4.30pm on Sat 5th Oct at the St Paul's end of the bridge.#LondonMudlark #Mudlark #Mudlarking

text: The change in seasons brings us much cooler temperatures, more damp days and higher quantities of rain, as well as much darker and shorter days.Hydration has been known as a key to wellness and health in any season, especially in the colder weather. Drinking tea can help you stay hydrated, as well as keeping you warm.The tea of October goes to Soothing Indian Herbal Infusion, which has a lovely warming effect on the body. Its taste is a complex infusion of spices combined with sweetness from liquorice root and rounded off with floral notes of rose petals. The infusion also has sweet and spicy aromas with a flowery accent. It's a wonderfully fresh cup to start your Autumn. . . . #tea #camelliasteahouse #britishmuseum #teaparty #teapartytheme #londontearoom #londontea #londonteatime #afternoontealondon #afternoontea #englishtea #traditionaltea #teatime #teaobsessed #rosetea #teaholic #tealover #healthydrinks #herbaltea #visitlondon #explorelondon

name: 2019-10-04 20.17.45 2147213899099745170_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Before the storm...Victoria and Albert Museum. Ten budynek zawsze robią na mnie wielkie wrażenie. Historia tego zdjęcia nie jest zbyt skomplikowana: tego dnia Ro odbierał dokumenty z pobliskiej ambasady, a ja w tym czasie wybrałam się na krótki spacer po okolicy, gdzie mieszczą się trzy znane mi muzea (może jest jeszcze jakieś, ale osobiście jeszcze nie sprawdziłam): National History Museum, Science Museum i Victoria and Albert Museum. Pierwsze z nich odwiedziliśmy podczas naszej pierwszej podróży do Londynu, było ciepło, słonecznie, pamiętam, że wszystko było dla mnie takie ekscytujące. Kolejne dwa odwiedziłam w lutym tego roku, w walentynki (ceny kwiatów na straganach wynosiły od 8 funtów w górę, by następnego dnia stanieć nawet do 1 funta, bo szkoda, żeby je wyrzucać, więc Ro wybrał dla mnie bukiet następnego dnia 🙈).Teraz postanowiłam tylko sfotografować budynki i to jedno z moich ulubionych zdjęć..Historia właściwa: plan zakładał, że sprawy w urzędzie zajmą około 20 minut. Niestety, zajęły około godziny, a w tym czasie zdążyła rozpętać się burza, taka porządna burza z piorunami, grzmotami, której idzie się przestraszyć. No i ja się przestraszyłam, schowana pod wiatą autobusową z azjatyckimi turystami robiącymi filmiki na stories. Pogoda się poprawiła, oczywiście, ale ja niestety zostałam naznaczona deszczem dużo wcześniej. No cóż 🙈 wcześniej tego dnia wdepnęłam w kałużę, która okazała się głębsza, niż myślałam 😂 to jest jeden z powodów, dla których na studiach moja kumpela nazywała mnie ciapciokiem.......#ciapciokowehistorie #londyńskiehistorie #londonstory #southkensington #londonphoto#london4u #britisharchitecture #britishmuseum #victoriaandalbertmuseum #victoriaandalbert #kroplądeszczu #niezwykłebudowle #stopandstare #mylondondiary #mybeautifulsimplicity #mytravelstory #vintagestylephoto #lightroompresets #igerslondon

name: 2019-10-04 20.30.02 2147220087375374514_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Planes de finde 📝⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Soy fan de ir a museos, recorrerlos y ver qué tienen para ofrecer. No importa si es un 🏛️ de bellas artes, histórico o de tapitas de gaseosa, si tengo tiempo/dinero para ir: voy 😃⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Mi mamá este año me tuvo que frenar 🙋 porque cuando visitamos París puse casi todos museos en el itinerario (museos a los que *ya había ido* pero quería volver). En Londres fue clara: "quiero ver la ciudad y -si hay tiempo- museos".⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Al final fuimos a la triada bendita: @britishmuseum @nationalportraitgallery @nationalgallery y me contuve de ir a más porque me adapté a ella, que tampoco domina muy bien el inglés entonces se iba a aburrir 🤷‍♀️ Sola fui a la @tate Britain mientras ella recorría la bella @westminsterabbeylondon así que hicimos win-win 🙌⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Pero no es necesario cruzar el charco para embriagar(me)se con museos. ¡Tenemos tantos acá! 😍 Mis preferidos son: @bellasartesargentina @modernoba @museodecorativo y @museofernandezblanco ¿Los tuyos? Contame 😉⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#tupropialondres #museos #britishmuseum #tatebritain #nationalgallery #nationalportrait #museumsuk #londonmuseums #museosnacionales #museosba #bellasartesargentina #mnba #patrimoniomifb #VoyAlModerno #modernoba #mnad #findecultural

name: 2019-10-04 23.00.02 2147295582396418916_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Fashion & Gardens, Garden Museum⁠⁠A bespoke showcase system was designed within a constrained budget, which satisfied the stringent requirements of the brief while allowing for maximum flexibility visually and technically. Through previous collaboration with world-class showcase manufacturers on new product developments, London Atelier had the inspiration and technical capability to provide a unique solution for the temporary exhibition. This was also tailored to the limited manufacturing capabilities of being produced locally. The showcase system was seamlessly integrated within the set work, and incorporated carefully considered lighting design.⁠⁠⁠#londonatelierarchitects #instadesign #ic_architecture #archicage #architecturegram #architecture_hunter #thinkingarchitecture #littleblackbox.ny #critday #studioofblo⁠ #photooftheday #instagood⁠ #exhibitiondesign⁠ #temporaryexhibition #temporaryinstallation #britishvogue #Valentino #AlexanderMcQueen #PhilipTreacy #christopherbailey #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #victoriaandalbertmuseum #furniture #modern #detail #propertydevelopment #property #propertyinvestment #realestate⁠⁠⁠

name: 2019-10-05 00.17.26 2147334534252132057_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ¡Buen Viernes para todos 👋🏻🌍! Arrancamos el día recordando este tremendo lugar que es #Londres 🇬🇧. Un lugar 💯 recomendado!...🌍Dato: es una ciudad con los precios más elevados que otros destinos europeos, donde para comer con las 3B hay que buscar bien en todos lados. Personalmente muchos dirán no comas @mcdonaldsuk 🍟🍔jaja y buee era lo mas economico 😅, tambien @shakeshack tenia buenos precios y con hamburguesas bien buenas 😁👏🏻..🌍Dato: para moverte por la ciudad, trate de ahorrar un poco y como consejo, les recomiendo buscar un alojamiento cerca de todo el centro (cerca de los atractivos) ya que, moverte dentro de esta ciudad tiene un precio bien elevado 😢🚌. Yo aloje en @smarthostels por un muy buen precio! (Lo encontré en @bookingcom , @airbnb estaba mas caro 🤔).🌍Dato: Si o Si recorrer la ciudad de noche, atractivos como #LondonEye #SohoLondon #CarnabyStreet y si quieres ir de fiesta el Barrio #Soho tiene varias opciones 😅🔥..🌍Dato: ir a Museos, ya que en esta ciudad son GRATIS 👏🏻, eso si necesitas muucho tiempo. Recomendable el #BritishMuseum..🌍Dato: bajar la app @citymapper ya que te muestra Precio, Medio de transporte y Tiempo hacia el destino que quieres llegar 🚀👀. .🌍Dato: para buscar los atractivos de esta ciudad, puse en #Google, Turismo Londres y aparecieron todos los lugares turisticos de esta gran ciudad 👏🏻..🌍No olviden conocer si van por poco tiempo (fui por 3 dias) ir a #PicadillyCircus, #TowerBridge (es el que tiene las torres jeje todos lo confundimos con el London Bridge), #LondonBridge, #BigBen (lo están arreglando), #BuckinghamPalace, #M&Mworld, #StPaulCathedral y bueno, no olviden la foto en alguna cabina telefonica 👌🏻🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿🇬🇧...Bueno este destino tiene muuuchos tips, pero trate de poner unos de los mas importantes 😅 espero que les sirvan! Cualquier cosa los invito a comentar y si tienen más BIENVENIDO SEA 😁🌍...Gracias por apañar siempre @rosendoropa y @alfachile_ 👏🏻🚀....#Uk #UnitedKingdom #London #Londres #Tourism #Turismo #travel #Travelgram #trip #Europe #chileno #dtpm #viaje #viajero #chilean #europa #globetrotter

name: 2019-10-05 01.00.20 2147356132846173825_britishmuseum.jpg
text: THE TABLET OF SHAMASH. This clay tablet celebrates the commissioning of a new statue of the sun god Shamash in gold and lapis lazuli by Babylonian king Nabu-apla-iddina (r. 888-855 BCE), after an earlier statue had been destroyed in the Sippar temple. Seated on a throne is Shamash in his shrine, while the king and his attendants approach him on the left (the king is in the center). ⁠⁠The symbol in the middle is the symbol for the sun. I talk about this symbol in some detail in my latest video on the Astronomical Knowledge of the Sumerians.⁠⁠To get there, click on the link in my profile⁠or search for "#mythsofancienthistory" on Youtube⁠⁠#shamash #sungod #babylon #ancientmesopotamia #inscriptions #ancienthistory #history #archaeology #antiquity #antiquities #worldofantiquity #ancientpast #travel #traveler #travelphotos #adventure #explore #explorer #travelbug #travelstories #traveldiaries #traveltheworld #amazingdestinations #travelinspiration #travelgoals #travelogue #worldtravel #ancientartifacts #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-05 03.09.57 2147421359274273254_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #여행 31일째 밤#런던#웨스트엔드#라이온킹세계에서 가장 많은 인종이 모여있는 도시, 가장 더럽고 냄새나고, 하지만 가장 아름답고 낭만적인 도시. 그 파리를 뒤로하고 저녁에 런던에 도착. 파리에 도착하자마자 해본 것이 아무 빵집에나 들어가서 크로와상을 사먹은 것이었다면 (파리는 어떤 빵집이든 빵이 맛나더라는 말을 너무 많이 들어서)런던에 와서 가장 먼저 한것은 뮤지컬보기!! •런던뮤지컬 싸게.보는 팁!!데이시트(당일까지 안 팔린 표나 환불된 표를 당일아침 싸게 파는것) 단, 10시에 티켓부스가 오픈이지만 아침 7시부터 줄을 선다는것! 유명한 뮤지컬을 싸게 보려면 3시간은 줄 서야한다는 말이다. But!! 그런 수고도 없이 싸게 보려면? 당일 유랑카페를 뒤져보자. 누군가 데이시트 티켓을 추가로 구매했을지도. 나도 이렇게 시간과 돈을 절약하여 단돈 3만원에 라이온킹을 볼수 있었다.라이온킹은 내한하지 않는이상 한국에서 절대 볼수 없을테니 꼭 봐야하는 뮤지컬 중 하나다. 우리나라 뮤지컬보다 값싸게 얻은 표지만 역시 퀄리티는 분명 더 높았다. 그럴수밖에 없는게, 우리나라가 아무리 배우수준이 높더라도 이곳은 전용극장에 배우도 하나의 뮤지컬을 전문적으로 하는 사람이니...(라이온킹도 라이온킹만을 위한 전용극장이 있고 배우들은 이 뮤지컬만 전문적으로 수년동안 해온 사람들) 무대장치부터 수준이 다를수밖에 없다. 아무튼 진짜진짜진짜 꼭 봐야한다. 꼭 라이온킹이 아니더라도 런던 웨스트엔드에서 뮤지컬은 꼭 보자!!#여행32일째내가 진짜 런던에.왔구나 하고 실감하게 된 것 첫번째. 사방에서 영국 그 특유의 억양이 들린다. 마치 내가 영드의.한장면 안에 들어온 느낌이다. 두번째 영국 특유의 2층버스와 택시들. 아침에 차가막혀 2층버스가 일렬로 기다리는 모습이 진짜 가관이다.#버킹엄궁전#근위병교대식이곳도 사람 진짜 많다. 좋은 자리에서 보려면 2,3시간 전부터 서서 기다려야한다ㅠㅠ(런던이 파리보다 사람이 더 많은 느낌이다) 근위병교대식 보려고 엄청난 인파가 몰려있다. 근데 정작 근위병교대식은 별게 없는데...?? 근위병들의 긴 털모자가 귀엽다^^#대영박물관#Britishmuseum세계3대박물관 중 하나. 특별히 유명한 작품이 있다기보단 전 세계에서 훔쳐온? 유물들을 전시해 놓은곳. 그야말로 전세계의 유물들이 다 모여있다. 돌아보다보면 어떻게 저런것까지 가져오냐...좀 심했다 싶은것들이 많다. 특히나 많았던 그리스의 판테온이나 피라미드관련 유물들#내셔널갤러리 세계3대 미술관 중 하나. 파리에서의 추억때문에 이제 진짜 미술관이고나발이고 그만가고 싶었는데 하필이면 런던은 대부분 박물관 미술관이 무료다 ㅠㅠ 세계3대 미술관이 공짜라는데 안갈수가 없지. 이로써 이번 여행에서 세계 3대 박물관(영국,루브르,바티칸) 3대 미술관(프라도,우피치,내셔널갤러리) 다 돌았다!!(나름 뿌듯ㅎㅎ, 대신 다리를 잃었...??내 다리ㅠㅠ)P.S 영국의 박물관과 미술관은 왜 무료일까. 정확한.이유야.모르겠다만 처음엔 남의 나라 유물들 약탈해 놓고 전시해놓은 것이 양심에 찔려서 그런가 생각했다. 그러나 한편으론, 확실히 무료다 보니 그 어떤 미술관보다 어린 학생들을 많이 볼수 있었다. 이렇게 어렸을적부터 다양한 나라의 문화 유물들과 수준높은 예술작품들을 자유롭게 보면서 자란다면... 과연 영국이 왜 문화강대국인지 알수 있었던 대목이었다.

name: 2019-10-05 04.22.53 2147458079935382572_britishmuseum.jpg
text: MCM Dinnerware spotted🚩.“Town and Country” and “Well of the Sea” both by acclaimed designers Eva Zeisel, 1946 and American designer William Craig McBirney for Shenango China of Syracuse, 1949. Zeisel’s work is made for Red Wing pottery of Minnesota. She was asked to produce an informal inexpensive service to “boldly modern” . The result was this collection which took its name form a popular magazine “Town and Country” Eva’s love of inventive humorous and practical forms is obvious with her different choice of colors which could be mixed and matched easily. Her forms are organic. McBirney’s plates, cups and saucers are also distinct because of its spindly linear construction - a familiar feature of post-war Art. #midcenturymodern #midcentury #evazeisel #williammcbirney #britishmuseum #midcenturydining #midcenturydecor #mcmpottery

name: 2019-10-05 08.48.39 2147591840089805495_britishmuseum.jpg
text: @bijouxreviewThis enameled gold, pearl and gemstone pendant embodies a hippocamp, the sea-horse of ancient Greek mythology. The word hippocamp is derived from the Greek ἵππος (horse) and κάμπος (monster). The legendary sea horse also gave its name to the hippocampus region of the brain, the shape of which is oddly seahorse-like. This jewel is in the collection of London’s @britishmuseum and is an early 19th century reinterpretation of 16th century jewelry. More jewels such as this treasure grace the Waddesdon Bequest Gallery of the @britishmuseum #seahorse #hippocamp #mythicalcreatures #pendantoftheday #pendant #pendants #britishmuseum #neptune #poseidon #antiquejewelry #bijouxreview #pearlpendant #merman #mermaid 💥#Repost @britishmuseum 💥

The exhibition of art and artefacts relating to Kurdish history, identity, persecution and cultural destruction by ISIS by international artists and a heavy presence of Kurdish artists. #london #friezelondon #frieze #thecitizennewspaper #uhcl #art #kurdish #kurd #iraq #turkey #thebritishmuseum #britishmuseum #ashmolean #pittsriversmuseum #iwm #imperialwarmuseum #bullet #isis #middleeast #painting #saatchiart #uk #europe #eu

name: 2019-10-05 10.03.17 2147629406063839473_britishmuseum.jpg
text: “For the whole world is the sepulchre of famous men, and it is not the epitaph upon monuments set up in their own land that alone commemorates them, but also in lands not their own there abides in each breast an unwritten memorial of them, planted in the heart rather than graven on stone.” - Pericles Funeral Oration, Thucydides II.43.3. ..This is one of the four busts of ‘Pericles with the Corinthian Helmet’ assumed to be Imperial Roman copies of the now destroyed Kresilas’ statue that stood at the Acropolis. Found at Hadrian’s Villa and now standing at the British Museum this Pericles is also featured in the opening pages of the Thucydides Volume I Loeb edition and  thus in the nightmares of even the most advanced classicists everywhere. ...#stoodforareallylongtimetogetaphotowithouttouristsinthebackgroundyourewelcome #periclesfuneraloration #pericles #notthativeeverattemptedtranslatingthucydidesforfuncosimnotanidiot #justopenedtheloebforthisquoteonly #strategos #thucydides #pericleswiththecorinthianhelmet  #ancientgreece #britishmuseum #ancientgreek #ancienthistory #ancientgreekart #greeksculpture #classicalstudies #classicsnerd #historynerd #romansculpture #museumlover #nerdlife

name: 2019-10-05 15.47.33 2147802675873676427_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Stuck for weekend plans? This is your last chance to see ‘Golden Age of Satire: late-Georgian satirical prints’ from the British Museum and ‘KINDNESS: Prints & Drawings by David Shrigley’ as they both end on Sunday. Wickedly funny depictions of the world from contemporaries of Lord Byron in contrast with deadpan humour of an artist working today. Strikingly relevant satire in glorious settings of the King Charles II Rooms.

name: 2019-10-05 17.59.44 2147869213170301475_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Pottery shard found by Klay on the Thames a few days ago. Could it be Madam Blondin (Selina Young) who traversed a 600 metre rope across the Thames from Battersea to Cremorne Gardens in Augst 1860? She performed the feat five times, to audiences of around 2,000 people, taking about seven minutes to make each crossing. A newspaper report of the time stated "her performance is apparently fraught with little danger, for she crosses the rope with an ease, freedom and self-possession that is truly astounding". But tradgedy struck a year later when she suffered a serious fall while crossing a highwire at Highbury Barn. She had already traversed the line in a suit of armour and pushing a wheelbarrow and was crossing while clutching a balancing pole loaded with lit fireworks. They exploded asymmetrically, threw her off balance and she fell 20 metres to the ground, breaking her neck and thigh. The accident left her a "mangled cripple" and she apparently never performed again.#Londonmudlark #Mudlark #mudlarking

name: 2019-10-05 18.13.50 2147876305681461593_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Halloween is not far away. To get into the mood, here’s an appropriate satire originally published by William Holland on October 1, 1792.Titled ”Resurrection Men” this etching (with a hint of aquatint) depicts a group of grave robbers spooked by an unhappy-looking ghost, who holds a bone (maybe one of his own) in his hand.The ”occupation” of resurrection men became notorious in the 18th century when fascination with anatomy grew and many scientists and anatomists needed fresh cadavers for their research. The primary way of acquiring corpses was by using the ”unwanted” cadavers by the poor, homeless or unclaimed, but there were persistent rumours that on occasion grave robbing was resorted to in order to keep the fresh flow of research material. Subsequently, a whole new profession emerged, and these resurrection men, often in competition with each other, took more and more risks to turn a profit from delivering more and more cadavers. Image © The Trustees of the British Museum#prints #etching #satire #humour #ghost #halloween #october #eighteenthcentury #18thcentury #18thcenturyart #art #arthistory #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-05 18.24.51 2147881853544078191_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The autumn term is galloping. I'm leading four different courses at two separate universities. Two of those courses - Black British Music: Exploring Identity Through Sound and Breaking America: Exploring the Value of British Music, National Identity & Culture via International Success - provide space for several field trips.-We visit a variety of venues, absorbing the passionate expertise of musicians & historians to fully grasp the real world consequences of the constructions of racial & social identities: the imperial pursuit & colonisation of nations; the transportation and enslavement of Africans, the oppression of African indigeneity, the use of cultural facets OF African indigeneity, of people, of natural resources for reputational benefit in the West. These trips ALL relate to music.-The international view of a nation propagandised to, how the Other musically respond to being Othered BY that nation is approached through visits to the @metronomes_mso Pan Yard where students play Trinidad & Tobago's national instrument, tangibly exploring the steel drum's position within anti-colonial expression, of musicality measured against more established, formally recognised instruments.-We also take part in #AliceProctor's #uncomfortablearttour at the #BritishMuseum, extracting the truth from the imperial over-simplifications, subjectivities and omissions accompanying 'imperial' artefacts on permanent display in one of the UK's most popular museums. What these items: foreign works of art, worship, clothing, tools labour & war (many demanded back) say in this official and popular space about racialised, gendered and classed narrative & (inter)national power (and the recontextualisation of history to suit those positions) reflects the enduring nature of contemporary misrepresentation - historic, racialised, classed, gendered, institutionalised.-When my 'Breaking America...' students visit the Royal Albert Hall & glance out unto the Albert Memorial, they're looking at a tribute (w/ carved global Others in subjugation on each plinth) that utilised all the funds raised from the Great Exhibition of 1851 to build the Hall. An exhibition in which (cont...)

name: 2019-10-05 18.26.15 2147882554850869011_britishmuseum.jpg
text: LONDON ARCHITECTURE: The British Museum// Robert Smirke (1852), Foster & Partners (2000)..‘At the heart of this cultural institution is the Great Court – the largest, and arguably most extraordinary, covered courtyard in Europe. Added in 2000, consider this proof that the architecture of one era really can be enhanced by another. And if the promise of a vast two-acre, two-century-old Greek Revivalist masterpiece isn’t enough, it’s topped by a hypnotic tessellated glass roof. Architecture turns artwork with geometric shadow patterns cast across the light-filled space. Explore the museum’s renowned archive of artefacts; or just sit back in what is one of central London’s most serene meeting spots’...An extract from our new photo book ‘An Opinionated Guide to London Architecture’ which takes readers on a tour around London via the best buildings. Light of exhibition is on at Coal Drops Yard until 20 October. ..Publisher: @hoxtonminipressText: @sujataburman @biscott_iPhotography: @taranwilkhuPR: @smithandbaxterArchitect: @fosterandpartners..#londonarchitecture #hoxtonminipress #wallpapermag #architect #booklaunch #archilovers #architecturelovers  #architecture #archiporn #londonist  #architexture  #architectureguide #designlovers #architecturephotography #architektur #britishmuseum #londonlife #londonmuseum #normanfoster #normanfoserarchitecture #fosterandpartners #robertsmirke #thebritishmuseum #revivalist #geometry #architecturedetails #lightandshade #thegreatcourt

text: 🇪🇸 ¿Cuál es la ciudad que más os fascina y a la que volveríais una y otra vez?Para mí, es #londres . Dentro de unas semanas, volaré a Londres por séptima vez. Y es que es una ciudad donde siempre hay algo por descubrir, una nueva librería, un rincón especial, un tour diferente, un museo que no tuviste la oportunidad de visitar, pero también hay lugares a los que es obligatorio volver: Camden Town, Notting Hill, Hyde Park, el British Museum......🇬🇧 What’s the most amazing cify for you, that one where you’d go back once and once again? For me, it’s #london . Insome weeks, I’ll be flying to London for the 7th time. This is because it’s a fascinating city where you always have something to find out, a new bookshop, a especial place, a different tour, a museum you couldn’t visit yet, but there are also places you must go back to, such as #camdentown , #nottinghill , #hydepark, the #britishmuseum , ...#traveltolondon #londoncity #ilovelondon #londonengland #londres🇬🇧 #visitlondon #ig_london #londonphotography #bigben #housesofparliament #lostrotamundospuntoes #lplafotodeldía #postaleslp #thetravellingnomads #globewanderer #womentravel #borntotravel #traveltheworld #travelholics #viajaresvivir #viajarmola #travelblogger

text: Joan Miró i Ferrà (1893 – 1983) aka Joan Miró a Spanish painter, sculptor, and ceramicist is considered one of the world's most widely copied painters! The number of Miró fakes out in the world is crazy.  Miró knew that his work was copied and faked, but he never seemed to care as his focus was always on his next piece of art. Authentic  Miró’s hang in just about every major museum in the world 🌎 search them out and enjoy the real deal. #miró #joanmiro #moma #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #philadelphiamuseumofart #oilpainting #modernart #midcenturyart #abstractart #tatemuseum #britishmuseum #guggenheim #museenationaldartmoderne #auctionhouse

text: Üzerinde Grekçe “Neşe” yazan iskeletli mozaik. Roma dönemi, MS 3. yüzyıl. 2013 yılında Antiocheia Antik Kenti’nde bir evin yemek odasında bulundu. Antakya, Hatay.Hafifçe uzanarak bir yastığa dayanmış, bir elinde içki kabı tutan iskeletin yanında şarap amforası, ekmek ve Grekçe “Neşe” kelimesi bulunuyor.________________ The skeleton mosaic with the Greek word “euphrosynos” (meaning Cheer). From the Roman era in the third century AD. Found in 2013 in the dining room of a house in the ancient city of Antiocheia. Hatay, Turkey.Next to the skeleton, which is leaning on a pillow and holding a drink container, is a wine amphora, two loaves of bread and the Greek word “euphrosynos.” ______________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@archeo.travel @ancient.road _______#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #greekisland #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum #greekmythology #ancient

name: 2019-10-06 02.39.34 2148130848923601265_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The magical #britishmuseum Its permanent collection of some eight million works is among the largest and most comprehensive in existence.The British Museum was established in 1753, largely based on the collections of the Irish physician and scientist Sir Hans Sloane. It first opened to the public in 1759, in Montagu House, on the site of the current building. Its expansion over the following 250 years was largely a result of expanding British colonisation and has resulted in the creation of several branch institutions, the first being the Natural History Museum in 1881 (Source: https://www.britishmuseum.org) #cityoflondon #london_only #london4all #london_city_photo #londonguru #timeoutlondon #thisislondon #thelondonlifeinc #londoncityworld #prettylittlelondon #itssolondon #humlondon #londondisclosure #londonvisionaries #visitlondon #mysecretlondon #mydarlinglondon #igerslondon #londondecanted @exploringlondon @virtuallondon #londonbylondoners #photooftheday #ilovelondon #londonhistory #londonheritage #shut_uplondon #londonisopen

name: 2019-10-06 03.54.32 2148168581232393663_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Guitarist (c.1757).🎨 Painted by Jean Baptiste Greuze.Born: 21 August 1725, Tournus, France.Died: 4 March 1805, Louvre, Paris, France. (aged 79).🖼 Oil on canvas 64 x 48 cm..📝 His early life is obscure, but he studied painting in Lyons and appeared in Paris about 1750. He entered the Royal Academy as a student and worked with Charles Joseph Natoire, a prominent decorative painter. During the 1760s Greuze achieved a significant reputation with his sentimental paintings of peasants or lower-class people seen in humble surroundings and in the midst of theatrically emotional family situations.In 1769 Greuze was admitted to the academy as a genre painter. Ambitious to become a member of the academy as a history painter, which was a higher rank, he was so angered by his admission as only a genre painter that he refused to show his paintings at the academy's exhibitions (the Salons). But by that time he was already famous and could afford to ignore the Salons.French painting during the 18th century was dominated by the rococo style. Rococo painting was aristocratic in nature, elegant, and sensuous; stylistically it depended upon soft colors, complex surfaces, refined textures, free brushwork, and asymmetrical compositions based upon the interplay of curved lines and masses. Produced for highly sophisticated patrons, rococo painting concentrated on aristocratic diversions, decorative portraits, mythological and allegorical themes frequently treated in a playful or erotic manner, and idyllic pastoral scenes.Greuze's pretentiously moralizing rustic dramas constituted a reaction against rococo frivolity in art; by appealing to emotion they were also a revolt against the emphasis placed upon reason and science by the philosophers of the Enlightenment, the intellectual movement that pervaded the first half of the 18th century.The rising importance of the middle class, and of middle-class morality, also played a part in the success of Greuze's cottage genre.Greuze survived the French Revolution but his fame did not. He died in Paris on March 21, 1805, in poverty and obscurity....

name: 2019-10-06 05.04.37 2148203858099273951_britishmuseum.jpg
text: INAUGURACIÓN DE MUSEO SOBRE CASTILLO EN PONFERRADATodo a punto !!! INAUGURACIÓN:9.10.2019 (Capicúa del año !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082 . 2019. 2082“El puente en el Arte”Una obra universal de la pintura cada año, 63 en total,  hasta el 2082, año del MILENARIO.Santalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.Los tres primeros museos ya se han inaugurado en Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata y Madrid. El próximo será el de Ponferrada.OPENING OF MUSEUM ON CASTLE IN PONFERRADAEverything on point !!!OPENING:9.10.2019 (Capicúa of the year !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082. 2019. 2082“The bridge in Art”A universal work of painting every year, 63 in total, until 2082, the year of the MILENARY.Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose purpose is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.The first three museums have already opened in Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata and Madrid. The next will be Ponferrada.  #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma  #museedorsay #louvre #met #salvadordalimuseum #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #yaleartgallery #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

text: A drawing made by grinding charcoal into ink, from the burned out main church at Qarakosh in Iraq. The work portrays the burned interior of a building in the same city after ISIS torched it, before the siege of Mosul. The second photo shows the same work in the P21 Gallery in Kings Cross in the exhibition ‘The Road Through Kurdistan’ which runs until the 23rd of October. #charcoal #ink #drawing #paper #blackandwhite #black #burned #burn #qaraqosh #mosul #iraq #thecitizennewspaper #uhcl #universityofhouston #iraq #britishmuseum #bisi #ashmoleanmuseum #911memorial #museum #worksonpaper #saatchiartist #peshmerga #isibulletholepainting #iwm #theaterofoperations

name: 2019-10-06 11.45.10 2148405463719450698_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Chew Valley hoard. Over 2,500 silver pennies were discovered by metal-detectorists in the Chew Valley, Bath & North-east Somerset, UK. The coins of Harold Godwinson (Harold II, the last crowned Anglo-Saxon King, r 1066) and William the Conqueror (William I, r 1066- 1086) are being displayed at the British Museum. The stunning hoard sheds light on the transition of power immediately after the Norman Conquest in 1066.  Repost from Current Archaeology & Carly Hilts. Credit: Image: Pippa Pearce, copyright Trustees of the British Museum. #archaeology #thechewvalleyhoard #britishmuseum #chewvalley #somersethistory #somersetarchaeology #normanconquest #anglosaxon #englishhistory #britishhistory #metaldetectorist

name: 2019-10-06 16.34.24 2148551032937430030_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Cecilia de Madrazo cose en esta acuarela (1874, @britishmuseum) de su marido Mariano Fortuny. Me gustó y compré una reproducción, pero a fuerza de mirarla empecé a pensar ¿y si no cosía? ¿Y si fue invención de su marido (no sería la única) por considerarla una estampa íntima adecuada?. Indagando un poco en su biografía, parece que la señora Madrazo sí era aficionada a la costura, aunque también a la literatura, la música, las antigüedades, la moda y la pintura. Cuando leo que era firme defensora de la idea wagneriana de la obra de arte total, no puedo evitar imaginar que todas esas labores de costura que yo misma he desestimado en primer lugar por considerarlas "femeninas" son en realidad creaciones artísticas que se perdieron para siempre.. En la web del @museoprado se pueden encontrar estas y otras fotos de Cecilia de Madrazo en su singular palacio veneciano, donde vivió hasta el fin de sus días, en 1932..#otraslecturas #museodelprado #britishmuseum #madrazo #fortuny

name: 2019-10-06 18.42.23 2148615454628377370_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Detalle del arquitrabe de la tumba de Nykaianj. Antiguo Egipto. Imperio Antiguo. Principios de la dinastía V. Hacia el 2.450 a.C. Caliza. Tumba de Nykaianj en Giza. British Museum. (9544)Este bloque coronó el pórtico de entrada de la capilla de la tumba de Nykaianj. El texto enumera los festivales en los que las ofrendas se presentaban para alimentar el espíritu del difunto.  Fue inspector de sacerdotes en el Templo del Sol y del complejo piramidal del faraón Userkaf. En dicho templo también actuó como sacerdote principal de los dioses Ra y Hathor.#antiguoegipto #anticegipte #ancientegypt #historia #history #art #arqueologia #archeology #britishmuseum #imperiantic #imperioantiguo

name: 2019-10-06 20.15.27 2148662292414095525_britishmuseum.jpg
text: I was lucky enough to visit #britishmuseum Friday night and spend a couple of hours in my favourite gallery spending time to sketch very poorly some of the wonderful objects. Really struck by #padmasambhva and #garudabird statues. I have been thinking about painting the Garuda in oils so pulled in the photo and played around with the colours. I don’t think what I want to show is captured by this image and don’t think it’s the right approach for an oil painting (I’ve been wondering about glazes) so posting my sketchy image ideas here.

name: 2019-10-06 20.31.19 2148670285884466520_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Hi followers! 👋🏽 I’ve been a bit quiet on here since wrapping up season 1 of Past Matters - life has been a bit busy, but this podcast is never far from my mind and plotting the Christmas special and season 2 for next year is top of my priority list this afternoon. What else are Sundays for, right?🎙🎙🎙Anyway I thought I’d take the opportunity to introduce myself properly, in case you were wondering about who the muppet asking the experts questions is! 🎙🎙🎙So, my name is Ploy Radford. I’m 30 years old and live in London. I used to be a full time journalist but now I do a bit of freelance writing around the day job of working in PR. Obviously, I love history, I have a degree in classics from Cambridge Uni, and the history modules were my favourite part. Horses, reading, eating and travel are also passions 🐴📚🍕✈️. (I suppose shopping is a guilty hobby too - this photo was taken in the British Museum exhibition gift shop - history and shopping = heaven 🛍). Do say hi in the comments and let me know which episodes you enjoyed and suggested venues for next season! 🎙🎙🎙#historygirls #historygeek #podcastlife #newpodcastalert #historylovers #pastmatterspodcast #historypodcast #arthistory #britishmuseum #furryhats #freelancewriter #podcaster

text: I love a free day out at a museum but I have to say The British Museum although beautiful is not that child friendly.There is not enough to keep little ones busy and occupied which is a shame as I was so looking forward to seeing the Egyptian section as that was always my favorite at school.Perhaps it's one I will re-visit when I have child free day (so never🙄) But on the plus side they do have fast track ques if you have kiddies 👍👍👍..#daysoutforfree #funforfree #essexmum #essexfamily #weekend #family #essexblogger #london #museum #britishmuseum ##westlondon #wc1 #mum #mom #mama #instamums #instagrammamas #realreviews #mumthatreviews #londonreviews #ourdayout

name: 2019-10-06 22.36.27 2148733262619887712_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Lintel 25 - Maya, about AD 725"On the second lintel from Structure 23 at Yaxchilan, the sacrificial offering of blood conjures up a visionary manifestation of Yat-Balam, founding ancestor of the dynasty of Yaxchilan. In the guise of a warrior grasping a spear and shield, this ancestral spirit emerges from the gaping front jaws of a huge double-headed serpent rearing above Lady Xoc. She gazes upward at the apparition she has brought forth. In her left hand she bears a blood-letting bowl containing instruments of sacrifice, a sting-ray spine and a obsidian lancet. "Ethno. 1886-316#maya #mayaculture #ladyxoc #yatbalam #ancestralspirits #ethno #yaxchilan #culture #lintel #ritual #bloodletting #anthropologie #anthropology #beautyofcentralamerica #britishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #london #england #uk

text: Yellow Tree, Red Barn (c.2016).🎨 Painted by Irina Rybakova.Born: 1962, Vyshny Volochok, Russia..🖼 Oil on canvas 27 x 35 in..🏛 Location: Grenning Gallery..📝 Irina Rybakova is a famous Russian master of landscape.The image of the Russian village and the village worker are her dearest subjects.Her art is appreciated in museums and collections both in Russia and abroad.Irina worked as part of the artistic group Academica dacha in Vyshny Volochek, the oldest and well-known creative base of the Union of Artists of the Russian Federation.In 1991 she entered Kostroma (a historic city) department of Artists Union in Russia. Promotes the contemporary realistic school in art in mass media.Image of the Russian village and the village worker are her most dear subjects and does not like landscapes without humans......#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #tree #irinarybakova #vyshnyvolochok #russia #artinfluencer #grenninggallery #kostroma #yourarttimes

text: Eskiden olumsuz enerji ve nazardan korunmak için evlerin girişinde KAICY mozaiği (Kem göz mozaiği) bulunurdu. "Kaicy" Eski Yunancada "sana da" demek.Yani "Ne düşünürsen düşün, düşündüğün seni bulsun".&In the past, KAICY mosaic (Kem eye mosaic) was found at the entrance of the houses to protect against negative energy and evil eye. "Kaicy" means "you" in Ancient Greek. So "Whatever you think, whatever you think will find you". 🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿Follow us>>>>>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road 🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿🧿#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

name: 2019-10-06 23.47.29 2148769016713579558_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This beautifully carved, jade terrapin would have been created in the early 1600s. The carving us so accurate that in can be identified as a female species from the river Jumna, a river which is a tributary of the Ganges in India. As it is life sized (over a foot long) and so well crafted it probably would have been commissioned for a Mughal Prince, or a Hindu Mughal aristocrat. It can been seen in the new Islamic galleries in the British museum. #terrapin #jumna #ganges #mughal #jade  #britishmuseum #theislamicworld #albukharyfoundationgallery

name: 2019-10-06 23.55.07 2148772857539087437_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ..Same room in the “Ancient Egypt” Gallery on the 3rd level of the British Museum Friday October 4, 2019. Priceless artifacts usurped by the empire as it left its colony showcased in the most visited wing of the nation’s museum all under a ceiling that has clearly long been suffering the ravages of severe water damage. And it is not under repair. Brought tears to my eyes. Shameful ..._____________________#britishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #thebritishmuseum #ancientegypt #ancientegyptian #disrespectful #disrespect #shame #shameful

text: Another one of the Moko Jumbies by Zak Ové in the British Museum.These kind of scary looking stilt walkers are a key feature in the Trinidad Carnival, with Moko meaning healer in Central Africa and Jumbi being a Western Indian name for ghost or spirit. They were first installed in the Great Court back in 2015 to coincide with the Notting Hill Carnival, but thankfully given a permanent home 👍#britishmuseum #museum #africagalleries #africa #african #museuminlondon #zakove #mokojumbies #carnival #trinidad #trinidadcarnival #henrymoore #history #follow #explorelondon #discoverlondon #itssolondon #mylondon #share #londonlife #londontips #like #londonguide #localguide #prettycitylondon #instalondon #igerslondon #timeoutlondon #thisislondon #photooftheday

name: 2019-10-07 01.56.46 2148834085660174167_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Я БЫ ВЕРНУЛАСЬ СНОВА⠀Расскажу о местах, которые меня впечатлили, и которые я советую посетить, если Вы поедете в Лондон ❤️⠀1. Warner Brothers Harry Potter Studios⠀Место, где хотел бы очутиться каждый любитель великой саги. Когда автобус подъехал к студии, я сразу поняла, что мне здесь одной скучно точно не будет. Так и произошло. Эта выставка организована настолько хорошо, что даже взгляд от всего происходящего оторвать нельзя было. Однозначно поехала бы ещё раз 💯⠀2. Natural History Museum⠀Особенно сильно понравились зал с луной, а также выставка, посвящённая анатомии человека. Не было времени все прочитать досконально, поэтому хочу вернуться!!! А ещё там очень классные минералы.⠀3. British museum⠀Пошла я туда утром, на все про все был один час 😱😱😱, чтобы посмотреть exhibitions этого необъятного музея! Конечно же, все залы мне обойти не удалось, но половину точно посмотрела. Если поеду в Лондон опять, то обязательно пойду пересматривать и досматривать.⠀4. National Gallery⠀Увидела вживую картины, на которые раньше смотрела лишь через экран 📺 место, чтобы расслабиться, духовно насладиться, понаблюдать за художниками и любителями. Да ещё и на Трафальгарской площади находится — двойное удовольствие!!!⠀5. Tower bridge⠀⠀⠀Не могу не упомянуть этот знаменитый мост. Сразу скажу, я не поднималась наверх, но снизу пейзаж не хуже. Сразу вспоминаю, как мы шли по мосту, затем вдоль набережной мимо White Tower, доходили до London Bridge, пересекали его и шли на London bridge station, чтобы сесть на электричку и commute.⠀6. Парк Greenwich⠀Те, кто придумали все парки в Лондоне — просто превосходны. Здесь можно не только посидеть на лавочке, подышать свежим воздухом, послушать о чем говорят местные, понаблюдать за их собачками, но посетить музеи. Мой любимый — Queen’s house. Во-первых, там были только я и пару китайцев, во-вторых это просто красиво. Выставка картин очень разнообразная.⠀⠀7. Notting Hill Gate⠀Вот здесь я пожалела, что поехала одна. Слышали о разноцветных домиках? Так вот, они на этой улице. Красиво, а сфоткать некому. Но я не растерялась, сама наделала классных фотографий😄⠀ПРОДОЛЖЕНИЕ 👇🏼👇🏼👇🏼⠀

name: 2019-10-07 04.34.07 2148913286090036089_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Today we are on Acropolis in Athens, Greece. You can see here a part of a temple called Erechtheion. The building itself has an original construction. As it was built on slope, the west and north sides are about 3 m (9 ft) lower than the south and east sides.The main role here is played by columns called Caryatids.These are the most famous and the most often copied ones, however the concept apparently had come from Middle East where the columns had been made as mithological creatures of women`s heads.Here you see only replicas. You can find five original ones in Acropolis Museum and the sixth one is held by British Museum.#caryatids #caryatid #erechtheion #acropolis #athens #greece #acropolismuseum #britishmuseum #ancient #ancientarchitecture #architecture #archi #archilovers

name: 2019-10-07 07.18.34 2148996053490371888_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The pesky flames don’t touch St Agnes! Lavish enamels tell the story of St Agnes on the Royal Gold Cup in the Medieval Europe galleries in the British Museum. Shallow channels in the gold are filled with powdered glass and fired to produce these beautiful translucent decorations. Completed in 1390 and still looking fine.  #royalgoldcup #britishmuseum #saintagnes #medieval #enamel #medievalgold #jeanducdeberry

name: 2019-10-07 16.16.22 2149266731271654463_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Ontem foi dia de mais pubs, um que foi inspirado na obra “A volta ao mundo em oitenta dias”, de Julio Verne. Os funcionários vestidos a caráter, comidas do mundo inteiro, uma carta de gin no andar superior que impressiona... fomos no Soho, um bairro que respira gastronomia, cultura, atividade artísticas das mais diversas, bares... e paramos no Brewdog. Conhecemos o Neal’s Yard, no Convent Garden... outra região de brilhar os olhos! Conhecemos por fora a Westminster Abbey e a London Eye! O Museu Britânico... que lugar! Londres continua nos encantando! E continuará mais... #londoneye #nealsyard #soho #conventgarden #conventgardenlondon #britishmuseum #mrfoggs #brewdogsoho #brewdog #westminsterabbey #london #england #londres #inglaterra #travel #travelling #visitlondon #pub

name: 2019-10-07 17.20.35 2149299058198877357_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Spent some time in the British Museum in London this week, which houses an astounding collection of world artefacts (thanks to the extent of the British Empire). Here are 3 objects that completely captured my attention: a 6,000-year-old flint bull’s head from Egypt (a deity symbol of power and virility); an 11,000-year-old shamanic deer mask (made from a large red deer stag) from Star Carr in England; and a 6,000-year-old Neolithic polished axe, made from tuff from the Lake District. I was able to hold the axe, and feel a connection to the person who made and used it, but even to be in the presence of these other glassed-in artefacts was a powerful, visceral experience. #primitiveskills #ancestralskills #britishmuseum #rewilding #prehistoricarchaeology #experimentalarchaeology #stoneage #flintknapping #mesolithicdeermask

text: .... Harry Potter..行きたかった所の１つでもあるハリーポッターの駅 9 3/4 線.なかなかに並んでて撮るまでに1時間くらい待った😣😣ひとみを待たせてばかりで申し訳なかったよ(；ω；)でも、写真撮れて嬉しい😋😋💓ありがとう😊！！.あとは、大英博物館と綺麗なパディントン駅！.博物館はホント広すぎて何から観たらいいのか分からずウロウロ👯‍♀️.パディントン駅は、めちゃくちゃ人が常にいっぱいいた！！駅も開放的で綺麗だったな〜〜..#イギリス旅行 #ロンドン旅行 #ロンドン #イギリス #london #harrypotter #ハリーポッター #キングクロス駅9と4分の3番線 #キングクロスセントパンクラス駅 #kingcrossstation #stpancrasstation #キングスクロス駅 #セントパンクロス駅 #パディントン駅 #paddingtonstation #大英博物館 #britishmuseum #trip #travel #holiday #kagoshima #greatbritish

name: 2019-10-08 00.40.35 2149520519641669649_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Royal Lion Hunt. These alabaster bas-reliefs show Assyrian King Ashurbanipal (approx. 635 BC) demonstrating his bravery and hunting prowess. The King would want to show his ability to keep at bay dangerous wild animals and foreign invaders that posed risks to his peoples. These reliefs once adorned the walls of the King’s palace. They were discovered by Hormuzd Rassam in 1853 and currently housed at the British Museum. Stunning and detailed artistry and a connection to all of our pasts. #gentadv #gentlemanadventurer#adventure #adventurer #adventureseeker #thegentlemanadventurersclub #Picoftheday#exploretheworld#exploretheglobe#travelphotography#natgeo#natgeotravel#traveldeeper #aroundtheworld #britishmuseum #thebritishmuseum #assyrianreliefs #assyrianrelief

Late, late yestreen I saw the new Moon,With the old Moon in her arms;And I fear, I fear, my Master dear!We shall have a deadly storm.(Ballad of Sir Patrick Spence)I didn't include all the poem. But it is absolutely brilliant. If you like that sort of thing. name: 2019-10-08 01.50.04 2149555488610539687_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This spooky satire is thematically and stylistically similar to the other William Holland -published etching I posted a few days ago.This print was published in February 1795. It depicts a couple’s late night stroll in the graveyard interrupted by a ghost. The husband subsequently trips on the ghost, the ghost falls upon the wife’s feet, and the husband accidentally kicks his wife on her jaw. name: 2019-10-08 02.55.09 2149588240923932923_britishmuseum.jpg
text: La piedra de #Rosetta es la pieza estrella del #MuseoBritánico, procedente de una estela egipcia de brillante piedra volcánica.En su superficie contiene un decreto del año 196a.c. Está escrito en 3 lenguas distintas: jeroglíficos egipcios en la superior, escritura demótica en la franja intermedia y griego antiguo en la inferior.Gracias a la coincidencia de contenido en las tres inscripciones, esta piedra fue la clave para descifrar el lenguaje de los jeroglíficos. No es impresionante?? ✳️🎉🖌️Desliza para conocer nuestra selección de joyas en el #britishmuseum. Estás de acuerdo con nuestro TopTen? 🔟 🧐🤔 Cuéntanoslo en los comentarios..Para visitar videoguias y documentales... Entra en www.experienciasconarte.com#antiguoegipto #piedrarosetta #faraones #mesopotamia #roma #grecia #antigüedad

name: 2019-10-08 03.03.16 2149592334570993176_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Kraliçe Nefertiti"___________Nefertiti (MÖ 1370–1330), bir Mısır kraliçesi olup, tek tanrılı Atenizim dinini yayan Firavun Akhenaton’un eşidir. Eski Mısır tarihine ait bütün kitaplar, onun dillere destan güzelliğinden bahseder. Adı; “güzellik geliyor”, “güzel olan” ya da “güzelden gelen” anlamlarına geliyor. Kimi kaynaklarda Nefertiti’nin asıl adının Tadukhepa olduğu, ünlü güzelliğinden dolayı Nefertiti ismiyle anıldığı ifade ediliyor._Kraliçe Nefertiti’nin, nerden geldiği ve kökeni tam olarak bilinmemekte olup bununla ilgili, çeşitli varsayımlar vardır. Bunlardan en kabul göreni; Firavunların üç nesilden beri dost ülkelerle iyi ilişkilerini sürdürmek için onların prenseslerini alma alışkanlığı edindikleri 18. Hanedanlık zamanına götürüyor bizi; Mezopotamya ile Kafkaslar arasında bulunan Mitanni devletine._____________Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria.________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@ancient.road @archeo.travel Post by: @antiktarih ______Contact Pages : @sevgiiyenerr ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-10-08 03.24.24 2149602969189035681_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Αποκατάσταση της πλουσιότερης ταφής της Εποχής του Σιδήρου στη Βρετανία | Βρέθηκε στο Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire | 1ος αι. π.Χ.▪︎Η ταφή ανήκε σε σημαίνον πρόσωπο. Το σώμα είχε τυλιχτεί σε δέρμα αρκούδας και αποτεφρωθεί. Στη συνέχεια τα καμμένα οστά τοποθετήθηκαν σε σωρό στο δάπεδο του τάφου.Το περιεχόμενο του ταφικού θαλάμου περιελάμβανε αναρίθμητα αγγεία, μεταλλικά δοχεία και άλλα κτερίσματα, ακόμη και ξύλινα δοχεία και ένα στρώμα από άχυρο, που δεν διατηρήθηκαν. Η πλειονότητα των κτερισμάτων είναι εντόπιας προέλευσης, αλλά οι αμφορείς και το ασημένιο κύπελλο προέρχονται από την Ιταλία, και οι δίσκοι από τη Γαλατία.Ο τάφος χρονολογείται στα μέσα του 1ου αι. π.Χ., μεταξύ των εκστρατειών του Ι. Καίσαρα (55-54 π.Χ.) και της εισβολής του Κλαυδίου (43 π.Χ.).▪︎Reconstruction of the richest Iron Age burial found in Britain | Discovered at Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire | 1st Century BCE▪︎The burial was that of an important man whose body had been wrapped in a bear skin and cremated. The burnt bones were placed in a heap on the floor of the grave. The large burial vault was filled with numerous pots, metal vessels and other offerings. The burial also contained wooden bowls and buckets, a straw mat and other organic materials which have long since perished. Most of the grave-goods are native, but the wine amphorae and silver cup are iItalian, while the platters and large flagon were made in Gaul. Wine amphorae are only found in burials north of the Thames.The grave dates from late in the first century BC, midway between the expeditions of Julius Caesar (55-54 BCE) and the invasion of the Emperor Claudius (43 CE).▪︎#archaeologicalmuseum #archaeologia #archaeology #archaeologylife #historylovers #archaeologylove #museum #museum_lovers #pottery #history #britishhistory #england #ironage #burial #britishironage #britishmuseum #storiantica #london #historia #museumsaroundtheworld #welwyngarden #archaeologist #ancientcivilization #artefacts #igworldclub_archaeology

name: 2019-10-08 05.45.12 2149673838716269276_britishmuseum.jpg
text: MUSEO DE SAN JUAN DE LA MATAEL FUEGO EN EL PRADOHomenaje al Museo del Prado en su Bicentenario Complementa y amplía la exposición anterior sobre el mismo tema pero con obras pertenecientes al Museo del Prado: Velázquez, Rubens, Goya, El Bosco, Cossiers,.....Y como plato fuerte:“Un cuadro viviente...”!!!!!! Santalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.MUSEUM OF SAN JUAN DE LA MATATHE FIRE IN THE PRADOTribute to the Prado Museum in its BicentennialIt complements and extends the previous exhibition on the same subject but with works belonging to the Prado Museum: Velázquez, Rubens, Goya, El Bosco, Cossiers, .....And as a main course:“A living picture ...” !!!!!! Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose purpose is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.  #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma  #museedorsay #louvre #met #salvadordalimuseum #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #yaleartgallery #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

name: 2019-10-08 06.47.26 2149705161468144450_britishmuseum.jpg
text: TUMBA DE MENA Menna fue un noble egipcio que vivía en la Dinastía XVIII, ya sea durante el reinado de Tutmosis IV o la de su sucesor, Amenofis III.De su tumba podemos recordar que sus funciones oficiales estaban relacionados con la agricultura.Tenía una esposa llamada Henuttawi, dos hijos y cuatro hijas, todos representados en ella.Es conocida como la tumba TT 69 y se encuentra en el Sheij Abd el Qurna.La mayoría de las tumbas de los funcionarios se encuentran en esta zona , la zona de las Tumbas de los Nobles.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-08 06.56.32 2149709738108110139_britishmuseum.jpg
text: TUMBA DE MENNATT69Menna celebró el título de “ Escriba de los Campos del Señor de las Dos Tierras del Alto y Bajo Egipto", así como supervisor de campo de Amón.Supervisó los templos propiedad de las tierras del estado.Se cree que trabajó para el Templo de Amón en Karnak vigilando la medición de los campos, el trabajo en la tierra y la velocidad y el rendimiento de los cultivos registrados.#dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-08 07.06.13 2149714616494819775_britishmuseum.jpg
text: TUMBA DE MENA TT69 La balanza de la Justicia actual procede del Antiguo Egipto, pero no era el símbolo de Maat, la diosa de la Justicia egipcia. Era el instrumento en el que Anubis, el dios de la muerte que aparecía como un hombre con cabeza de chacal o perro salvaje, pesaba los corazones de los difuntos para determinar si las almas merecían bien el paraíso o ser devoradas por un monstruo horrible.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

text: 大英博物館（ロンドン）展示物②***アテネのアクロポリスにあるパルテノン神殿の彫刻を切り取ったものが並んでいました。英国の貴族が持ち帰り 生活苦になった貴族が国に売却したそうです。なんと パルテノン神殿🏛の主要な彫像やレリーフの約50%が大英博物館にあるそうです！現在 ギリシャ政府との間で返還問題が起きているとか…5枚目は復元されたクサントス（都市名）の「ネレイド記念堂」です。**大英博物館のお宝にも聞き捨てならない歴史があるようです‼︎・・・#britishmuseum #unitedkingdom #uktravel #london #great #summer2019#canoneoskissm #大英博物館#英国#英国旅行#2019夏 #入場料無料 #ファインダー越しの私の世界 #写真撮るのが好きな人と繋がりたい #旅行好きな人と繋がりたい #안녕하세요 #영국#런던 #카메라여자 #박물관 #훌륭하다

name: 2019-10-08 14.59.45 2149952944655681815_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Cueva de las Manos..📝 Cueva de las Manos is a cave, which is located in the heart of Patagonia, in the province of Santa Cruz, Argentina. The name can be translated from Spanish as “The Cave of Hands”. In 1941, a monk discovered this unusual cave in the gorge of the river Pinturas (Rio Pinturas). Then, he couldn’t even imagine that this was the oldest and perhaps the most sensational cave rock paintings in the world.Later, in 1964, a professor of archeology Carlos Gradin thanks to his researches glorified the Cave of Hands to the whole world. However, he was concerned about the safety of the original appearance of this discovery. In 1999, the Cueva de las Manos was included into the UNESCO World Heritage List. Thus, it has become one of the most important attractions of Argentina.Scientists say that these unique cave paintings were made about 13 thousand years ago. They were created using stencils and natural dyes such as white clay, iron oxide and manganese. Thus, the prints acquired the purple, green and blue colors. The remarkable fact is that the same colors were used during the funeral rites. The ritual of creating handprints by the natural colors was a peculiar custom which is considered to be a rite of initiation. This is a series of caves speckled with similar patterns. Their length amounts 160 km.In general, the drawings are divided into three groups according to their age and style. There are more than 800 prints of human hands in a life-size, as well as images of animals resembling deer and camels, human figures and hunting scenes. It is worth mentioning that only 36 prints are traces of right hands. The cave is not very big in size, so probably people came here to relax after hunting and conducted various rituals.Since the Cave of Hands is hidden from the human eye in a deep gorge of the river, it’s pretty hard to get here. The cave is situated in a deserted place, without any settlements....

name: 2019-10-08 15.38.24 2149972398374586817_britishmuseum.jpg
text: If you’ve ever visited the Thames foreshore you might have found some large shards of pottery that look like this - unglazed terracotta with white slip painted roughly on the inside. They are pieces of sugar mould, used to make sugar loaves, which is how sugar was  traditionally sold. There’s a lot of it between the Millennium Bridge and Queenhithe and I’ve only recently noticed the sign on the Sugarloaf pub nearby that explains the sugar refineries that were there between the late 17th and early 19th century. (Swipe for more pics)#londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking #mudlarkingbook

name: 2019-10-08 15.40.52 2149973647622819647_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Две вещи страшнее для произведения архитектуры, чем время: война и желание «унести с собой кусочек».⠀Впервые я увидела храмы Акрополя в 2000 году и, кажется, взяла с собой на память камушек с дороги, ведущей к древним развалинам. 🙈⠀Потом через пару лет я впервые поехала в Лондон и познакомилась там с коллекцией Британского музея.⠀Сказать, что я была поражена, увидев десятки скульптур, фризы, метопы или попросту целый фасад храма Порфенон в залах музея, значит не сказать ничего.⠀Во мне тогда смешались два чувства. Одно — искреннее возмущение тем, что для пополнения музейных коллекций в 19 веке использовались такие варварские методы. Выломать кусок стены из храма 😢 и перевезти на другой конец Света под эгидой сохранения культурных ценностей в то время было делом привычным.⠀В то же время, второе чувство, воспитанное, годами искусствоведческих лекций и часами проведёнными в различных музеях мира, говорило мне что музейная коллекция — это навсегда, и нельзя просто так взять и пересмотреть принадлежность ее экспонатов.⠀Дилемма в том, что музейное «навсегда» по сравнению с вечностью, которую простояли храмы Акрополя на афинских холмах — несопоставимы.⠀Вообщем для меня путь экспонатов в музейную коллекцию и возможность пересмотра их принадлежности до сих пор открытый и болезненный вопрос. А вы что скажете?⠀#греция #афины #акрополь #искусство #древниймир #искусствовед #музей #искусствовечно #музейнаяколлекция #куратор #парфенон #культурныйфорум #британскиймузей #athens #greece #acropolis #parthenon #museum #acropolismuseum #britishmuseum #art #artcurator #historyofart #museumcollection #tobeornottobe #tobeor #travel #travelblogger #travelblog #travelphotography

name: 2019-10-08 19.03.16 2150075512228073541_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Next Thursday, 17th October, I am running the first of my autumn London walks. This first amble is in Bloomsbury, a part of London I absolutely adore at this time of year.Our walk will take us down quiet, Georgian streets and around the British Museum (pictured here). We will see the imposing Art Deco Senate House (the Ministry of Information in Orwell’s 1984) and a famous green cab shelter. We’ll visit Coram Fields and wander through some of London’s prettiest squares.I’ve specifically set the walk to start at 5pm to make the most of the magical twilight as we take our walk. At this time of year the plane trees are resplendent and create a network of cosseting canopies over the garden squares, and in the early evening the curtains are left undrawn offering us glimpses of Georgian drawing rooms in the fading light.If you’d like to come, there are just two places left. All details in my bio. Oh and we’ll be ending our walk with a drink in a cosy London pub. Just the place to be on an atmospheric October evening. 🍂#bleakhouseexperiences #londonbylondoners #bloomsbury #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-08 19.21.57 2150084919974495315_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The Great Court of The British Museum in London. Does it look too clinical or is it interesting architecture? I’m in the second camp. I know it’s not cool to have the non-square thing on Insta but the full wide view is the only way to do this justice.  The British Museum is dedicated to human history, art and culture. It has a permanent collection of over 8 million works and is among the largest and most comprehensive in the world. It was established in 1753, covers 807,000 sq ft (75,000 sq metres) over 94 galleries. It was the first public national gallery in the world and incredibly remains free of charge to enter.  It is not without controversy (Elgin Marbles and the Rosetta Stone are endlessly debated whether they should return to their countries of origin). The Great Court pictured here is the central quadrangle (now there’s a word!!). It is dedicated to the Queen Elizabeth II and is the largest covered square in Europe. It’s very easy to get lost in here and spend a long time finding the exact location where you promised you’d meet your husband....just saying😉

text: 🦁 This super photo showing the Lion of Knidos in the Great Court was taken by @viyanl.The giant sculpture weighs six tons and was carved from a single block of marble in the 2nd century BC. It was made for a funerary monument in Knidos, on the western coast of modern-day Turkey.The eyes were originally inlaid with coloured glass to help sailors navigate the rocky coastline.Share your photos with us by tagging the location!#BritishMuseum #AncientHistory #sculpture #lion #London #photo #UK #museum #📸

name: 2019-10-09 00.56.13 2150253161839705621_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Congratulations to @britishmuseum for another thought-provoking exhibition. Inspired by the East explores the impact that the Islamic world has had on Western art from 1500 to the current day. The show uses artefacts including art ceramics, photography, glass and clothing to highlight a centuries old tradition of influence from East to West and ends with works of four artists working today exploring the idea of Orientalism including this print reimagining 19th century harem paintings by the Moroccan artist Lalla Essaydi.The exhibition opens on 10 October and runs until 26 January. A companion book is available to purchase https://www.museumbookstore.com/products/inspired-by-the-east-how-the-islamic-world-influenced-western-art

name: 2019-10-09 01.23.57 2150267121639605334_britishmuseum.jpg
text: One of the most iconic of Anglo-Saxon finds from Mound 1 at Sutton Hoo in Suffolk. The discovery of the burial at Sutton Hoo, and the objects contained within it, helped to change opinions about a period of history that was traditionally known as the Dark Ages. Historians now commonly refer to this period as Early Medieval. Whatever name people wish to give it, this period of history is certainly not an age of darkness as the items found at Sutton Hoo clearly indicate. #anglosaxon #suttonhoo #nationaltrust #earlymedieval #darkages #helmet #raedwald #burial #history #iconic #britishmuseum #ahistoryoftheworldin100objects #craftsmanship #suffolk #anglosaxonhistory

name: 2019-10-09 02.00.27 2150285490769879477_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Because I was often asked what is a Triglyph, here we are 😉Triglyph means in Greek Three(tris)/channels(glyphes) and it is part of the Doric frieze together with a Metope. Some archaeologists say that its shape come from the union of three wooden planks that support the roof of the temple. Others say it comes from the stylization of a tripod. A typical Triglyph is made up of a upper horizontal part called Capital, the three vertical channels called Glyphs, an horizontal line called Taenia which is often decorated with a Maeander design, the lower part called Regula which is followed by 6 "drop-shaped" small parts called Guttae. All those parts are putted together following precise geometric relationships as the Golden Section one 🐌!I hope you enjoyed my little description ☺️🏛🏛🏛#doric #doricorder #classicalarchitecture #classicalart #classicalarchaeology #triglyph #triglyphs #metope #doricfrieze #dorictemple #parthenonmarbles #parthenon @reunitetheparthenonmarbles #britishmuseumlondon #britishmuseum @archaeostoryteller #greektemples #acropolis #eustacepalladinos eustacepalladinos.com

name: 2019-10-09 02.20.19 2150295486391912047_britishmuseum.jpg
text: One of the historical figures that really impacts fragrance history is the Roman emperor, Constantine the Great. He moved the seat of Christianity to modern-day Istanbul (Constantinople, he called it: not a modest man) and set up generous budgets for aromatics in the churches he was having built. Before him, Christians largely associated scent with Greek, Egyptian and Roman style paganism, and idolatry. After him, they started to associate (good) scent with godliness. Indirectly, it’s thanks to Constantine that we have a tradition of burning aromatics in Catholic churches. Here, we see a censer, from around AD 330-650, right during or after his reign. #scenthistory #istanbulnotconstantinople #christianity #britishmuseum #perfumehistory #history

name: 2019-10-09 02.40.26 2150305611661917234_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Tumba de Amenemope en Tanis (Egipto).Hijo de Psusenes I y la reina Mutnedyemet, sirvió de joven como corregente durante los últimos años de su padre, de acuerdo con las evidencias encontradas en el vendaje de una momia.Las tumbas reales de Psusenes I y Amenemopet fueron descubiertas intactas por el arqueólogo Pierre Montet entre 1939 y 1940 en Tanis, encontrándose que contenían valiosos tesoros, incluyendo máscaras funerarias de oro y muchas piezas de hermosa joyería. Cuatro objetos de la tumba de Amenemopet, un collar y tres brazaletes, conservan grabado el nombre de su padre, Psusenes I.#temple#god#isis#sobek#egyptian#egipto#egypt#egitto #pharaohs#faraones#tutankamon #dinastía#artegyptian#artegypt #anticoegipto#ancientegypt #egiptologia #egyptoloyi#Giza#museoegizio #museoegiziotorino#metropolitanmuseum #King'sValley#nefertiti#amazingegypt #metropolitan#britishmuseum

If you’re at the British Museum, you must see this. #history #ancientegypt #rosettastone #britishmuseum #london #museum #egyptianhieroglyphs #hieroglyphs

name: 2019-10-09 03.16.57 2150323993148616550_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Kraliçe Nefertiti"___________Nefertiti (MÖ 1370–1330), bir Mısır kraliçesi olup, tek tanrılı Atenizim dinini yayan Firavun Akhenaton’un eşidir. Eski Mısır tarihine ait bütün kitaplar, onun dillere destan güzelliğinden bahseder. Adı; “güzellik geliyor”, “güzel olan” ya da “güzelden gelen” anlamlarına geliyor. Kimi kaynaklarda Nefertiti’nin asıl adının Tadukhepa olduğu, ünlü güzelliğinden dolayı Nefertiti ismiyle anıldığı ifade ediliyor._Kraliçe Nefertiti’nin, nerden geldiği ve kökeni tam olarak bilinmemekte olup bununla ilgili, çeşitli varsayımlar vardır. Bunlardan en kabul göreni; Firavunların üç nesilden beri dost ülkelerle iyi ilişkilerini sürdürmek için onların prenseslerini alma alışkanlığı edindikleri 18. Hanedanlık zamanına götürüyor bizi; Mezopotamya ile Kafkaslar arasında bulunan Mitanni devletine._____________Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria._______Post by: @antiktarih ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-10-09 03.37.58 2150334571147850240_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Antoninler Çeşmesi, Burdur’un Ağlasun ilçesinde yer alan Sagalassos Antik Kenti'nin en göze çarpan yapılarından biri. MS 161-180 yılları arasında Roma İmparatoru Marcus Aurelius zamanında yapılmış ve tanrı Dionysos’a ithaf edilmişti. Çeşmeye "Antoninler Çeşmesi" denmesinin sebebi, Roma İmparatorlarında Antoninler dönemine denk gelmesi. 28 metre genişliğinde ve 9 metre yüksekliğindeki çeşmenin en sağ ve en solunda Dionysos Tanrısı'na ait heykeller var. Bunlar orijinal pozisyonda duruyor. Diğer heykelleri başka bir yerden, büyük ihtimalle bir tapınaktan veya tiyatrodan getirilmiş.______________ Antonin Fountain, one of the most striking structures of the ancient city of Sagalassos, modern Burdur, Turkey. Built during the reign of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius between 161-180 AD and dedicated to the god Dionysus. It’s called "Antonin Fountain" because it coincides with the period of Antonines during the Roman Empire. 28 meters in width and 9 meters in height. On the far right and left of the fountain are statues of the god Dionysus in the original position. Other sculptures were probably brought from another temple or theater. ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>> @archeo.travel @ancient.road ________Contact Pages: @sevgiiyenerr ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #beniculturali30 #arte #catlovers #artworkoftheday #storiadellarte #volgoarte #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #masterpieces #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: 따란🥰 드디어 마이리얼트립 단독으로 영국박물관 투어가 개시됐어요! 3년 전 제 투어를 듣고 영국을 다시 찾은 분부터 최근 갤러리를 함께하셨던 여행자분까지, 가장 많은 문의가 “박물관은 어떻게 신청해요?” 였는데, 이제는 속 시원하게 답해드릴 수 있겠네요. 마이리얼트립에서 후기를 작성한 모든 분께 5천 원 할인쿠폰을, 첫 후기를 작성하면 3만 원 할인쿠폰을 드린다고 하니, 서둘러 주시와요👍이전 후기가 없어서, 제가 더 궁금하시다면 다른 상품의 후기를 봐주시와요. “어머님, 전적으로 저를 믿으셔야 합니다” 10살 아이부터 80대 할아버지까지, 무조건 만족시켜 드리겠습니다. 💂🏻‍♀️#마이리얼트립 링크는 프로필에 있어요 #영국박물관 #대영박물관 #런던

name: 2019-10-09 04.41.03 2150366324857441444_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Британский музей — центральный историко-археологический музей Великобритании и один из крупнейших музеев мира. Он был основан в 1753 году с разрешения британского парламента. Его экспозиция занимает 94 галереи, общая протяжённость которых составляет 4 км. В основу вошли коллекции трёх известных людей — графа Роберта Харли, врача Хэнса Слоуна и антиквара Роберта Коттона. История Британского музея началась с частного собрания экспонатов. Английский врач Хэнс Слоун, который к тому же являлся известным коллекционером древностей, путешественником и натуралистом, еще при жизни составил завещание. В нем говорилось, что за совершенно символическую плату он передает свои экспонаты королю Георгу II. На тот момент коллекция насчитывала более 70 000 предметов.Британский музей основали 7 июня 1753 года специальным актом Парламента. Впоследствии именно Парламент приобретал экспонаты у коллекционеров, чтобы пополнить фонд музея.На данный момент British museum поделен на 6 тематик, которые объединяют в себе археологические и культурные объекты разных стран и периодов:- Древний Египет и Нубия- Африка, Восточная и Южная Азия, Океания, Месоамерика- Древний Восток- Древняя Греция и Древний Рим- Великобритания и Европа- Графика и гравюра#greatbritain🇬🇧 #unitedkindom #england #london🇬🇧 #великобритания🇬🇧 #англия #лондон  #потрясающийгород #отдых #британскиймузей #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-09 04.44.29 2150368052499499154_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Коллекция египетских экспонатов Британского музея считается одной из крупнейших в мире. Особенно широко представлен период с 3 тысячелетия до н. э. по 7 век н. э. Среди экспонатов — скульптура фараона Рамзеса II, гранитная голова Тутмеса III, изваяния богов и каменные саркофаги. Также в египетской секции хранится около 800 папирусов с литературными произведениями, мифами, религиозными гимнами, записями исторических событий и другими документами. Кроме того, в коллекции музея имеются ценнейшие экземпляры «Книги мёртвых», украшенные рисунками, миниатюрами и заставками.Отдел искусства Древней Греции и Древнего Рима располагает великолепной коллекцией античной скульптуры (в том числе несколько десятков плит и 12 фигур с фронтонов древнего Парфенона, вывезенных в 19 в. в Англию британским послом Томасом Брюсом — как считается, незаконно), предметами бронзового века из Эгеиды (3—2 тыс. до н. э.) и многочисленными произведениями римского искусства из Помпей и Геркуланума.#greatbritain🇬🇧 #unitedkindom #england #london🇬🇧 #великобритания🇬🇧 #англия #лондон #britishmuseum #британскиймузей #потрясающийгород #отдых

name: 2019-10-09 04.55.45 2150373718206158641_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Too many gems in this brilliant and thought-provoking #britishmuseum show, ‘How the #East Influenced the #West’, to know what to post! But here are a few picks...first, Palestinian artist Raedah Saadeh (Who Will Make me Real, 2003) challenges idealised notions of the #Orientalist Odalisque by wrapping herself in newspapers referring to the politics of the Middle East and through her daring gaze; then the #Qajar ruler Mozaffar al din Shah whose portrait was influenced by European styles of photography, and lastly a contemporary Turkish video installation inspired by a C19 work. The show is all about how we see the ‘other’, and how the two sides have dialogued with one another over the centuries. #albukhary#orientalism

These bookplates are works of art in their own right, and two more highlights from the current #BritishMuseum show on how the East influenced the West

text: INAUGURACIÓN DE MUSEO SOBRE CASTILLO EN PONFERRADATodo a punto !!! INAUGURACIÓN:Miércoles 9.10.2019 (Capicúa del año !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082 . 2019. 2082“El puente en el Arte”Un pintor universal cada año, coincidiendo con sus Aniversarios, 63 en total,  hasta el 2082, año del MILENARIO, expondrán sus puentes.Santalla & StrartS y QuinSan han creado la Asociación de Museos Virtuales, cuyo fin es que todos los pueblos, independientemente de su población, puedan disponer de un museo de arte.El lema es: NINGÚN PUEBLO SIN MUSEO.Los tres primeros museos ya se han inaugurado en Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata y Madrid. El próximo será el de Ponferrada.OPENING OF MUSEUM ON CASTLE IN PONFERRADAEverything on point !!!OPENING:Wednesday 9.10.2019 (Capicúa of the year !!!)PONS FERR ART 1082. 2019. 2082“The bridge in Art”A universal painter every year, coinciding with his Anniversaries, 63 in total, until 2082, the year of the MILENARY, will exhibit their bridges.Santalla & StrartS and QuinSan have created the Association of Virtual Museums, whose purpose is that all peoples, regardless of their population, can have an art museum.The motto is:NO PEOPLE WITHOUT MUSEUM.The first three museums have already opened in Lapuebla de Labarca, San Juan de la Mata and Madrid. The next will be Ponferrada.  #reinasofiamuseum #museodelprado #caixaforum #museothyssen #hermitagemuseum #whitneymuseum #centrepompidou  #nationalgallery  #moma  #museedorsay #louvre #met #salvadordalimuseum #britishmuseum  #tatemodern #guggenheim #nycart #brooklynmuseum #lacmamuseum #gemaldegalerie #artinstitutechicago #ufizzi  #louvreabudhabi #galleriaborghese #gettymuseum #yaleartgallery #sfmoma #nationalgalleryofart #altepinakothek #rijksmuseum

text: Greetings from #Assyria, I mean #London! What a day! The most amazing thing was running into the world's leading #Syriac scholar Sebastian Brock at the British Library and getting to interview him for about half an hour! Couldn't believe it! #Providence is at it again on my travels! Also participated in the #Assyrian reliefs tour and checked back on my favourite Sumerian item the Standard of Ur from Abraham's hometown from 2500 BC, as well as the world's oldest #Bible the #codexsinaiticus from the 300s. In #England for another 4 days for a #johnhenrynewman #pilgrimage, then off to #rome for his #canonisation. #standardofur #sumer #sumerian #britishmuseum  #sebastianbrock #britishlibrary #iraqi #suryoyo #kalhu #nimrod #ashur #visitlondon
