name: 2019-10-09 06.38.15 2150425311274520864_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Rainha Nefertiti "___________@curiosomisterioNefertiti (1370–1330 aC) era uma rainha egípcia e esposa do faraó Akhenaton, que espalhou a religião monoteísta de Ateneim. Todos os livros da história egípcia antiga falam de sua beleza lendária. título; "A beleza está chegando" significa "linda" ou linda ". Algumas fontes afirmam que o nome real de Nefertiti é Tadukhepa e que é chamado Nefertiti devido à sua famosa beleza._A origem e a origem da rainha Nefertiti são desconhecidas e existem várias suposições. O mais aceito deles; Nos leva à 18ª dinastia, onde os faraós costumam levar suas princesas por três gerações para manter boas relações com seus países vizinhos; Estado de Mitanni entre a Mesopotâmia e o Cáucaso._____________Nefertiti, também chamada Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (floresceu no século 14 aC), rainha do Egito e esposa do rei Akhenaton (anteriormente Amenhotep IV; reinou entre 1335 e 36 aC), que desempenhou um papel proeminente no culto ao deus do sol conhecido ason A paternidade de Nefertiti não é registrada, mas, como o nome dela se traduz em "Uma Linda Mulher Chegou", os primeiros egiptólogos acreditavam que ela devia ter sido uma princesa da Mitanni Síria._______Postado por: @antidate________Não se esqueça de nos seguir >>>@ ancient.road@ ancient.road@ ancient.road@ ancient.road____#arqueotravel #arqueologia #arqueologia #arqueologia #arqueologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #ruestloves_monuments #months #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: This #pencildrawing I  produced at the #britishmuseum in the new #exhibition of how the #art of the #islamicworld has #inspired #westernartists. I chose to focus on #jeanléongérôme #painting on 'The grain thresher', #depicting #oxdrawn #wheatthresher in the #egyptian #countryside evoking a #rural idyll. This is not a direct copy of his work as I felt closer to the #markmaking of Vincent van Gogh when #drawing the #wheat. I added a hills to the background a little artistic licence. It is worth a visit to see the many beautiful crafted objects. #londonartist #colourpencils #landscape

name: 2019-10-09 17.45.23 2150761086467550945_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Manga マンガ, la mostra al British MuseumSecondo alcuni i Manga sono robe per bambini o, al contrario, sono diseducativi. Al British Museum la pensano diversamente tanto che lì si è da poco svolta la più grande mostra fuori dal Giappone, interamente dedicata ai Manga.."I Manga sono una forma d'arte narrativa visiva che è diventata un fenomeno multimediale globale, raccontando storie con temi di vario genere, ambientati in mondi reali o immaginari. Si tratta di uno storytelling coinvolgente che funziona attraverso le immagini che regnano sovrane. I caratteri giapponesi con cui è scritta la parola 'Manga' possono essere tradotti con 'Immagini in rivolta' o 'Immagini illimitate'. C'è meno dipendenza dal testo e la narrativa viene creata attraverso il disegno di linee espressive e lo sviluppo visivo dei singoli personaggi. È la qualità visivamente coinvolgente del manga che lo rende così unico e popolare.Si pensa che i primi esempi di Manga siano nati in Giappone intorno alla prima metà del XIII secolo, sotto forma di rotoli di pergamena, detti emaki (rotoli illustrati), che spesso rappresentavano caricature di personaggi umani o di animali antropomorfi come rane o conigli. Sono stati poi alcuni artisti del XVIII secolo a coniare la parola 'Manga' che all'epoca poteva essere tradotta con 'Disegni bizzarri e divertenti'. I primi fumetti giapponesi nascono negli anni Venti del Novecento attraverso la pubblicazione di strisce di cartoni animati seriali su riviste e giornali. Ma i 'Manga', almeno quelli che oggi conosciamo, fecero la prima comparsa nel 1947, nell'edizione di Osaka del quotidiano Shokokumin shinbun, dove vennero pubblicate alcune strisce del diario di Ma-chan ad opera di un giovanissimo disegnatore di nome Osamu Tezuka".#manga #mangaexhibition #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-09 18.06.56 2150771935846498587_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Öpücük (The Kiss), İtalyan ressam Francesco Hayez'in 1859 yılında tuval üzerinde yağlı boya ile çizdiği tablo. Öpücük, Hayez'in en ünlü tablosudur. Tablo günümüzde Milano'daki Pinacoteca di Brera müzesinde sergileniyor. İtalyan resminin ana özelliklerini taşıyan bu tablo, romantizmin ruhunu temsil ediyor.Daha fazlası için @ancient.road 👈_ 🇬🇧 Il bacio (The Kiss) is an 1859 painting by the Italian artist Francesco Hayez. It is possibly his best known work. This painting conveys the main features of Italian Romanticism and has come to represent the spirit of the Risorgimento.Follow us: @ancient.road @archeo.travel Post by : @antiktarih 🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹 #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

name: 2019-10-09 18.37.13 2150787177712503216_britishmuseum.jpg
text: БЕСПЛАТНЫЕ 🆓 МУЗЕИ 🏛 ЛОНДОНА 🇬🇧.  Лондон уникален огромной концентрацией музеев в городе. Они  сделаны таким образом, что бы быть интересными даже для тех, кто обычно не ходит по таким местам.Давайте познакомимся с самыми классными: .🏛 Лондонская Национальная Галерея находится на Трафальгарской площади и является одним из самых посещаемых мест в Лондоне. Картины 🏞 великих  Леонардо Да Винчи, Рафаэля, Ван Гога, Моне, Ренуар, Тициан, Рембрандт, Рубенс, Босх.. и это только начало!. 🏛 Музей естествознания - один из самых лучших музеев Лондона и мира. А также самый любимый у детей 👧🏻👶🏻. 70 миллионов экспонатов среди которых растения🎋, животные 🦍, насекомые🕷 , камни,минералы и палеонтологические останки🐾. Один из трех музеев на улице Exhibition Street. Очень интересный и настоятельно рекомендован мною! Вход бесплатный! Множество экспонатов можно потрогать руками 🙌🏻. В центральном зале музея полностью сохранившийся скелет 30 метрового динозавра 🐉🐲😱. .🏛 Британский музей один из самых посещаемых 👫👫 музеев в мире и музей номер 1️⃣ в Великобритании. В музее 13 миллионов объектов!!! Каждый из которых был отобран специальной комиссией и является уникальнейшим в своем роде. Но известен он прежде всего своей знаменитой коллекцией мумий 🧟‍♀️🧟‍♂️ #nationalportraitgallery #nationalgallerylondon #thebritishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #britishmuseum #museodehistorianatural #naturalhistorymuseum #naturalhistorymuseumlondon #londonmuseums #traveltoLondon #путешествие2019 #великобритания🇬🇧 #турванглию

text: Our concierge team is always happy to recommend attractions or places to visit to our guests. Among their recommendations there is “Tate Modern”. It is Britain's national gallery of international modern art and forms part of the Tate group. It is based in the former Bankside Power Station, in the Bankside area of the London Borough of Southwark. Whether your interest is Cubism, Surrealism, or contemporary installation, the Tate Modern’s sweeping collection and temporary exhibitions are sure to impress. Admission to Tate Modern is free. Are you planning to visit it? Tate Modern is only at few stops by tube from the Washington Mayfair Hotel. ..#tatemodern #tatemodernmuseum #tate #museum #art #tatemodernmuseum #artgallery #artlovers #londonmuseum #londonattractions #visitlondon #london #londonlife #concierge #britishart #cool #gb #britishmuseum #artgallery #cubism #surrealism #uk  #contemporaryart #internationalart #hotellife #mayfair

name: 2019-10-09 21.37.30 2150877916951252650_britishmuseum.jpg
text: A must visit when in #London: @britishmuseum! I can't believe this was my first time to visit this museum though I'd been to London so many times! -This is part of the Assyrians exhibition. The mighty Assyrian empire began as the small city-state of Ashur in what is now the north-eastern region of Iraq. -Visitors entered palaces through massive gateways flanked by colossal human-headed winged bulls called lamassu that protected the King from dangerous supernatural forces! -In light of what is happening nowadays in Iraq, it is imperative that we learn the vast and rich history it breeds. It used to be the cradle of civilisations so let's work together and help where we can! -I've put a link in my bio to sign a petition by @unhcr_iraq to help the Iraqi people! #letsTalkRealWorldIssues #theCelebrationProject

text: Little Feet @britishmuseum is running tomorrow ⭐️Thursday 10 October from 10:30-12 ⭐️ This session is a storytelling session led by a professional storyteller. There is also a chance to make your own story props. It’s totally free and don’t forget you can use the ‘easy access’ line to skip entrance queues. 🥰The next exhibition explorer session is⭐️7th November 10:30-12⭐️where families can explore the exhibition ‘Inspired by the East’ free of charge with under 5 activities. 🥰

Museu de Belas Artes de Boston.@curiosomisterioPolifemo é o filho gigante de Poseidon, o deus do mar na mitologia grega, e a ninfa Thossa, que também é conhecida como o Ciclope na Odisséia de Homero.___________________Chefe da Polifemo (detalhe). Grego ou romano, cerca de 150 aC. Mármore dolomítico da ilha grega de Thassos. Museu de Belas Artes, Boston. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

name: 2019-10-10 01.04.36 2150982157685013300_britishmuseum.jpg
text: @curiosomisterio A Mãe de Toda a Criação na Mitologia Grega Gaia Ana Mãe Terra ”Ia Gaia, que emerge de Khaos, dá à luz Urano (Céu) e Pontus (Mares) sozinho, criando montanhas. Então ele se une a Urano e Pontus e enche o universo de deuses gregos.Seis deuses masculinos da união com Urano, Okeanos, Krios, Hyperion, Iapetos, Koios, Kronos e seis deuses femininos, Theia, Rhea, Themis Phoebe, Tethys, Mnemosyne e três kyklop, Brontes (Trovão), Steropes (Lightning), Arges (raios) e Hekatonkheirler, Kottos, Briareus, Gyes, que são definidos como braços faciais.Estes 12 deuses são referidos como titãs na mitologia grega.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-10-10 01.48.52 2151004437375932832_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 3. I spent Easter with family in Kent. One lazy day I and my Niece decided to visit Central London and do a solo tour which included galleries, stadiums and I made sure the British museum was on the list. It wasn't my first time but museums are my favourite. And I wouldn't pass up the opportunity to visit the Africa exhibit and the Benin Mask. By the way the recreation for 'The Black Panther' was almost spot on. (The knives exhibit). I still have so many unedited pictures of the day. The postcard shows the view of the museum roof. The interior is twice as beautiful with all the natural light. On the same day we passed through King's Cross Station. I basically lived there and can't count how many times I passed through. On this day I decided to finally live my Harry Potter fantasy and posed for a picture at Platform 9¾. I went to the shop to pick up the printed photo and saw it would cost me about £10. I bought a postcard instead. 😊#AnnaTakesShotsLS#Postcards

text: İngiliz Sir Charles Thomas Newton’un 1858-59 yılları arasındaki Knidos antik kentinde yaptığı ilk ve kapsamlı kazılarda, Yunan anıtsal mezarından ortaya çıkardığı M.Ö 300’lere tarihlenen, 7 ton ağırlığa sahip Knidos Aslanı. Knidos Anadolu’nun güneybatı ucunda Ege ve Akdeniz’in birleştiği noktada yer alan antik dönem boyunca önemli bir kültür, sanat, din ve ticaret merkezidir. British Museum. 🇬🇧—————————-🇬🇧7 Ton marble lion from a Greek monumental tomb at Knidos (now in SW Turkey), Circa 300 BCE. Sir Charles Thomas Newton excavations 1858-59, British Museum.Post by: @antikcag.tarihi Follow us: @archeo.travel @ancient.road #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia #knidos #ancientroad

name: 2019-10-10 02.40.45 2151030551742652081_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #viaggiinegitto ED IN #NUBIAIl #giornale di #viaggio di #Belzoni, unica opera del grande #esploratore fu definito da #HowardCarter il celebre scopritore della tombadi #Tutankhamon "Il più affascinante libro mai scritto sull'#Egitto", Questa edizione Integrale che fu pubblicata per la prima volta In #Italia nel #1825 e mai più ristampata è arricchita da numeroseillustrazioni d'epoca e corredata da una Introduzione, note e spiegazioni di Alberto Silotti che nel corso di numerose spedizioniha ripercorso fedelmente gli itinerari di #Belzoni lungo Il #Nilo a nel deserti d'#Egitto e ha curato l'edizione critica del "#Narrative" (titolo originale Inglese del giornale di viaggio di Belzoni) per ll #BritishMuseum.Le numerose #litografie d'#epoca nel volume contribuiscono a ricreare l'atmosfera dei primi #viaggiatori che arrivarono in #Egitto nel#XIX secolo e le Imprese degli aspiratori e degli scopritori del suo straordinari monumenti.

name: 2019-10-10 03.00.24 2151040434252652876_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Çalılıktaki Koç heykelciği. Sümer Erken Hanedanlar dönemi, MÖ 2600-2400. Ur, Kraliyet Mezarlığı. Irak. British Museum.Yüksekliği 45.7 cm, genişliği 30.48 cm. Koçun başı, bacakları ve çiçekli ağaç için altınla kaplanmış ahşap kullanılmış. Boynuzları, gözleri ve postu lapis lazuliden, kulakları ise bakırdan._______________ “The Ram in the Thicket” statuette. Sumerian Early Dynastic period, 2600-2400 BC. Ur, Royal Cemetery. Iraq. British Museum.45.7 cm in height, 30.48 cm in width. It was made of a variety of materials – the fleece, the horns, and the eyes are made of lapis lazuli, the ears are made of copper, while the wood, which is overlaid with gold, was used for the ram’s head, legs, and the flowering tree. #arkeofili #arkeoloji #archaeology #ancient #iraq #ırak #statuette #heykelcik #sumerian #sümer #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-10 05.07.24 2151104363731669732_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Monte Vesúvio, desde 79 dC, 172, 203, 222, possivelmente 303, 379, 472, 512, 536, 685, 787, 860, 900, 968, 991, 999, 1006, 1037, 1049 1073, 1139, 1150 e 1270, 1347 e 1500.O vulcão entrou em erupção em 1631, seis vezes no século 18 (incluindo 1779 e 1794), oito vezes no século 19 e novamente em 1906, 1929 e 1944.Não houve explosão desde 1944, e nenhuma das explosões após 79 DC foi tão grande ou destrutiva quanto a explosão que enterrou Pompéia em cinzas.@curiosomisterio_______________Desde 79 dC, o Vesúvio entrou em erupção repetidamente, em 172, 203, 222, possivelmente em 303, 379, 472, 512, 536, 685, 787, 860, 900, 968, 991, 999, 1006, 1037, 1049, 1073 , 1139, 1150, e pode ter havido erupções em 1270, 1347 e 1500.O vulcão entrou em erupção novamente em 1631, seis vezes no século 18 (incluindo 1779 e 1794), oito vezes no século 19 e em 1906, 1929 e 1944.Não houve erupções desde 1944, e nenhuma das erupções após 79 dC foi tão grande ou destrutiva como a de Pompeia.________ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ #Tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

text: ⁣⁣⁣⁣Unuz Você sabia que os maias acreditavam em um deus de corpo humano, mas cabeça de morcego, chamado Camazotz, 2500 anos antes de Batman, o personagem da DC Comics que conhecemos?⁣Na mitologia maia, podemos alcançar um deus morcego chamado Camazotz. No entanto, você pode ver na foto não é um trabalho antigo dos maias. Este trabalho foi feito pelo artista Kimball em 2014 e exibido no Museu de Design do México. ⁣⁣ Cam Camazotz - um deus Muito antes da DC Comics nos apresentar o Batman, 2.500 anos atrás, para ser mais preciso?⁣⁣@curiosomisterioUm deus morcego chamado Camazotz pode ser encontrado na mitologia maia, mas esta imagem não representa uma escultura antiga feita pelos maias. Esta é realmente uma obra de arte moderna criada em 2014 pelo artista Kimball para uma exposição no Museu Mexicano de Design.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️〰️ #archeotravel #archaeology #archaeology #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus # beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #love_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues # italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

name: 2019-10-10 13.18.39 2151351615880409623_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Girl in a Field (c.1857).🎨 Painted by Ludwig Knaus.Born: 5 October 1829, Wiesbaden, Germany.Died: 7 December 1910, Berlin Germany..🏛 Location: Hermitage Museum, St-Petersburg..📝 Studied from 1845 to 1852 under Sohn and Schadow in Düsseldorf. His early works, like "The Gamblers" in the Düsseldorf Gallery, are in the manner of that school, being dark and heavy in color. This deficiency was remedied by study at Paris, whither he went in 1852 and enrolled as a pupil of Thomas Couture.In 1853 his "Morning after the Kermess" received the second gold Medal of the Salon and made him a celebrated painter. Except for a year's study in Italy he remained in Paris until 1860.His chief works of this period include "The Golden Wedding", "The Baptism", and "The Promenade", purchased for the Luxembourg.From 1861 to 1866 he practiced at Berlin, producing such works as "Boys Playing Cards", "Looking for a Bride", and "His Highness on His Travels". The next eight years of his life saw the production of much of his best work, including "The Children's Festival", "In Great Distress", and "The Village Prince". From 1874 to 1883 he was professor at the Royal Prussian Academy, Berlin, continuing to reside in that city until his death.He was a member of the Berlin, Munich, and many other academies; an Officer of the Legion of Honor and a Knight of the Prussian Order Pour le Mérite. Possibly, his most famous work is "Girl in a Field". Engravings of his works were especially popular among the German peasantry.Ludwig Knaus's work has been offered at auction multiple times, with realized prices ranging from $89 USD to $296,000 USD, depending on the size and medium of the artwork. Since 1998 the record price for this artist at auction is $296,000 USD for Charity, sold at Christie's New York in 2006. The artist died in 1910....#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #field #ludwigknaus #wiesbaden #berlin #yourarttimes

name: 2019-10-10 15.42.02 2151423784861987959_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Inspired By The East: How The Islamic World Influenced Western Art⠀Exhibition • British Museum • 10am - 5pm • £14⠀⠀Charting the fascinating history of cultural and artistic interactions between East and West, this exhibition explores the impact the Islamic world has had on Western art for centuries.⠀⠀Artistic exchange between East and West has a long and intertwined history, and the exhibition picks these stories up from the 15th century, following cultural interactions that can still be felt today. Objects from Europe, North America, the Middle East and North Africa highlight a centuries-old tradition of influence and exchange from East to West. The diverse selection of objects includes ceramics, photography, glass, jewellery and clothing, as well as contemporary art, showcasing how artistic exchange influenced a variety of visual and decorative arts. The exhibition concludes with a 21st-century perspective, through the eyes of four female artists from the Middle East and North Africa who continue to question and subvert the idea of Orientalism in their work and explore the subject of Muslim female identity.⠀⠀The show takes a deeper look at the art movement of ‘Orientalism’ – specifically the way in which North Africa and the Middle East were represented as lands of beauty and intrigue, especially in European and North American art. Often blurring the lines between fantasy and reality, Orientalist art reached its heyday in the mid-1800s, as Europeans and North Americans were looking overseas to fundamentally learn more about other cultures, but its popularity had faded by the 1940s with the decline of the British Empire.⠀⠀More information via link in bio.⠀⠀Visit Bounce for more London events: www.bounce.london ⠀⠀#islamicart #britishmuseum #whatsonlondon #exhibitonslondon #artlondon #bounce

name: 2019-10-10 15.48.40 2151427122572085983_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Repost from @artofofiare using @RepostRegramApp - Öba gha tò kpèré... The Oba(King) of the Binis is perceived as a God-King by his subjects. In times past, the Bini King was held highly as a deity and presided over a large and civilised kingdom spanning great lengths in the west coast of Africa (even into the region known today as Ghana). The Oba of Benin was partly a warrior, a religious head and a hereditary king. He was believed to have the ability to shape-shift into the form of a Leopard at will as he also controlled tamed Leopards around his palace court.Today, the Oba still holds this position, even though diluted to a great extent, but still effective as the Benin Kingdom has been incorporated into the Nation Nigeria. ---- Finished work from my #WIP yesterday.Software: Ps#biniart #obaofbenin #bini #leopardking #fantasy #obaewuare #warriorking #beninHistory #binihistory #bronzehead #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-10 17.27.56 2151477080919833187_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Today is World Mental Health Day and I have thought long and hard about a suitable post. In the end I decided to just give you the river, my healer and soulmate, my confidante and saviour... ﻿'When I was by the river, I was somewhere else, disconnected from the city and a world away from my problems. It was my escape, from people, work, awkward situations, even sometimes from myself. It was where I went to forget about my failing relationship and my unfulfilling jobs, it healed my broken heart, helped me to make sense of the senseless and threw a watery arm around my shoulders when life became too much. Sometimes, just a stolen halfhour was enough. Other times I walked beside it for miles, casting my problems into the retreating tide, telling it my secrets.' Mudlarking: Lost and Found on the River Thames by Lara Maiklem#LondonMudlark #Mudlark #Mudlarking #mudlarkingbook

name: 2019-10-10 20.26.26 2151566929345499126_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 📌Tiflis, Gürcistan'nın başkentidir. Rus yönetimi altındaki dönemlerle uzun, karmaşık bir tarihi yansıtıyor. Çeşitli mimarisi Doğu Ortodoks kiliselerini, süslü art nouveau binalarını ve Sovyet Modernist yapılarını kapsar. Her şeyden önce yeniden inşa edilmiş bir 4. yüzyıl kalesi olan Narikala.....📌Tbilisi is the capital of the country of Georgia. Its cobblestoned old town reflects a long, complicated history, with periods under Persian and Russian rule. Its diverse architecture encompasses Eastern Orthodox churches, ornate art nouveau buildings and Soviet Modernist structures. Looming over it all are Narikala, a reconstructed 4th-century fortress, and Kartlis Deda, an iconic statue of the “Mother of Georgia.” 📸👉👉👉@travelwithtalia👈👈👈Post by: @arkeoveyasam Follow us: @archeo.travel @ancient.road #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

She’s frightening him by showing a painting of the Spanish Armada being defeated by the English naval forces. The queen says: ”Monster! - look at that and tremble!!!” Image © The Trustees of the British Museum#prints #etching #satire #humour #ghost #halloween #napoleon #britishhistory #napoleonicwars #spanisharmada #history #nineteenthcentury #19thcentury #19thcenturyart #art #arthistory #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-10 20.37.29 2151572487308242361_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ~Ο Θησαυρός του Snettisham~Μια σειρά ανασκαφών μεταξύ 1948 και 1973 στην κομητεία του Norfolk στην Αγγλία έφερε στο φως το σύνολο που είναι γνωστό ως "ο Θησαυρός του Snettisham". Ο θησαυρός αποτελείται από περίπου 150 κομμάτια "torc" (είδος μεταλλικού κοσμήματος που φοριέται γύρω από το λαιμό) και 70 ακέραια. Χρονολογείται γύρω στο 70 π.Χ.Τα torcs ήταν κατασκευασμένα από συνεστραμμένα ελάσματαατόφιου χρυσού και αργύρου. Είχαν θαφτεί σκοπίμως σε ένα λάκκο, μετά από χρόνια χρήση. Αυτοί που τα έθαψαν ήθελαν, πιθανώς, να διαφυλάξουν τα πολύτιμα αντικείμενά τους σε περίοδο πολέμου ή ανασφάλειας. Ίσως, πάλι, να τα αφιέρωσαν στους θεούς τους - σύμφωνα με μία υπόθεση, η σκόπιμη καταστροφή πολύτιμων αντικειμένων συνιστά μορφή ανάθεσης (θρησκευτικής αφιέρωσης). Παρότι άγνωστης προέλευσης, τα ευρήματα είναι αρκετά υψηλής ποιότητας ώστε να ανήκαν σε βασιλικό θησαυρό των Iceni, βρυθονικής φυλής της Εποχής του Σιδήρου της Βρετανίας.▪︎~The Snettisham Hoard~The Snettisham Treasure is a series of discoveries of Iron Age precious metal, found in Snettisham, Norfolk between 1948 and 1973.The hoard consists of around 150 metal torc fragments, and over 70 complete torcs (stiff metal necklaces), dating from 70 BCE. The torcs are made from twisted strands of solid gold and silver wire and had been deliberately buried in a pit after several years of heavy use. One hypothesis suggests the deliberate destruction of valuable items was a form of votive offering.Though its origins are unknown, the hoard is of a high enough quality to have been royal treasure of the Iceni, a Britonnic tribe of Iron Age Britain.▪︎#archaeologicalmuseum #archaeologia #archaeology #archaeologylife #historylovers #archaeologylove #museum #museum_lovers #gold #ancientgreece #ironage #torcs  #preciousmetal #storiantica #britain #historia #museumsaroundtheworld #archaeologist #mythology #britonnic #artefacts #britisharchaeology #britishmuseum #snettishamhoard #hoard

name: 2019-10-10 20.41.25 2151574463691210644_britishmuseum.jpg
text: I've been storytelling today @britishmuseum with all the toddlers and babies in this beautiful Eastern setting. Part of the 'Inspired by the East' exhibition. I told stories from the Arabian Nights collection for their regular 'Little Feet under 5s'. With music, arts and crafts and lots of movement, it was an energetic morning which ended with a dancing parade at the Sultan's Palace. 🎶 One mum exclaimed how captivated her 8 month old was. The older children loved trying on my jewelled props. 👑💎😀

text: [3/3] Resonance from the past | British MuseumElgin was a lover of art and antiquities.Concerned about damage being done to important artworks in the temples of Greece,he asked permission of the Sublime Porte to have artists measure, sketch, and copy important pieces of sculpture and architectural detail for posterity.An outcry arose over the affair, and Elgin was assailed for rapacity, vandalism, and dishonesty in hauling the Grecian treasures to London.The Greek government has frequently demanded the return of the marbles, but the British Museum has not acceded, and the issue remains controversial. ↟

name: 2019-10-10 22.55.37 2151642014920546243_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The "Waterloo Helmet" is an example of a ceremonial horned helmet from Celtic La Tene culture. The helmet was originally decorated with pieces of red glass, and would have been even more visually striking when it was made. It is impractical for use in combat, and was probably only used for ceremonial purposes, possibly in processions or parades.The bronze helmet was made c. 150 - 50 BCE, and was found in the Thames River near the Waterloo Bridge, England. It is the only example of an Iron Age horned helmet to be found in Europe, and the only Iron Age helmet to be found in southern England. The Waterloo Helmet is on display in the British Museum in London.•••••••••••• •(Image © by the British Museum)

text: The history of magic is as long as time and as wide as the world. In every culture, in every age, in every place and, probably, in every heart, there is magic.••Another great addition to the growing literature on Harry Potter! •• This non-fiction eBook features content adapted from the audiobook Harry Potter: A History of Magic – inspired by the British Library exhibition of the same name. It is the complete collection of the four eBooks in the series.••A Journey Through examines the colourful characters and curious incidents of the real history of magic, and how they relate to the Hogwarts curriculum of the Harry Potter stories. From spells and charms throughout the years to potions made for medicinal purposes or as poisons. To the use of bones and peering into teacups in the parlours of the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, to see what fate and fortune holds. ••••@wexfordlibraries @bolindaaudio @Bolindaaudio @BorrowBox #Bolinda #BorrowBox #Listenup #Audiobooks #librarylove #october #Halloween #magic #librariesofinstagram@librariesireland #libraryusersrock #whatlibrariesdo #ebooks #harrypotter #jkrowling #britishmuseum #series

text: “The warrior” REAL MIRRORED PHOTO OF A STONE PHOTOGRAPHED IN SOUTH TYROL IN AN AREA WHERE A ROMAN CASTRUM WAS PRESENT . THE PHOTO WAS TAKEN IN A TERRITORY TYPICALLY INHABITED BY THE RETI WHERE THE ROMANS THEN SETTLED. HOWEVER, SOUTH TYROL WAS ALSO AN AREA OF COMMERCE FOR THE ETRUSCANS (NOTE, IN FACT, THAT THE WARRIOR'S HELMET SEEMS TO HAVE AN ETRUSCAN AND NOT A ROMAN SHAPE). THE ARCHETYPE OF THE WARRIOR IS PRESENT IN MANY POPULATIONS, SYMBOLIZING STRENGTH, COURAGE AND THE DOMAIN OF ONE'S FEARS.@artidofficial www.stefanofavaretto.it#etruscan #warrior #roman #stone #villagiulia #masterpiece #artcurator #artinfluencer #etruschi #instapic #stars #vip #britishmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #moma #instagood #artporn #stefanofavarettoofficial #artblogger #museum #eventiroma #energy #spiritualart

name: 2019-10-11 02.33.50 2151751845077069499_britishmuseum.jpg
text: @withrepost • @garlandmagazine Oblivion by Sheraz Faisal⁠Sheraz Faisal’s practice as a designer and fine artist overlap to each other and he showed an enigmatic vocabulary of visuals that are sensuous and edgy. His approach to his subject matter is always very minimal and refined. Bullet is an object of destruction, a universal notion to show masculinity and power. He wanted to negate this idea and convert it into something ornate object for everyday life. His fascination kept him going to discover the symbolism and taboos attached to a bullet. In the last ten years, the war against the terror brought Pakistan into limelight and western media around the world focused to sell the stories of Pakistan, either true or false, bullets or veil, the negative image projected of the country always bothered him. Sheraz was compelled and passionate to see through the haze and do his bit to let the world see the creative side of the nation.⁠⁠He started collecting empty fired bullet shells to make very simple pair of earrings by adding tiny semi-precious stones or engraving roses on it. His fellow artist admired his creativity and encouraged him. Soon ALIEL discovered and got him on board to get a conscious and professional attitude towards his work and manufacturing. “Oblivion” was created using copper fired bullet shells, gold plated with 18 K yellow gold, pink tourmaline, white pearls and a halo of diamonds added a new character to the piece.⁠⁠⁠In our current issue, Asad Hayee documents a project with Sheraz Faisal to create jewellery interpretations of artworks. @SherazFaisal⁠⁠#Pakistanjewellery #Lahore #garlandmag #thestans #diamonds #jewelrydesigner #fashiondesigner #textiledesign #furnituredesign #salimahashmi #vogue #barber #luxuryjewelry #finejewelry #ink #menwithtattoos #hautejoaillerie #oneofakind #instadaily #history #inked #visualart #hoscos #britishmuseum #fashiondiaries #milano #lifeofadventures #bnulive #alieljewellers #pifd

name: 2019-10-11 02.39.30 2151754699409535271_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀🇬🇧_United Kingdom_London2019_January⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀20대 첫 유럽, 그리고 첫 영어권 국가를 겪고 있던 나에게 뜻 밖의 도움이 됐던 건 바로 우버 드라이버 쓰앵님들이셨다. 별점 5점을 위해, 최상의 서비스를 제공하려는 그분들의 부단한 노력은 주로 스몰톡으로 이어졌다. 오래간 영어를 자주 쓰지 않아 아직 어색하고 입도 덜 풀린 나에게 기사님들은 마치 무료 20분 체험판 스터디서치 같은 존재였다. 낯선 그들과 얼굴도 마주하지 않고, 간간히 백미러로 눈을 맞춘 채 나눈 수많은 정다운 대화. 그 중 아직도 기억에 남는 기사님이 두 분이 계신다. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀한 분은 런던에 처음 도착해서 히드로 공항에서 만난, 내 생애 첫 우버 드라이버님. 어릴 때 런던에 와봤으나 아무런 기억도 나질 않는다는 나의 말에, 기사님은 친구집으로 달려가는 길 지나치는 영국의 모든 것들을 소개해주셨다. 런던의 맛ㅈ... 그런건 없고 그냥 치킨티카마살라가 전통 요리라고 하셨던 것만 기억난다.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀두 번째 기사님은 바로 나를 대영박물관에 데려다주신 기사님이다. 정말 말 그대로 젠틀맨이셨던 기사님은 영국의 어떤 모습이 가장 좋았냐는 질문을 하셨고, 난 그 질문에 ‘하늘이 보여서 좋아요’라고 답했다. 빌딩숲이라고 할 수 있는 강남, 광화문에서 보던 한 뼘짜리 갑갑한 하늘과 다른 뻥 뚫린 하늘이 좋아보이더라. 그 대답에 기사님은 친절히 영국의 오래된 벽돌 건물들의 건축 양식과 역사를 설명해주셨다. 기사님과 나는 (주로 기사님은) 엄청난 지식을 뿜어내며 대영박물관을 향해 갔다. 그러다가 우리는 대영박물관이 왜 입장료가 없는지에 대해 얘기하며 제국주의 양아치 영국을 열심히 비판하며, 좋은 대화 나눠서 감사하단 뜻으로 말랑카우와 한국 스티커를 잔뜩 드렸다. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀도착한 대영박물관은 너무 좋았다. 너무 넓고 아름답고 쾌적하며 너무나도 역사적이고 문화적인 공간이었다. 다 둘러 볼 시간이 없음을 알기에, 몇군데를 골라서 가려 했다. 허나 나는 내가 심각한 길치임을 망각했고, 뭐 결과적으로는 발이 닿는대로 보고 왔으며 그 또한 좋았다. 폐장 시간이 되어 계단을 걸어내려오며 바닥에 새겨진 문구를 보게 되었다. 생각하거나 해석해 볼 겨를 없이 사진만 파박 찍고 박물관을 뛰쳐 나왔다.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀‘And let thy feet millenniums hence be set in midst of knowledge’ 아주 재수 없다⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#여행 #여행스타그램 #추억 #기록 #유럽여행 #영국여행 #사진 #london #europe #uk #londra #travel #travelphotography #unitedkingdom #follow #travelgram. #f4f #photo #photography #followfollow #britishmuseum #대영박물관 #주저리주저리

name: 2019-10-11 03.59.37 2151795021896839437_britishmuseum.jpg
text: İNCİ EVİNER’ İN HAREM ADLI VİDEO ESERİ, 10 EKİM 2019 – 26 OCAK 2020 TARİHLERİ ARASINDA BRITISH MUSEUM, LONDRA’DAİnci Eviner’ in“Harem” (2009) adlı video eserinin sergilendiği “Inspired by the east- how the Islamic world influenced western art” adlı grup sergisi, 10 Ekim 2019’ da British Museum’ da açılıyor.10 Ekim 2019-26 Ocak 2020 tarihleri arasında British Museum, Londra’da gerçekleşecek grup sergisi “Inspired by the east- how the Islamic world influenced western art”, Doğu ve Batı arasındaki büyüleyici kültürel ve sanatsal etkileşimlerin geçmişini izleyerek, İslam dünyasının yüzyıllar boyunca Batı sanatını nasıl etkilediğini araştırıyor.İnci Eviner’in de aralarında bulunduğu, 21. yüzyıl perspektifinden Oryantalizm fikrini eserlerinde ters yüz eden dört kadın sanatçının eserleriyle sonlanan sergi, bu sanat hareketinde Batı gözüyle Doğu’nun güzel ve merak uyandıran topraklar olarak temsil edilme biçimlerini inceleyerek Oryantalizm’in yalnızca resmi değil, çok daha geniş bir yelpazedeki görsel ve dekoratif sanatları nasıl etkilediğini yansıtıyor.Sergi, 26 Ocak 2020 tarihine kadar izlenebilecek.http://www.kitaptansanattan.com/sanattan/inci-evinerin-haremi-british-museumda/.........#incieviner #britishmuseum #art #sanat

text: 10/08/2019〜10/010/2019﻿﻿Hello！﻿﻿ヨーロッパ、バックパッカーでの周遊1人旅 ﻿7日目は、パリからロンドンへ2時間半、ドーバー海峡を渡りユーロスターに乗って移動🚄﻿﻿7日目は、イギリス ロンドン🇬🇧﻿﻿2泊3日かけロンドンを観光してきました！﻿﻿スペインの時の服装は、半袖短パンで良かったのが、ロンドンは寒すぎてダウンを着ないと死ぬ笑笑﻿﻿ロンドンは、ハリーポッターで観たまんまの街の世界！﻿﻿ロンドンタクシーがとにかくカッコよかった😎﻿﻿ビッグベンが工事中だったのが残念😩﻿﻿でもハリーポッターが大好きな自分は、ロンドン市内で巡れるロケ地は周れて嬉しかった！！！次回は、ハリーポッタースタジオに行ってみたい🥺﻿﻿ロンドンのご飯はよく美味しくないと聞くが、そんなことはなくフィッシュ&チップスも美味しかった！﻿﻿夜行バスに乗って次の目的地へ移動🚍﻿﻿Thank you London, GoodBye UK！﻿﻿#イギリス #ロンドン﻿#ヨーロッパ #ヨーロッパ周遊 ﻿#バックパック #バックパッカー﻿#旅行 #旅﻿#大英博物館 #バッキンガム宮殿 #ビッグベン #セントポール大聖堂 #タワーブリッジ ﻿#UK #England #London #Europa﻿#backpack #backpacker #backpacking #trip #travel ﻿#britishmuseum #buckinghampalace #bigben #westminsterabbey #stpaulscathedral #towerbridge #aroundeurope ﻿#GoPro﻿﻿

name: 2019-10-11 08.26.28 2151929330706485187_britishmuseum.jpg
text: ¿Momia de la mala suerte?.El portal web de National Geographic ha publicado un interesante artículo sobre la supuesta maldición de una momia que se encuentra en el Museo Británico de Londres. En realidad no se trata de una momia, sino de una tapa de ataúd egipcia que perteneció a una mujer de alto rango, posiblemente una sacerdotisa de Amón Ra, a la cual se le atribuyen múltiples desgracias. La más sonada es la de haber sido la causante del hundimiento del Titanic..El ataúd de 1,62 metros consiste en una cubierta antropomorfa repleta de jeroglíficos, pintada de vivos colores, tallada en madera y yeso, y data hacia finales de la dinastía XXI (950-900 a.C). El objeto fue bautizado hace años comoThe Unlucky Mummy (la momia de la mala suerte), a pesar de que en realidad tal momia no existe..Pero ¿por qué se le puso tan nefasto nombre? Parece ser que a esta sacerdotisa se le atribuyen las mil y una desgracias relacionadas con sus sucesivos propietarios y sobre quienes intentaron contar la historia de sus maldades. La leyenda más impresionante sin duda, es la cuenta que el sarcófago viajaba a bordo del Titanic, y fue el causante del hundimiento del famoso transatlántico..Asimismo, según algunos rumores, llevaba un amuleto en su cabeza que rezaba así: "Despierta de tu postración y el rayo de tus ojos aniquilará a todos aquellos que quieran adueñarse de ti"..Evidentemente, en torno a la cubierta del ataúd de esta mujer se mezclan todo tipo de informaciones, algunas verdaderas, otras rumores y la mayoría auténticos disparates. Sin embargo, los invito a leer el reportaje completo pues es una interesante historia que vale la pena conocer. ..Fuente: https://www.nationalgeographic.com.es/historia/curiosa-momia-mala-suerte_14741/amp.Imagen tomada de: https://elpais.com/cultura/2018/08/04/actualidad/1533408384_752727.amp.html..#egipto #egypt #momia #mummy  #maldicion #curse #antiguoegipto #ancientegypt #britishmuseum #legends #leyendas #egiptologia #egiptofaraonico

name: 2019-10-11 09.24.44 2151958659647899788_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Opened today at the British Museum (@BritishMuseum): Lalla Essaydi (@lallaessaydi) in "Inspired by the East: How the Islamic World Influenced Western Art"!.Right off the heels of Frieze (@Friezeartfair) week in London, the excitement in the art world continues with this compelling show co-curatored by Julia Tugwell (#JuliaTugwell) and Olivia Threlkeld (#OliviaThrelkeld), sponsored by Standard Chartered Bank (@stanchart) and organized with Islamic Arts Museum Malaysia (@islamicartsmuseummalaysia). The show examines how European and North American visual arts have been inspired by the Islamic world for centuries. Known as ‘Orientalism’, this representation of the East in Western art often blurred the line between fantasy and reality. Featured in the show is photographer Lalla Essaydi who reimagines the harem paintings of 19th Century Orientalism to show women as active agents rather than passive objects subjected to the voyeuristic imaginings of European artists. Essayadi replaces the bright colors, nudity and luxury of Orientalist paintings with monochrome settings, fully clothed women and strings of Arabic letters, taking back ownership of their representation. This thought-provoking exhibit is sure to keep art lovers excited! “Inspired by the East” is open NOW through January 26, 2020 at The British Museum in London! .Image: Lalla Essaydi, "Bullets #5," 2009, chromogenic print mounted to aluminum with a UV protective laminate, 48 x 60 inches.#InspiredByTheEast #Photography #Art #WomenInTheArts #19thCenturyArt #Orientalism #islamicart #middleeasternart #lallaessaydi #painting #Frieze #ArtFairs #London #BritishMuseum

text: 在發舊照時～回憶重回當時的人事地物🗿彷彿又回到了現場-👇🏻👇🏻Faromi國慶活動👇🏻👇🏻@faromi.style -🏛British museum大英博物館世界最大博物館，收藏800萬件藏品！從亞洲到非洲、不列顛到希臘...全世界古文明派對🎉絕對跟你想像的博物館完全不一樣！尤其裡面古希臘、羅馬、埃及文物堪稱鎮館之寶⚖️雖然有些寶物都是掠奪而來🏴‍☠️但時間總是沖淡一切，前人種樹後人乘涼，就帶著尊敬的態度來吧！(雖然走整天也看不完)#britishmuseum#購物金#roma#munny#rosettastone#bookofthedead#unitedkingdom

name: 2019-10-11 13.36.03 2152085146977698942_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Fascinating Rhythm..🎨 Painted by Eric Bowman.Born: in Pasadena and grew up in Orange County, CA..🖼 Oil on canvas 9x12 in..📝 Essentially a self-taught artist, Eric had a knack for drawing as far back as he can remember, always the class artist throughout his elementary and high school years. Early on, various art-related jobs such as silk screen T-shirt printer or surfboard airbrush technician led to a lengthy and successful career as a commercial artist, eventually transitioning to fine art painting.Eric’s style of painting is a mixture of Impressionism and Realism. His stylistic influences are the Russian Impressionists and various American Impressionists of the last century. He is equally adept at both landscape and figurative painting. Light and shadow play a crucial role in solidifying his compositions.He has garnered many awards in juried competitions, showing in national and regional exhibitions in some of the country’s most prestigious galleries and museums.His paintings are in collections around the world, including England, Australia, Canada and Mexico.Eric resides in northwest Oregon with his wife and daughter....#museum #moma #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #gettymuseum #curator #graffiti #streetart #oilpainting #rhythm #music #jazz #party #ericbowman #pasadena #orangecounty #yourarttimes

name: 2019-10-11 15.33.19 2152144170045765139_britishmuseum.jpg
text: This is a piece of Roman roof tile, called a tegula. It would have been a flat with a raised edge on each side. It’s not that unusual to find pieces of tegula on the foreshore, but this is a bit special because it’s got the thumb print of the person that made it baked into the clay. I haven’t let anyone else touch it yet, I’m the only person to have pressed my thumb into this dimple in almost two thousand years and I’m keeping it to myself for a little bit longer.#Londonmudlark #mudlark #mudlarking

text: Kids books about Egyptian mummies? What are you thoughts? A little bit scary, fascinating or too much? I got to thinking as I was reading this wonderful attached book about rhymes. What is a mummy? “Not me!” Was the first obstacle. That took some time... then what about the zombie? 😂 It really needs to come with a warning ⚠️ “Prepare sensible answers to a. What’s a mummy b. What’s a zombie?” That said it’s great fun and made me realise that perhaps I should add a warning at the front of “Millie meets the mummies- The British Museum” it’s coming soon! #parents #dinosaurbooks #dinosaurbooksforkids #kidsmuseum #kidsinmuseums #kidscorner #museumsforkids #museumforkids #museumswithkids #kidslovemuseums #britishmuseum #britishmuseumlondon #thebritishmuseum #naturalhistorymuseumlondon

text: Etienne Nasreddine Dinet’s The Prayer currently on view at The British Museum’s new exhibition. Dinet, a French artist, visiting North Africa in the late nineteenth century was so taken by the culture and the people that he converted to Islam and became fluent in Arabic. He even translated Arabic literature into French. So quite the dude then! #britishmuseum#dinet#orientalism

name: 2019-10-11 20.13.19 2152285104230235868_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Dr. Peuramaki-Brown spent Friday morning at the British Museum Anthropology Library and Archives Study Room examining reports and personal correspondence related to the 1931 T.A. Joyce expedition to the Pearce sites of the Cockscomb Basin. Along with the papers were two newly recovered expedition maps of the area and the smaller Williams’ Ruins site, which had been previously misplaced in the archives, as well as a modified map (1887) of the Maya region with additions/updates made by Alfred Maudslay to the Sittee River and South Stann Creek areas. These documents are helping us tie our recent reconnaissance trip (2016) to the Pearce sites in with previous research in the area, as well as our newly acquired (2019) lidar data of the area and future plans for investigations. Many thanks to Francesca Hillier and Jim Hamill of the BM for their ongoing support #scraparky #britishmuseum

text: Marble sculpture of Iris, from the west pediment of the Parthenon, ca. 438BC-432BC. Originally with wings, they’re now missing. From the British Museum’s pages: “The drapery clings to her body in some places, while elsewhere the folds of material flutter around restlessly.The movement of the drapery and the pose of the sculpture suggest the rush of wind against her body during flight.” Photo taken at the British Museum#parthenon #ancientgreece #art #britishmuseum #marble #sculpture #elginmarbles #acropolis

name: 2019-10-11 21.23.50 2152320588998468298_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 📌Antakya’da, The Museum Hotel Antakya’nın inşaatı sırasında bulunan ve yerinde korunmasına karar verilen Antik Roma dönemine ait mozaik.Dünyada bilinen en büyük tek parça hâlinde antik taban mozaiği. Mozaik 1050 metrekarelik bir alanı kaplıyor. Müze-otelin yapımı sırasında Eros heykelciği, sikkeler, metal objeler, mimari parçalar ve pişmiş toprak eserlerin de olduğu 30.000'e yakın arkeolojik eser ortaya çıktı.Daha fazlası için @ancient.road  @archeo.travel 👈_ 🇬🇧 The ancient Roman period mosaic found during the construction of a hotel in Antakya. It is the largest known single expanse of floor mosaic in the world. The mosaic covers an area of 1050 square meters.During the construction of the museum-hotel, nearly 30,000 archaeological artefacts, including the Eros statuette, coins, metal objects, architectural pieces and terracotta artifacts were discovered. Photo by @cemalemden .Follow us @ancient.road  @archeo.travel 👈Post by : @antiktarih #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology  #archeologia #italianart #athensgreece #arte #athens #storiadellarte #ephesus #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #acropolis #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #traveling_arte #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #rome #britishmuseum #ancientroad #arqueologia

text: #Repost @britishmuseum (@get_repost)・・・🐉 This colourful cloisonné jar was made in 15th-century China. The enamel decoration shows a vigorous-looking dragon chasing a pearl through clouds.Brightly coloured enamelled objects like this were once thought to be vulgar and garish, but by the early 1400s they were considered suitable for the emperor’s palace – the reign mark suggests this jar was used in the Imperial Household.In Room 33 you can learn more about the fascinating history of China from 5000 BC to the present.#BritishMuseum #China #ChineseHistory #cloisonné #art #design #London #Museum #Ming

name: 2019-10-11 23.06.32 2152372282218003838_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Details from contemporary artworks by Raeda Saadeh and Layla Essaydi at the closing section of the British Museum’s wonderful show “Inspired by the East: how the Islamic world influenced western art”. The exhibition begins with artworks dated back to the 1500’s including ceramics,glass, jewellery, manuscripts as well as painting and drawings. The contemporary photographic works by middle eastern and North African women artists are a contemporary reaction to the images of Orientalist representations of the East, subverting and undermining works by earlier European and North American artists. Exhibition is on til 26 January.#womenphotographers#phototgraphy#britishmuseum#exhibition#

name: 2019-10-11 23.56.07 2152397241321525320_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Sumerian ‘votive’ figures from the Abu temple at Eshnunna, (modern Tell Asmar), Iraq. 2900 to 2300 BCE. Votive figures such as these are displayed in the Iraq Museum, the Louvre, the Met Museum and the British Museum among others.It is thought that the purpose of votive statues was to offer constant prayers on behalf of the donor/owner. The most striking feature of such statuettes is the disproportionate size of the eyes. Scholars have offered various explanations for this such as; the alertness needed for constant prayer, or eyes wide open in awe and wonder, and eyes as windows to the soul, but of course, no one knows for certain. I absolutely love these little statues and it was a real joy to render them in illustrative form! #sumeria #sumerian #babylonian #tellasmar #akkadian #ancientneareast #illustration #artsandcrafts #colour #votivefigures #iraq #ancienthistory #sculptures #britishmuseum #louvre #metmuseum #iraqmuseum #pergamon #eshnunna #assyria #assyrian

name: 2019-10-12 00.56.46 2152427465427763284_britishmuseum.jpg
text: •The British Museum, in the Bloomsbury area of London, United Kingdom, is a public institution dedicated to human history, art and culture. Its permanent collection of some eight million works is among the largest and most comprehensive in existence, having been widely sourced during the era of the British Empire. It documents the story of human culture from its beginnings to the present.It was the first public national museum in the world.The British Museum was established in 1753, largely based on the collections of the Irish physician and scientist Sir Hans Sloane. It first opened to the public in 1759, in Montagu House, on the site of the current building. Its expansion over the following 250 years was largely a result of expanding British colonisation and has resulted in the creation of several branch institutions, the first being the Natural History Museum in 1881.••London, the capital of England and the United Kingdom, is a 21st-century city with history stretching back to Roman times. At its centre stand the imposing Houses of Parliament, the iconic ‘Big Ben’ clock tower and Westminster Abbey, site of British monarch coronations. Across the Thames River, the London Eye observation wheel provides panoramic views of the South Bank cultural complex, and the entire city.Standing on the River Thames in the south-east of England, at the head of its 50-mile (80 km) estuary leading to the North Sea, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. Londinium was founded by the Romans.The City of London, London's ancient core − an area of just 1.12 square miles (2.9 km2) and colloquially known as the Square Mile − retains boundaries that follow closely its medieval.Info: Wikipedia#vacations #moments #travel #instatravel #ig_photooftheday  #fun #ig_travel  #travelblogger #travelling #travelphotography #ig_shots #travelgram #photography #throwback #instadaily  #lovelondon #travel #travelholic #instamoments #igers  #instatravel #city #visitlondon #antiquity #museum #london #britishmuseum #uk

text: This is a very dear ceramic I bought years ago in London .It is a copy of the original displayed at the British Museum .It has always followed me in all the houses I have moved in .As the sun .The lion and sun symbol is based largely on astronomical and astrological configurations: the ancient sign of the sun in the house of Leo, which itself is traced backed to Babylonian astrology and Near Eastern traditions.It is also the emblem of the Pahlavi dinasty.#silenterivaoct19 #britishmuseum #pahlavi #persia #iran #lion #sun #leone #sole #vitaminima #details #dettagli #piatto #ceramica

name: 2019-10-12 13.13.16 2152792861925833905_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Paris🇫🇷&Londonの記録・・ロンドン…大英博物館・とにかく超巨大博物館でした。私たちの滞在日数ではゆっくり見られないほどの所有点数だったので、見たかった古代エジプトやギリシャあたりに絞って見学。・あのロゼッタストーンもここにあります。とにかく凄い。時間が無かったから借りなかったけど、音声ガイドを借りてじっくり見たかったな。・特にエジプトのミイラや棺、神殿の像や壁画に圧倒されました。細かい装飾が美しすぎる。猫ちゃんのミイラもあった🐈・もしいつかまたロンドンに来る機会があったら、丸一日ゆっくり見学したい。・ロンドンのすごいところ→美術館、博物館が企画展以外はすべて無料（お金持ちも貧しい人も、こう言った芸術品は平等に楽しむ権利があるとして、そうしているらしい。素晴らしい🙆‍♀️💮）・・つづく…#大英博物館 #britishmuseum

Hunefer’in karısı ve kızı yas tutmaktadır. Üç rahip ritüeli gerçekleştirirler. Sağdaki beyaz yapı, bir mezarı temsil eder.Opening of the mouth ceremonyIt was a ceremony realised in a stage of the mummification process..An illustration from the Book of the Dead of Hunefer, 1300 BC, British MuseumThe mummy of Hunefer, is supported by the god Anubis (or a priest wearing a jackal mask). Hunefer's wife and daughter mourn, and three priests perform rituals. The white building at the right is a representation of the tomb.#ceremony #ancientegyptian  #hunefer #britishmuseum #anubis #priest  #illustration #jackal #mısır #egypt

name: 2019-10-12 14.12.47 2152828415110162053_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Portrait of a young woman in profile, probably the painter Anna Ancher (c.1882).🎨 Painted by Peder Severin Krøyer.Born: 23 July 1851, Stavanger, Norway.Died: 21 November 1909, Skagen, Denmark..🖼 Oil on canvas 36 x 29 cm..📝 One of the foremost Impressionist painters from Denmark, the artist Peder Severin Kroyer was born in Norway, but brought up in Copenhagen where he studied at the Royal Academy.He became the leading member of the Skagen artist colony, a group known as the 'painters of light'. This group, which included Holger Drachmann and Carl Locher, was strongly influenced by French Impressionism.In particular, they sought to study and capture the effects of light at different times of the day. Kroyer's paintings from Skagen are lively and naturalistic, and were executed en plein air. The influence of Renoir and Whistler can be seen in his paintings "Hip Hip Hurrah!". Kroyer travelled widely, spending time in Paris studying the Impressionists, particularly Edouard Manet, Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Camille Pissarro, Paul Cezanne and Georges Seurat. Kroyer was impressed with the art movement, and its enthusiasm for painting from real life, whether it was a portrait, landscape or cityscape. It encouraged him to keep his palette light and to loosen his brushstroke.Kroyer is best known for his carefree pictures of life in Skagen. His wife became his favourite model and, from the 1890s, she is represented in many of his works.Kroyer was a champion of plein air painting, and there are black and white photographs of the artist sitting on the beach, working on his large canvases. The French Impressionists had popularised this artistic practice, and it allowed the artist to capture light directly as he saw it. The economy of objects in Kroyer’s paintings, and the priority he gives to atmosphere lends an air of Symbolism to his work....#museum #metmuseum #museedulouvre #britishmuseum #nationalgallery #museodelprado #vangoghmuseum #brooklynmuseum #artforum #artbasel #tatemodern #instamuseum #rijksmuseum #whitneymuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #nationalmuseum #curator #streetart #pederseverinkroyer #stavanger #norway #skagen #denmark #yourarttimes

name: 2019-10-12 18.31.53 2152958817616734491_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Hej kochani w to słoneczne sobotnie popołudnie zapraszam Was serdecznie na 3 post z cyklu Wyjazd do UK. Dzisiejszy post będzie się skupiał na muzeach. 20 września wybrałam się, najpierw do Muzeum Historii Nsturalnej, które mnie po prostu oczarowało, nie tylko wewnątrz ale i zewnątrz. Przepiękny monumentalny budynek z niezwykłym wnętrzem. W środku możemy zobaczyć szkielety dinozaurów, dowiedzieć się czegoś o życiu prechistorycznych zwierząt, poznać przodków obecnych królów sawanny czy zobaczyć szkielet przodka ludzkiego i zobaczyć ewolucję czaszki ludzkiej, od australopiteka do dzisiejszego człowirka myślącego. Następnie udałam się do British Museum, do którego marzyłam aby się udać od czasów kiedy miałam jakieś 7 lat(od 5 roku życia byłam zauroczona starożytnym egiptem, a w Muzeum Brytyjskim jest jedna z największych ekspozycji egipskich ).Niestety poza pięknym wnętrzem atchitektonicznym muzeum nie zrobiło na mnie dobrego wrażenia. Ekspozycjs Egipska jest ogromna ale potraktowana po macoszemu. Zabytki wystawione są w gablocie bez żadnej "otoczki". Wszystko na półkach za szkłem wyglądają jak w sklepie z dekoracją mieszkania. Mumie, pomimo kartusza z imieniem na sarkofagu podpisane są "mumia kobiety", "mumia mężczyzny". Dla mnie osobiście odebrało to zabytką starożytności tą magię, odarto ją z mistyczności aby zwykły zjadacz chleba mógł wszysyko zrozumieć. Nawet mumia została odarta z bandaży tylko po to by gawiedź nacieszyła oczy. Dla mnie powinno być to inaczej przedstawione, a uwierzcie mi, mają tam takie zbiory, że mogli by stworzyć perełkę. Mam nadzieję, że post się Wam podobał. Dajcie znać czy byliście w którymś z powyższych muzeów i jak wy je odbieracie. Teraz uciekam i życzę Wam wspaniałego weekendu. ...#naturalhistorymuseum #naturalhistorymuseumlondon#naturalhistory #thingstodolondon#londonmuseum #visitlondonofficial #thisislondon #visitlondon#toplondonphoto #lovelondon #ig_londonphotographers#timeoutlondon #ilovelondon  #museumofnaturalhistory#igerslondon #britishmuseum #greatshots  #egypt#ancientegypt #londontravel #museumlover#thebritishmuseum#hieroglyphics #wondersofegypttours#pharo#nile #afterlife #gods #visitegypt  #exploreegypt

name: 2019-10-12 20.41.17 2153023952639878767_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Abu Simbel tapınağının iç kısmı. Abu Simbel Tapınağı Güney Mısır’da bulunan ve Mısır firavunu II. Ramses (MÖ 1279-1213) tarafından yaptırılan en önemli antik tapınaklardan biridir. II.Ramses bu tapınakları düşmanlarına gücünü göstermek ve bunun yanında en çok sevdiği karısı Nefertari’ye aşkını göstermek amaçlı yaptırmıştır. Kayaların içi oyularak yapılmış ve tam 20 yılda tamamlanabilmiştir. En ilginç özelliklerinden biri de içerisinde bulunan tapınma taşına senede iki kez, Ramses’in doğum gününde ve tahta çıkış gününde (21 Şubat ve 21Ekim) gün ışığı doğrudan gelecek şekilde tasarlanmıştır._____ 🇬🇧 Inside Abu Simbel temple of Ramses II. Abu Simbel, site of two temples built by the Egyptian king Ramses II (reigned 1279–13 BCE), now located in Aswān muḥāfaẓah (governorate), southern Egypt. In ancient times the area was at the southern frontier of pharaonic Egypt, facing Nubia. The four colossal statues of Ramses in front of the main temple are spectacular examples of ancient Egyptian art. By means of a complex engineering feat in the 1960s, the temples were salvaged from the rising waters of the Nile River caused by erection of the Aswan High Dam.Post by : @antiktarih Follow us: @archeo.travel @ancient.road #archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum

name: 2019-10-12 20.43.06 2153024869817551943_britishmuseum.jpg
text: "Kraliçe Nefertiti"___________Nefertiti (MÖ 1370–1330), bir Mısır kraliçesi olup, tek tanrılı Atenizim dinini yayan Firavun Akhenaton’un eşidir. Eski Mısır tarihine ait bütün kitaplar, onun dillere destan güzelliğinden bahseder. Adı; “güzellik geliyor”, “güzel olan” ya da “güzelden gelen” anlamlarına geliyor. Kimi kaynaklarda Nefertiti’nin asıl adının Tadukhepa olduğu, ünlü güzelliğinden dolayı Nefertiti ismiyle anıldığı ifade ediliyor._Kraliçe Nefertiti’nin, nerden geldiği ve kökeni tam olarak bilinmemekte olup bununla ilgili, çeşitli varsayımlar vardır. Bunlardan en kabul göreni; Firavunların üç nesilden beri dost ülkelerle iyi ilişkilerini sürdürmek için onların prenseslerini alma alışkanlığı edindikleri 18. Hanedanlık zamanına götürüyor bizi; Mezopotamya ile Kafkaslar arasında bulunan Mitanni devletine._____________Nefertiti, also called Neferneferuaten-Nefertiti, (flourished 14th century BC), queen of Egypt and wife of King Akhenaton(formerly Amenhotep IV; reigned c.1353–36 BC), who played a prominent role in the cult of the sun god known as the Aton. Nefertiti’s parentage is unrecorded, but, as her name translates as “A Beautiful Woman Has Come,” early Egyptologists believed that she must have been a princess from Mitanni Syria._______Post by: @antiktarih ________Bizi takip etmeyi unutmayın / follow us >>>@ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road @ancient.road ____#archeotravel #arkeoloji #archaeology #arqueologia #archeologia #italianart #italia #arte #cairoegypt #storiadellarte #ancientegyptian #beniculturali30 #heritage #artes #museos #artistlife #egyptology #tesori_italiani #uffizigallery #rome🇮🇹 #loves_monuments #total_monuments #statue #statues #italia365 #tuscanygram #nefertiti #britishmuseum #louvremuseum via @archeo.travel

name: 2019-10-12 20.54.11 2153030442285462343_britishmuseum.jpg
text: The British Museum’s exhibition Inspired by the East. It opened this week and explores western artists’ Orientalist depictions of the Middle East over the centuries. It began with an acknowledgment of the late Palestinian-American scholar Edward Said’s work.  Scroll through for my fave, the Willy Wonka looking fella — Their Customs Are Very Peculiar. The exhibition also featured works by contemporary Middle Eastern women from Palestine, Morocco and Iran subverting the depictions of “woman in a harem”.•••#britishmuseum #london #uk #travel #museum #inspiredbytheeast #orientalism #edwardsaid

name: 2019-10-12 22.25.06 2153076206707150032_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 𝑽𝒊𝒂𝒈𝒈𝒊𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒆 𝒎𝒐𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒕𝒊 🏺Siete mai stati ad #Atene? Un città in cui il passato e il presente si sposano alla perfezione. Questa foto è stata scattata all’interno della meravigliosa #Acropoli, un luogo capace di catapultare i visitatori indietro nel tempo. Un tuffo nell’antica Grecia, che fa sentire piccoli piccoli al cospetto dei grandi sfarzi del passato 🏛🇬🇷.Le statue che vedete sono solo delle copie delle vere Cariatidi dell’Eréchtheion, tempio ionico collocato al centro del sito archeologico. Ma non temete! Le autentiche Cariatidi sono conservate all’interno del Museo dell’Acropoli, ad eccezione di una delle statue angolari che viene tuttora custodita al #BritishMuseum di Londra. .E voi? Siete mai stati ad Atene? 🏛...........#travel #Travelgram #traveling #Travelphotography #travelling #travelblogger #traveler #traveller #travelingram #traveltheworld #travelblog #travels #traveladdict #travellife #travelphoto #travelpics #traveldiaries #travelbug #travelpic #travelers #travelstoke #travelgirl #traveldiary #traveldeeper  #travellers #travelph

name: 2019-10-12 22.53.56 2153090711942273121_britishmuseum.jpg
text: SWIPE LEFT ON IMAGE ABOVE FOR 3 MORE PICTURES:.Shaghayegh Cyrous ((@shaghayeghcyrous)) is an Iranian-American artist and curator based in San Francisco..She started her art practice in Tehran, Iran, where she began her artistic practice with urban installation, performance, and photography. Since 2011 and moving to the bay area and experiencing life from the lens of a refugee, her work has dealt with the experience of cross-cultural communication and translation, addressing predicaments of estrangement and distance caused by political and cultural power dynamics..Her projects incorporate interactive time-based strategies such as social practice, socially engaged art, and participatory performances, as well as digital technologies such as video installation and live video chats, to create poetic spaces and opportunities for human connection..As she continues to research different strategies and languages of navigating various political and cultural issues, her practice has extended beyond her art into the curatorial realm. Her current focus is on the compression of time and space resulting from digital technologies such as Skype, Line, and Telegram..These technologies enable her and others like her to connect “live” to their home countries, reflecting the desires of exiles and immigrants for communication with homelands that exist beyond their present times and locations. Her most recent work explores how digital media plays this critical role in the lives of exiles and immigrants, forcing them to navigate two different spaces – the physical and the virtual..Cyrous holds a BA in Visual Art from For Science and Culture University of Tehran, and an MFA in Social Practice from California College of the Arts. She recently received Bangkit Arise international art residency of Asian Art Museum and Clarion Alley Mural Project and performed at North x North Festival at Anchorage Museum..READ REMAINDER OF BIO IN COMMENTS SECTIONS BELOW:

name: 2019-10-13 00.53.52 2153151082793355344_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Carrying on October’s witchcraft and magical theme. Two objects of talismanic purpose, this time from the newly built Islamic galleries in the British Museum. Both of these objects come from Palestine and date to the early 20th century. The first is a necklace that has cobalt blue and white beads used to avert the evil eye, which is a curse unknowingly given from the glare of one who is deeply envious. This necklace would have been worn by a child or mother, as the chunks of alum (salt crystals) were thought to protect children, help stop bleeding and safeguard against fire. The red triangular pendant at the bottom contains folded paper written with protective verses from the Quran, and the small tortoise shell is a good luck charm to ensure a long and happy life. The second object is a baby’s bonnet with more blue beads, some encasing more alum crystals, and another paper of protective verses folded into a triangle. Evil eye talismans are ubiquitous now and, at least in the west, are seen as something one might buy as a tourist in a market in Istanbul. However, the belief in the evil eye is still held in parts of Asia, and the concept of the evil eye has lasted for centuries in both pagan and monotheistic religions, perhaps originating in Ancient Greece. ..........#palestine #evileye #islamichistory #britishmuseum #thebritishmuseum #talisman #handoffatima #palestinian #islamicart #materialculture

text: Jangan mau kalah sama Sir Raffles, beliau banyak sekali koleksi antik Indonesia, yuk mari mencintai budaya kita, dan melestarikan warisan nenek moyang.. 👵🏻👨🏼‍🦳..Rather jealous of the vast collection of Indonesian antiques / Indonesian subjects by Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles...Here on display at the British Museum are Raffles collection of Wayang Topeng, Wayang Krucil Gilig, and Wayang Klitik from Java circa 1700-1824...The portrait of Raffles is by George Francis Joseph. It was taken on the year 1817 in England at the end of Raffles governorship of Java....#raffles #stamfordraffles #thomasstamfordraffles #java #javanese #wayang #wayangklitik #wayangtopeng #antique #indonesianantiques #javaneseantique #britishmuseum #exhibition #london #collectinginsoutheastasia #collector #culture #javaneseantiques

name: 2019-10-13 02.53.44 2153211408073737919_britishmuseum.jpg
text: 🇬🇧ᴛʜᴇ ᴇɪɢʜᴛʜ ᴅᴀʏ 在英國的最後一天，來到最後的景點#大英博物館 開開世界收藏的眼界👀#古埃及 #木乃伊 #摩艾 太多了😆謝謝#onacis Boss為我們邀請導覽解說，真的是好棒👍🏻👍🏻❤️這次的旅程真的好棒，難忘的回憶太多了～😆🥰例如～相機命喪倫敦😭😭😭～跑進去廁所找時，工作人員講英文我都聽不懂一直比手畫腳🥺急哭了我....好顯 @a870308 太會英文了😭😭雖然最終還是沒找回～出門在外真的要很謹慎！沒事沒事的❤️「一切都是最好的安排」❤️學習經驗，回台灣必須學英文，靠翻譯太累了😫出國一趟，當過啞巴後才知道英文的重要🥺這一趟旅行，從不熟到家人相處，感動無比，團隊能契合需要大家的包容與體諒與愛所結合🥰感謝這趟旅程的所有人 @a870308 @emma_unisys @n2ronger @jay80720 @affe.chen @shihui.dai 真的好愛大家❤️❤️💪🏻回國後好好加油，希望每年都能有這樣的學習旅程🥰😘😍😆ɪ ʟᴏᴠᴇ ᴇᴠᴇʀʏʙɪᴅʏ#pei佩 #英國 #倫敦 #britishmuseum

name: 2019-10-13 04.28.17 2153259001394934989_britishmuseum.jpg
text: My new favourite: How nature is depicted in art and culture and philosophies of life..'Three friends of winter' by Ding Yingzong (1735-50)A pine tree is often depicted by bamboo and plum blossom to form the 'three friends of winter' since they could endure the cold wind. This subject matter is a popular symbol of 'flourishing in adverse conditions'.This work is an example of single sheet prints manufactured by the Ding clan in Suzhou, featuring bright colours and poetic descriptions.. #art #lifelessons #life #nature #museum #chineseart #chinese #britishmuseum #collections

name: 2019-10-13 06.39.31 2153325052672757211_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Too popular among everyone in the world to visit constantly for local, which is the #BritishMuseum yet it's just an honoured to visit there again for a while as business meeting for inspection.Looking back, the holiday just before starting the sophomore at college (almost a decade ago!), I've quite often had lunch on weekday inside secretly in some rooms exhibiting Japanese traditional swords or drawings.だれもが知ってる大英博物館にこうして仕事で伺うことになるのはなかなか感慨深い（とはいえ浸る余裕は終るまでもてそうにないけれど）。PR人としてはミジンコだと日々自問自答してるけど、日々、来ては去っていく数多の人に踏まれ見られそれでもドシッと無骨に構える建物に入ると（学生時代の記憶のある場所はとくに）不思議と発してるなにかがあって、ほんと少しだけだけど勇気づけられる。不思議と発してるなにか、というのは一過性や表層的なママゴトが淘汰されていく覚悟みたいなもの。安心と同じくらい漂っている、冷たい現実のようなもの。いつも背中に感じていたいもの。#Holborn #Bloomsbury#GreatRussellStreet

name: 2019-10-13 07.41.13 2153356107947646354_britishmuseum.jpg
text: I molossi nel realismo ellenistico, molte sculture di animali in bronzo di questo periodo ci sono note solo attraverso copie di marmo romane.  I Molossi abitavano nell'antico Epiro ed erano imparentati con il moderno mastino e si narra che erano notoriamente feroci.  Usati sia per guardia agli animali sia per uso domestico a guardia delle proprietà e sicurezza nelle città. Aristofane, nel V secolo, parla dei rischi di tentare di superare una porta sorvegliata da un cane molosso, mentre la leggenda narra che il famigerato statista ateniese e generale Alcibiade ne abbia tenuto uno con una coda ancorata.  Questo cane una volta indossava un colletto.  Le mascelle spalancate mostrano denti potenti, ma la posa rilassata e lo sguardo verso l'alto gli conferiscono un'aria obbediente.  Altre cinque versioni di questa scultura, tutte trovate vicino a Roma, sono ritenute copie romane di un originale in bronzo greco perduto, probabilmente del II secolo a.C.

name: 2019-10-13 09.40.41 2153416238252240758_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Just next to this piece are the 800 year old century Benin Bronzes, looted by the British in the 19th century. A few remain in the museum but most were sold to art houses and museums around Europe. Nigeria has asked for them back and after some hesitation the UK has kindly allowed their restitution but only on a temporary basis which is more than fair. Nigerians are always after something, take take take, honestly chill out....#britishmuseum #london #art #uk #golgo #manga #museums #depowergroup #thebritishmuseum #museum #architect #travel #artcollectors #interiorarchitecture #interiordesigners #artgalleries #contemporary #nigeria  #mouselouvre #exhibition #modernart  #contemporaryartcollectors #africa #africanart #galleries #history #nationalgalleryofmodenart

name: 2019-10-13 12.50.46 2153511906223251088_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Sunset at Sea (c.1906).🎨 Painted by Thomas Moran.Born: 12 February 1837, Bolton, Lancashire, England.Died: 25 August 1926, Santa Barbara, California, United States. (aged 89).🖼 Oil on canvas 76,7 x 102,1 cm..📝 Moran's family came to American in 1844, they made several family members become artists including Peter, Edward and Thomas the youngest. Moran took an apprenticeship as an engraver at Scattergood & Tefler, concentrated on refining his own technique in watercolor, studying under James Hamilton. Hamilton introduced Thomas to the work of J.M.W. Turner, whose painterly style remained a major influence throughout Moran's career. By the mid-1860s, Moran was already exhibiting sophisticated and accomplished paintings.Upon marrying Scottish-born etcher and landscape painter Mary Nimmo, Moran relocated his family to New York where he was hired as an illustrator at Scribner's Monthly. This appointment proved to be significant, as he was soon promoted to the position of chief illustrator, a move that set him on course to become one of the country's most important landscape artists.Thomas Moran's name is closely associated with the creation of Yellowstone National Park. In 1871, the artist was invited by Dr. Ferdinand Hayden, director of the United States Geological Survey, to join his expedition team headed for the Yellowstone region. For 40 days, Moran painted and sketched over 30 different sites in the region, which, in tandem with the remarkable photographs of his expedition colleague, William H, Jackson, proved beyond doubt the true majesty of the area's natural beauty. Their collective work was undeniably instrumental in influencing Congress to elevate and preserve the Yellowstone expanse, making it a national park in 1872.At the conclusion of the Hayden Survey, Moran continued his work both as a landscape artist and commercial illustrator. He entered a successful business relationship with the Santa Fe Railroad, which commissioned him to produce paintings of the Grand Canyon for its own marketing purposes. The paintings were made into magnificent color lithographs which served to introduce tourists to the beauty of the west....

text: Today we meet an old friend in the #britishmuseum. Stele with an inscription in Oscan . About 300-100 BC. Found built into the inner arch of the Nola Gate at #pompeii @pompeiportanolaportasarno The inscription reads, right to left: “Vibius Popidius, son of Vibius, chief magistrate, had charge of this work and and approved it”Pompeii Necropolis Porta Sarno 2019. name: 2019-10-13 16.53.43 2153634191181457103_britishmuseum.jpg
text: About a month ago a group of us went Roman pot hunting on the river Thames. We didn't find a complete one, but the most patient one among us carefully collected over 50 shards, convinced they all came from the same vessel. He was right, it took him three days, but he has pieced together a large, near complete, early Roman (around 100 AD) pot, possibly a storage jar. What an achievement!#Londonmudlark #Mudlark #mudlarking

text: Forepart of a colossal chariot horse from the quadriga (about 350 BC). The four-horse chariot group (quadriga) positioned on the summit of the mausoleum of Halikarnassos (modern Bodrum) was a great feat of engineering. text: This beautiful vase may look like it was made by Arabic hands, when in fact it was made by a Frenchman trying to imitate the Islamic style. It was part of a movement known as Orientalism and forms part of the new Inspired by the East exhibition at The British Museum (read link in bio for my full ⭐⭐⭐⭐ Londonist review). The exhibition runs until 26 January.

name: 2019-10-13 19.11.37 2153703599320868450_britishmuseum.jpg
text: #Klang day 2 - #RoyalKlangHeritageWalk #walking #tour, focusing on Klang the #RoyalTown of #Selangor..Whilst most of us thought Parameswara’s Melaka 600 years ago as the beginning of #Malaysia, Klang actually existed 2,000 years ago with human settlement since prehistoric times. Bronze Age drums, axes and other artefacts have been found here. A bronze bell dating 2nd century BC was also found here and is now in the #BritishMuseum. Also found are iron tools called #TulangMawas (ape bones). Klang was mentioned in 14th century literary works #Nagarakretagama dates to the Majapahit Empire; Klang River was marked and named on the earliest #maritime charts of Admiral #ChengHo on his visits to Malacca 1409-1433. Klang was under the control of the #Malaccan Sultanate in the 15th century. Klang became a producer of #tin. In the 17th century, the #Bugis from #Celebes Island (#Sulawesi) began to settle in the coastal region of #Selangor (including Klang, Linggi and Kuala Selangor). Being among the finest navigators of #SouthEastAsia, excellent traders and great warriors who fought using chain-mail armoury and used warships in sea battles, soon gained political influence becoming feared protectors of the Straits and establishing the Temenggung rule.

name: 2019-10-13 19.30.26 2153713065464624244_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Robert Forster.L'abbiamo visto per caso al British Museum durante una gita a Londra. Tra “Cazzo ma è proprio lui, il detective in The Code con Morgan Freeman e Antonio Banderas“ e "Ma vaffanculo non può essere lui, guarda, è vestito da barbone" durati circa 45 minuti, alla fine, abbiamo deciso di provarci e andare a salutarlo.Abbiamo conosciuto una persona semplice, vestita veramente come se la sua unica mansione fosse quella di andare dalla camera da letto alla cucina in un noioso pomeriggio di Novembre. Intenzionato a comprare un gioiello alla moglie e fissato anche un po' male dai commessi inglesi.Ci ha chiesto da dove venissimo e si è interessato su ciò che facevamo lì, una conversazione piuttosto semplice, ma considerando che stavamo parlando con una persona del genere era tutto un altro discorso.Ci siamo fatti fare una foto e ci ha augurato buona fortuna.Che forte.. Ho conosciuto Robert Forster, ed era proprio come lo descrivono negli articoli che si leggono in giro. Che grande.A modo mio lo ricordo così.Ciao vecchio#portraits #portraitphotography#colour #robertforster #forster #british #britishmuseum #friends #friend #hollywood #actor #actor #incontricasuali

name: 2019-10-13 20.32.09 2153744133085177126_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Канікули майже закінчились!Пишу із поїзда, що прямує із чарівного Уельса назад у Лондон 🎡Але хочу поділитись ще декількома фото...Британський музей на задньому фоні - це одна з найбільший будівель, в яку ми заходили у Лондоні, і вона нереальна!!!😱Вхід Б Е З К О Ш Т О В Н И Й!!!Не знаю, де ще можна знайти такий музей, за 0 грошей!!!Там виставки настільки живі, що потрапляючи в кожну зону, ти ніби опиняєшся в тій країні!!!Це я вам пишу, як абсолютний нелюбитель музеїв, що обходить їх другою стороною☺️Площа музею 92 тис. квадратних метрів і є, звичайно, платні виставки. Але треба потратити добрих 2 години ,щоб обходити всі безкоштовні!😉

name: 2019-10-13 21.06.36 2153761464492561250_britishmuseum.jpg
text: Finding Hamish at the #BritishMuseum. This is the chess set described in #TheWorldOfAllSouls.👇🏼Chess Set (twelfth century) Cadzow Lodge, Scotland Chess set of 78 pieces, carved out of walrus ivory and ebony. Size ranges from 3.5 centimeters to 10.2 centimeters, depending on the piece. Background: Shortly after he first met Diana at Oxford, Matthew visited his best friend, Hamish Osborne, at his hunting lodge in Lanarkshire. He was craving Diana and needed to talk. While circling the subject of Diana, the two played billiards, then chess, on a large, ancient chessboard with carved ivory and ebony pieces that Matthew had given to Hamish. Hamish’s chess set is similar to the famed Lewis chessmen, a set from the twelfth century that was discovered in Scotland in the nineteenth century. Most of the pieces are now at the British Museum in London, with eleven others at the National Museum of Scotland in Edinburgh. The figures look comically glum to the modern eye, but scholars believe their expressions were intended to convey strength and wisdom. When Gallowglass was downsizing, he gave the set to Matthew for safekeeping. Later, when Matthew was looking for a special gift for Hamish’s new house, Gallowglass suggested he give him “that old set of mine that’s gathering dust in the Old Lodge.” Chess Set (twelfth century) Cadzow Lodge, Scotland Chess set of 78 pieces, carved out of walrus ivory and ebony. Size ranges from 3.5 centimeters to 10.2 centimeters, depending on the piece. Background: Shortly after he first met Diana at Oxford, Matthew visited his best friend, Hamish Osborne, at his hunting lodge in Lanarkshire. He was craving Diana and needed to talk. While circling the subject of Diana, the two played billiards, then chess, on a large, ancient chessboard with carved ivory and ebony pieces that Matthew had given to Hamish. Hamish’s chess set is similar to the famed Lewis chessmen, a set from the twelfth century that was discovered in Scotland in the nineteenth century.
